Round 2: Each side can augment their ranks by replacing some of their marines with their support units and specialist infantry. What combinations could bring each side the win? Round 3: Now they have access to their side's respective ground vehicles. Who takes it then? Something tells me this is still a wash in favor of the Warhammer ones but who knows? input: argumenta sobre: Dragon Ball, Dragon Ball Z, and Dragon Ball Super are Banned. This has been a long time coming. The mod team has had a serious discussion about Dragon Ball and its place on the subreddit. This is something that has been brought up multiple times in the past and we've often hesitated on taking action on restricting series from , aside from things that are disruptive or don't promote healthy discussion e.g. memes, politics, etc.. However, time and time again this series has presented a constant problem that, frankly, we are tired of tolerating. With Super now over, there is little discussion left to be had on this matter and the potential of this series. From this day moving forward, we are no longer allowing any posts or comments involving or discussing Dragon Ball, Dragon Ball Z, Dragon Ball Z Abridged, or Dragon Ball Super. This decision was made for the following reasons. Due to Reddit's recent crackdown on child pornography and anything close to it, we can no longer risk the safety of this subreddit given that Dragon Ball has a history of displaying a child's genitalia. With prominent characters such as Beerus and Whis, we cannot condone a pro-alcohol series and any attempts to justify this fall under violation of our "no edgy stuff" rule. Dragon Ball Z is pro-genocide, seen multiple times such as when Nappa wiped out the bug race. Portraying androids as created to perpetuate evil goals is disparaging to those with cybernetic implants, recipients of prosthetics, and the brave men and women who have lost limbs protecting America. Users mentioning characters or feats from any of the series listed above face temporary bans. Repeat offenders will be assigned "shame flairs" that will replace their current flair until such time that the mod team can continue to trust the user's ability to refrain from Dragon Ball posts.
output: I'm fine with you banning Dragon Ball, Dragon ball Z and Dragon Ball Super, but I'll be DAMNED if you take away Dragon Ball Z Abridged! I need to know if HETAP-lusted Vegita can defeat a Spaceys fueled Burter and Jace.

input: argumenta sobre: What is the weakest squad that can reliably beat a squad of Space Marines? What is the weakest, non-Warhammer 40k, squad that can reliably, 6/10 times, beat a squad of Space Marines? Unit composition Round 1: 10 man, Ultramarines tactical squad. 8 will have a Bolter and Bolt pistol, 1 will have a Plasma gun, and the final will have a Heavy weapon. The sergeant has a chainsword as a cqb weapon. Round 2: 10 man, Ultramarines 2nd Company intercessor squad, each coming with a Bolt Rifle and bolt pistol, the Sergeant is equipped with a Bolt Rifle, Power Sword, and Plasma Pistol. Round 3: 10 man, Ultramarins 2nd Company Hellblaster squad, each equipped with a plasma Incinerator and plasma pistol. The sergeant is equipped with the same as his squad. Round 4: A 5 man Ultramarines 1st Company, Sternguard Squad, each space marine has a combi-weapon. 2x combi plasma, 2x combi melta, and 1x heavy bolter. For the enemy, they will carry their usual Loadout, just as each of the space marine squads do. The Battle Location: a 3 block city area. The space marines start at one end, the Enemy starts at another. The enemy must be able to reliably beat the space marines. Who can do it?
output: This may be controversial, but a squad of ghosts from SC2. They're low level psychics that can snipe from 5KM away with 25MMHE rounds that they can psychically guide, with the extreme upper end ones making a nuke like psychic explosion. Their main power beside mind reading and stealth is basic telekinesis. They're quite well trained and constantly re-indoctrinated. Their durability and stats might not be as good as an astartes but they can make up for it in other ways. At most they can reach R3 probably.

input: argumenta sobre: Can Earth without superheroes defeat omniman in 5 years? Lets suppose Omniman cannot fight back, and everyday he comes down to Earth in the same spot, and sits there for 4 hours taking all attacks without evasion or retaliation, then he may leave earth and recover for the next 20 hours before returning the next day. For 5 years. Earth on the other hand, may not use superheroes or superpowered individuals, but anything with normal human + equipment akin to ironman or first iteration zombie androids is fair game, nor can they use the viltrumite virus if they were to have discovered it. Lets suppose also that Robot cannot participate for Earth, since he may make the challenge too easy. Earth can take and analyze samples of omniman's cells. This takes place at the time of just before episode 1 of Season 1 of show invincible. Edit: round 2 if its too easy for Earth, nolan may dodge but must stay confined with the Washington Metropolitan Area Dmv, and can traverse no more than 50 m above ground.
output: Comic book durability is extremely inconsistent. As a matter of fact, in the real world, a nuclear fireball burns at 100 million degrees Celsius, or about four to five times as hot as the center of the sun. Nathan can be hurt via blunt force trauma from a super-powered punch - he is not tanking a nuclear fireball if we apply anything remotely resembling modern physics.

input: argumenta sobre: 10 average sized twelve year old American boys vs 1 average American adult male. So, I got into it with some guys in askreddit and I just want to see what you guys have to say about this. I'm being 100% serious. Specs for our 12 year olds are going to be based off my google results for the average stats for that age, so it's looking like our 10 unsung heroes will be standing at 4'9 and weighing in at a whopping 88 lbs. Let's also say that our 12 year olds aren't necessarily cream of the crop ball players but that they all have experience being forced to play various sports throughout their younger years. No athletic freak future nfl anomalies among them, but they're all decently familiar with physical exertion and there aren't any McLovins out there just waiting to get murked. Since we're talking averages here, let's say none of them have physically fought anyone at this point in their lives, so no real fighting experience. But, assume they've all seen every avengers film, they each have an older brother that's forced them to watch Dragonball Z cell and frieza sagas, and they each saw the second Rush Hour on Tbs when they were children and went through a brief period of pretending they were kung fu practioners as a result. For our beloved average joe I'm gonna take the literal average American male. This means our fearsome apex predator is going to stand 5'9 inches tall and his weight will round out at 196 lbs. At the time of the altercation Joe will be 36 years of age, and despite repeated assurances from his wife that she still finds him attractive, for the past 7 years he's found no success in his desperate attempts to decrease the circumference of his 40 inch waist. According to Joe, he peaked athletically at age 23 after having played intramural soccer for several years while pursuing his bachelors in Business Administration. He also lifted weights in college off and on but was largely inconsistent outside of a few disciplined and motivated 3 month stretches. Although admittedly sporadic, when Joe did weightlift he was always sure to steal his roommates well reviewed protein powder, and would often resort to using the cheap walmart brand powder to replace what had been taken. He was never caught. Sadly, Joe's white collar desk job and soul crushing commute have left him largely sedentary for the past 10 years. Over this time period Joe's physical fitness accomplishments have consisted of signing up for the local annual 5k and subsequently failing to attend, as well as his consistent yearly gym appearances immediately following increasingly desperate, regretful, and overconfident New Year's resolutions. R1: The fight will occur in a gladiator style arena with our combatants starting opposite of one another. Everyone involved is wearing standard athletic gear gym shorts, jogging shoes, t shirt. This is a fight to the death and everyone present is aware of this. The 12 year olds are not necessarily blood lusted but they are committed to the fight and will only stop if incapacitated. All I mean by this is that even though they can't be scared into running away and abandoning the fight by maiming one of them in front of the others, they're still normal 12 year olds and won't be attacking like World War Z zombies with complete wreckless abandon and disregard of their own safety. But like I said, the kids are 100% down for the cause and fully understand the life or death stakes. Neither side is given prep, the situation is revealed just before the fight begins. Who wins R1? Is it a close fight or a curb stomp? R2: Joe is given 4 weeks to prepare mentally and physically for the battle. He is informed that he will fight 10 twelve year olds to the death and is given a photo of the venue but everything else in the prompt remains the same. The children will still enter the arena with no idea of what's to come. Does this change the outcome? R3: The Rock has decided to volunteer as tribute in place of our sweet Average Joe. He is not aware of any info about the fight and will be 100% clueless until the fight begins. The 12 year olds however are given 8 weeks to prepare for the battle but cannot receive outside strategic counseling from anyone other than one of the 10 that will fight. They will know that The Rock is their opponent and they'll be allowed to practice in the arena before the battle. Nothing else changes. Can they smell what The Rock is cooking and live to share the tale with their children's children?
output: You know the prologue scene to Fellowship of the Ring when Sauron shows up with that bat and just wails away 10 dudes at a time? It would be like that

input: argumenta sobre: Agent 47 is Contracted to kill Homelander. He is given a method to execute and a certain amount of prep time. Who wins? I've always played around with the prospect of this potential match-up, but so it isn't so much one sided in either favor, I've elected to set up three scenario's of varying prep time and arsenal. Scenario 1 : Agent 47 is contracted by an anonymous and in this case irrelevant benefactor to assassinate Sister Sage. Having anticipated this, Sister Sage hastily constructs a bargaining chip in the form of a syringe to administer a de-powering serum of similar caliber to Butchers, but with the addition of piercing through any super durable flesh. Either after killing or in exchange for co-operation with Sage, 47 is given the syringe, and is given only a maximum of 5-15 minutes Depending on if they are in the same general location of Homelander or within accessible distance until her death is discovered, or she tips off Homelander, and he goes on the heavy offense. 47 Victory\- Administer the de-powering serum and assassinate Homelander by any other means. Homelander Victory\- Kill Agent 47 without disrupting public image. Scenario 2 : ICA Is contacted shortly after Homelander's deputization and contracted to perform an assassination. They are able to construct a similar piercing device as Sister Sage to be administered by dart or injection, however by the time they pick a date of a press conference at Vought HQ, Approximately 28 days post deputization, word has reached Vought of a possible assassination attempt, but have not acquired a who. At risk of total public meltdown, and ensuing premature? anarchy, Homelander is convinced by the rest of The Seven not to immediately blast any stranger on sight until probable cause can be found. This gives Agent 47 an entry point, but nothing more, as well as a possible weak link for an alternative threat in the ICA as a whole. 47 Victory\- Administer the de-powering serum and assassinate Homelander by any other means. Make a clean enough getaway without exposing the ICA to the greater "Supes" public eye. Homelander Victory\- Kill Agent 47 without disrupting public image. Compromise / Kill relevant ICA associations that would otherwise invalidate or disrupt the initial assassination plan before 47 can retaliate proper. Scenario 3: ICA Is contracted by an incarcerated Stan Edgar upon his dismissal from Vought to intercept and kill Homelander on behalf of concerned Vought scientists on the lower level, In order to prevent a "Wisdom of the Ages" level purging of their top scientists. In that time frame Longer than scenario 2, but less than one year, ICA is given access to databases relevant to their government allegiances, as well as some lower level Vought intel. They are also given time to psychoanalyze and observe Homelander's modus oparandi, to pinpoint a specific moment and location to conduct the take-down. In this scenario, Agent 47 Is armed with EITHER; The Aforementioned Piercing injector, which can also infect fluids or foods. The Aforementioned dart that can be administered discretely by launcher or manual toss ideally at mid range or high altitude to gain speed, or A single hardballer clip's worth of zinc alloy "Screw threaded" Hollow point bullets that allow a delayed injection beyond the upper skin level, but can not be silenced. Vought is not aware of the assassination attempt, unless the location conducted is under their existing tenure IE Vought Tower, shortly after 47's unauthorized arrival. While this gives the best chance of success, it hinges on finding a vital location and correctly getting in position to swiftly dispose of Homelander before retaliation, and depending on the location, Homelander also has less inclination to hold back under public scrutiny. 47 Victory\- Administer the de-powering serum and Kill Homelander by any means. Make a clean enough getaway without exposing the ICA to the greater "Supes" public eye. Homelander Victory\- Kill Agent 47 by any means necessary. So, the best of ICA vs the best of Vought. Who do you think comes out on top and why? I may share my potential takes if traction has it, but I want to keep my own thoughts and possible biases to myself in favor of others.
output: homelander senses him and lazers him from far away, he can also smell and hear him even if he goes very slow

input: argumenta sobre: Every single world leader is assassinated at the exact same time. Can humanity avoid collapsing into war and destruction? Without warning, the leaders of every nation on earth, be they presidents, kings, prime ministers, etc., die from a gunshot wound. The assassins are never discovered. Will the nations of the world be able to recover, or will the ensuing chaos, accusations, and conspiracy theories cause society to collapse?
output: It would definitely generate a lot of conspiracy theories and generate a lot of media attention. But without a clear cause or link to any particular organization I think it would be regarded as the mystery of our time. Governments would no doubt find convenient scapegoats and make efforts to route out 'terrorists' but life would go on. War is always possible but with every leader happening at the same time I would think unlikely.

input: argumenta sobre: All zinc in the universe is transmuted to copper. Can humanity survive? A cosmic being transmutes all the zinc in the universe to copper. No new zinc can be produced by any means. Biological processes that require zinc are modified to no longer require it, but other than that, humanity must make do on its own. Can we survive? How much damage does this change do? R1. No warning. R2. Humanity gets a year of warning.
output: Humanity survives, however it causes a series of catastrophic failures as the chemistry inherent in various pieces of machinery and infrastructure is altered in unsustainable ways, plus a gigantic recession as whole industrial pipelines need to be redesigned.

input: argumenta sobre: A guy is given immortality and gets trapped in the year 1900. Can he become a trillionaire in the 21st century? A 25 year old guy from Florida woke up one day in the year 1900 with no money and gadgets but he's given immortality where he cannot die from natural causes, such as old age or conventional illness, but can be killed by unnatural causes. How can he become a trillionaire in the 21st century?
output: I doubt it. The average Florida man isn't a genius in politics, engineering, socioeconomics, etc. Even if he knows say the A Bomb will be invented, he can't invent it. He might know there's an oil field in the Caribbean somewhere, but how will he position himself and convince people to drill there? His best bet to become a trillionaire would be to accumulate wealth slowly through the first 60 or so years, then dump millions into tech stocks, bitcoin, etc. He could end up with majority shares in Apple, MS, Amazon, Cisco, Lockheed... Honestly I think the biggest issue is being immortal. The IRS and feds would notice a guy who's worth 50 billion but doesn't have a birth certificate and has been around 100 years. He has to plan his fake identity well into the 60s.

input: argumenta sobre: Russia, China, and the US vs everyone else The 3 big superpowers have put aside their differences and are a secret unbreakable alliance. They cannot and will not go against each other. They want to take over the rest of the world. US includes Hawaii and alaska while china includes Taiwan, Russia is Russia. NO NUKES in this war and no stopping until the other side surrenders AFTER fighting, gets their land taken over, or otherwise incapacitated. The current leaders will stay current leaders for the duration of the war. If this swings to US, China and Russias favor: all other countries get notice of the alliance and get 1-2 weeks to prepare.
output: The outcome depends entirely on what you would consider a "win". American technology and logistical capability combined with Chinese industrial output means that this Alliance will curb-stomp in any conventional great power style conflict. The Alliance also automatically has nearly complete control over global trade due to the Sino-American navy being utterly unchallenged in any ocean. This is a serious problem, especially for the EU which is heavily dependent on foreign oil imports. What this boils down to is that the Alliance would destroy the world's conventional militaries within a matter of years but be unable occupy and govern their "conquered" territory effectively. However, a more realistic scenario imo is that the Alliance uses its massive economic leverage to exert de facto control over other world governments without direct conflict, while eviscerating any nations that fail to fall in line with its military might, and using its naval power to prevent other nations from assisting.

input: argumenta sobre: The Bismarck is magically transported back in time to the late 1700s and decides to solo the world's navy at the time... Both sides have unending ammunition and supplies and the global navy at the time is all consolidated together prior to the battle. Can the combined naval forces of the late 1700s win? R1: almost no warning the global navy has just enough time to consolidate their forces before the Bismarck attacks. They start 10km apart. R2: The global navy gets 10 years warning of the impending attack including a photo of the Bismarck but no information on the internal components of the ship.
output: Naval forces underwent one of the most dramatic Revolutions in Military Affairs in all world history when, in the 1860s, France and England both developed the "ironclad" concept. To say the Ironclad made every naval vessel before it obsolete may be an understatement. The ironclad was such fertile ground for rapid technological improvement that a new ironclad built in 1865 would ITSELF become obsolete by a newer ironclad built in 1870. Not ineffective. Not second-rate. Obsolete. In 5 years. This process of uncontrolled advancement continued until the Dreadnaughts appear at the turn of the century, at which point things slowed from a frantic pace to a rapid pace. Three more decades after that the Bismarck left the drydock. The only thing that would stop this hypothetical Bismarck from ruling the entire world in the 1700s would be that it can only be in one place at a time.

output: No. They couldn't even hold their own against normal life. I'd wager they get slaughtered and maybe Arthur pulls a Schwarzenegger, unless he's already too TB riddled Edit: Four Yautja?! No way in hell can the gang pull this off. I'll give you one, maybe.

input: argumenta sobre: Ulysses S. Grant vs. George Washington Each side has an army of 80,000 men Each side has the same weaponry and equipment Flat ground, no high or low ground to speak of Who is the better war strategist?
output: There are few people on here that admire George Washington more than I do. He was one of the great statesmen ever, and the US as we know it would not exist without him. He was a great, great man. He was, however, a lackluster general at best. He got the job as Continental Army commander based on his brief service with Braddock's failed expedition agains the French years earlier. But there really wasn't anyone else besides the insufferable Horatio Gates considered by the Continental Congress. Washington spent most of his time during the war being outmaneuvered and outfought by mediocre British generals. His greatest military accomplishments were: The retreat from Brooklyn Heights only necessary because he bungled the siege of New York The Battle of Trenton hardly a traditional battle, but one for which he deserves full credit The Battle of Yorktown and the campaign leading up to it, which were largely driven by French commanders and siegecraft. There were two things he did that nobody else could have, or would have done: Held together a starving, freezing, unpaid, poorly equipped army in the faced of the world's greatest military power by sheer force of will and courageous example At the height of his power and popularity, he handed in his commission to civilian authorities and stepped down from his army post, when with a word he could have been king of the new nation. That being said, Grant actually had military training and had worked his way up from being a junior officer to division commander, to overall command of Union forces. Not only did he fight and win many more battles than Washington, he handled forces the size of those mentioned in the prompt. Grant, easily 10/10

input: argumenta sobre: The Rapture happens and God, surprisingly, takes all of humanity. He takes pity on captive animals and gives them safe passage to freedom. For anyone asking for more details, if the animals can't immediately escape their enclosure Think all the ocean life living at Sea World in San Antonio God blips them to the nearest body of water that will allow them to live and give them a decent chance of not starving to death. And in the case of birds if their feathers are clipped he regrows them so they can fly. God also works his god power to keep nuclear power plants from melting down or really any left over human production from blowing up in their face so it's really just animals safely inhabiting our leftovers without us royally screwing them over one last time.

input: argumenta sobre: Who is the strongest character when only allowed to use their iconic item? The loop breaks when the loopee bears no ill will or disrespect for anyone, genuine goodwill towards everyone, and is at total peace with their actions during the day. There's no cheating and "pretending" to be good to get out. You also don't get a freebie for just not being aware that your actions are insane, even if you personally think there's nothing wrong. input: argumenta sobre: What is the least advanced technology that would have the biggest impact if delivered to Julius Caesar? One piece of technology, is delivered to Julius Caesar on the day he becomes emperor of Rome. It can be anything that has been invented as of 2024, but only one will be sent. If the item requires electricity, a small hand powered generator is sent with it. The generator may not necessarily be enough to power the device if it requires a lot of power however. What is the least advanced item that could provide the biggest impact on history? I think it would be something that is simple enough that Romans would understand it fairly quickly, but the concepts are something that humans won't discover for a long time. For example, a microscope would be understood as lenses already existed, but it would provide knowledge of micro-organisms that nobody would otherwise even conceive of for centuries. This revelation would launch medicine ahead far beyond what developed in history since people will figure out bacteria far sooner. Another one I had in mind is the telegraph, which would be fairly quickly understood as a means of transmitting a message through a wire. It's a simple concept, the only barrier is electricity.
output: A couple potato seeds. Not even GMO potatoes, just modern cultivars that benefit from centuries of selective breeding. Or even wilder, more "natural" variants if that'd count as less advanced. If potatoes can proliferate in the Old World 1550 years ahead of schedule it'll trigger a population boom and very quickly send world history way off course.

input: argumenta sobre: All 5 of America's major sports leagues go to war; which one wins? America's 5 major sports leagues NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, and MLS are going to war, each armed with all the gear and equipment they use in a given game balls, protective gear, bats, sticks, etc. The following battles all take place in a massive, perfectly flat field, with the armies in a circle 1000 feet away from each other. Round 1: Each league fights with however many players they have. Round 2: Each league is limited to just 100 players. Round 3: Same as round 2, except they're stripped of all equipment and have to fight hand to hand.
output: Interesting prompt. Hmm... Well the NBA and MLS both get completely slaughtered. They are quick, sure, and in great cardiovascular health, but they have virtually no combat relevant equipment. More importantly, they're too lean. Hockey and American Football players outclass them in size and strength by a \considerable\ margin, even if they weren't already using their gear. MLB fares decently well but cannot win. Bats and helmets are useful, and most players have mean swinging arms...but that's about it. Despite a baseline level of cardiovascular health, and very specifically developed swing and pitch related muscles a lot of pro baseball players are honestly pretty out of shape compared to their peers. They cannot run as far or oftentimes as fast, they carry a higher percentage of body fat considerably so, in some cases, and tend to be older; the sport is less physically taxing, and players often continue into their 40's while many NHL and NFL players call it quits as early as 30. It comes down to the NFL and NHL. If players are forced to wear and use all equipment, NHL obviously loses because it is very difficult to walk in ice skates. If its voluntary...I'd still give it to the NFL but only 6/10. They have excellent gear, applicable strategies, and massive, muscular frames. Many of them are on PEDs as well. They lack any melee weapons like the NHL, but they're so large, and so well practiced in tackling and pummeling opponents in an organized fashion that they can pull out a win more times than not without said weapons. More importantly, they have strong enough gear to weather a few bats and sticks to the face.

One day later, a single Playstation 2 and TV with appropriate input jacks appears at Soviet Space Command. Round 1: Can the soviets do anything with the PS2 to beat NASA to the moon? Round 2: It also comes with the software and hardware needed to run a retail copy of Linux for PS2 Linux is already installed and configured on the PS2. A single index card is included explaining how to access the man pages. Round 3: Same as two, but copies of Linux for Dummies, Computer Engineering for Dummies, and C Programming for Dummies are included. The reason for this prompt is that I remember reading different articles about export restrictions on the PS2 when it came out, because it was considered military grade technology. Here's a China example and here's one on general export controls from Japan
output: I think this question is less about the technological advantages it can bring and more about how big a clusterfuck of lies, fear and deceit flew around the USSR. In other words, would they actually make use of its full potential? I've got a feeling things would go sideways fast. I worked on dreamcast release titles and remember being told the same thing about export laws of the PS2.

input: argumenta sobre: Can a united 15th-century Europe produce a single modern ball-point pen? Was looking at my 50-cent ball-point pen and admiring how perfectly the machined steel ball fits into its tiny socket so here we go. All of 15th-century Europe is given the task of producing a single modern ball-point pen within 50 years or face annihilation by a magic force. The same magic force unites them, preventing all combat or conflict. They do not need to produce the same kind of ink. Can they do it? Round 1: They're given all the industry schematics for producing a ball-point pen but nothing else. Edit: Given how easily they can clear Round 1, I'm changing Round 2 from 1 pen to 1 million pens. Round 2: They're given all the industry knowledge, schematics, etc. for each step of the supply chain involved in producing a ball-point pen starting from raw materials. Meaning the materials and plans for all the machinery ever involved in the process. Basically, they have all the knowledge on how to build a 21st-century factory and its supply chains. However, they must produce 1 million pens in 50 years. Picked a million because from what I can google, the annual output of a small factory is in the millions of pens. They're a united continent with 50 years. Hopefully, it's fair. Bonus: If not, when is the earliest time a united Europe could accomplish it?
output: Absolutely. It's not even particularly hard. Like, they probably can't mass produce them, and it would absolutely be a hassle to use the damn thing because of the whole ink thing, but the only even moderately difficult part of the whole process is making a small metal sphere for the tip and you can do that with the shot tower method. Admittedly that method hadn't been invented yet during the prompt, but ball bearings existed at the time examples of them are in Leonardo da Vinci's notebooks so they clearly know how to make metal spheres. The only challenge is making them smaller. Once you've got the sphere all that's left is making a custom metal pen body and that's easy. --- Unless of course you're requiring it to be a modern disposable ballpoint pen, in which case it's impossible. They can't invent plastic in fifty years.

input: argumenta sobre: John Wick and Agent 47 are both contracted to assassinate Frank Castle 616. Who gets to him first and who succeeds? The High Table and the ICA have both put out a $15 million contract on Frank Castle AKA The Punisher, who's been killing every other operative they send his way. As a result both agencies decide to send their top assassins after him at the same time. Who's more likely to complete their mission? Each character has full access to their weaponry from the comics Punisher and the movies/video games Wick/47. - R1: Frank is unaware of either Wick or 47 being on his trail. - R2: Frank IS aware of both and has gathered some intel on them with Micro's help. - BONUS ROUND: Wick and 47 realize they're both after the same target and must kill the other in order to continue the mission. Who wins?
output: I'm pretty sure 47 takes every round. The only way Wick is really good at killing is in a direct confrontation. Sure, there was that one scene in the first film where he used a sniper rifle, but most of the time it's much more up close and personal. 47, on the other hand, gets much more creative with his kills. Poison, sabotage, and stealth are his bread and butter. Many of his assassinations are assumed to be freak accidents with how good he is- nobody knowing he was even there. Wick is a killer, while 47 is an assassin. Frank has a MUCH better chance of surviving R2, probably going off the grid. However, the ICA has access to live feed from satellites. Even if Punisher goes underground, a last known location goes a long way. He'd essentially have to be isolated in an underground bunker for as long as the contract is active. For the bonus round, 47 easily finds Wick before Wick finds him. Much greater stealth and a master of disguise, while Wick was able to be found by pretty much everyone that went looking for him. 47 knocks out Baba Yaga with a cupcake, steals his clothes, and snaps his neck.

input: argumenta sobre: Featured Characte Sign-Ups for July - September 2025 What is this? Every week our subreddit features a character,wikifeaturedcharacter and every two weeks we feature a team.wikifeaturedteam These posts are written by users for characters and teams they feel deserve more love on the subreddit. They serve as something like a shorter respect thread, with the goal of introducing people to the character or team in question. So if you go to one and say "Doesn't this belong on ?", expect to be mocked! For those who had no idea that this subreddit has Featured Characters, swipe right on the mobile front page, and be amazed. How to Sign Up This post will be for sign-ups for the July through September session and will stay up for around a week. Therefore, Sign-Ups close at 11:59 PM EST, Sunday, June 15th, give or take. Now, how do you sign up? Easy. Just post here, listing either the character or team you're planning. Then, at any point, before signups close, send us a Proof of Concept through modmail A Proof of Concept can be anything from a draft of the thread, to an already done Respect Thread, to an Imgur album of feats, so long as we know that you have something ready. If you don't have an acceptable draft ready within one week of your submission's scheduled date, we will choose a backup in its place. After everything is set, you can look forward to the Season Schedule a little later once we've finalized everything. What's a Featured Characte? How do I do these things? Easy! If you're familiar with the concept of , then you'll be able to understand this stuff. A Feature is basically a reasonably sized post summarizing the character or team, who they are and what they can do, including things like feats, allies, etc. etc. etc. in the case of teams, having small sections for each member of the team. Maybe throw in some recommended reading while you're at it. Need a helping hand on how to set up the formatting? Check out our template guidewikitemplate or just ask us for some tips. Feature Rules and Guidelines For a Featured Character post, we are looking for posts that have a reasonable, easily digestible number of feats. We're basically looking for briefer posts that get to the nitty-gritty of what a character can do rather than a full respect thread. Tell us who the character is, their most notable feats, and how they can be used on WWW. Team posts will have looser restrictions on this, but we're still looking for them to be easily consumable. Characters and Teams that have been featured in the past will not be accepted, excepting special circumstances such as being an alternate version of the character, or something. Characters or Teams that are in poor taste will not be considered. And we reserve the right to, for any reason, turn one down though we never really exercise this. We will prioritize submissions that have a Proof of Concept that is closer to completion and higher quality. What this means is we will put someone who has a final draft of their Proof of Concept earlier in the schedule than someone who has an incomplete draft or is just submitting a respect thread. If you want to increase your chances of making the cut, submit a final or nearly final draft of your Feature. Be aware that the team deciding this will have the final say in what is accepted and if we feel your submission is either incomplete or misleading of a character or team we reserve the right to refuse to put it on the schedule as a result. Don't complain if your Character or Team doesn't get picked. There's always next time. In addition to the rules, we have a few guidelines and/or suggestions for your submissions! Generally, we aim to show off more obscure characters, but that's not necessarily a prerequisite nor will someone 'popular' being submitted automatically veto a submission. Go for variety! Notice a lot of Marvel characters, or think more video game teams should be represented? Here's your chance to fix that! We want a lot of fun characters and teams to show off! Further, if you are submitting a draft for a character, if you use someone else's Respect Thread for your proposal, you must submit documentation that you obtained the permission of the Thread's author beforehand. We will be following up on this, and if your draft is wholly another person's RT, your submission will likely not be favorably viewed. Want some examples? Check out our Featured Archive or look at these example submissions, Tomura Shigaraki and Homelander for Featured Characters, and Ash's Champion Team or The New Avengers for Featured Teams, which are excellent displays of what we're looking for. If your submission includes NSFW material specifically nudity or other sexual material, please let the mod team know when you submit your proof of concept and mark the specific feats that are NSFW in your post. TL;DR Put effort into your draft. Bring something new to the table. Tell us if your post is NSFW. Backups In the event of someone not posting their feature on their scheduled date, the modteam will step in and supply an entry for that date. This is to encourage submissions to be of the highest possible quality as well as reward a quick response time. The following dates will be available to post your Features: Featured Characters July July 2 July 9 July 16 July 23 July 30 August August 6 August 13 August 20 August 27 September September 3 September 10 September 17 September 24 Featured Teams The number of team slots may vary depending on the number of submissions received. July July 5 July 19 August August 2 August 16 August 30 September September 13 September 27
output: I'd like to do a featured character for Marvin the Martian Looney Tunes or a Featured Team for the Stellaron Hunters Honkai: Star Rail. Preferrably later in the schedule for both if possible

input: argumenta sobre: "You cannot invade mainland United States. There would be a rifle behind every blade of grass." - General Isoroku Yamamoto. They are brutally stalled at cities and towns by the high ratio of gun owning Texan Citizens, numbering 26 million overall, who have modern firearms and require no more than a few minutes prep; the Galveston-Centered Hurricane prevents Naval Bombardment, Texas National Guard is ready within two hours tops to provide Aerial Superiority and coordinated action as a standing army or battalion. They've already lost the tech advantage; and they certainly don't have either the numbers or the experience in a dry climate. input: argumenta sobre: Most evil character that could lift Mjolnir? Being worthy of Mjolnir does not include being good natured, however, some of the qualities prevent most evil characters from lifting it. That being said, what is the most evil character that would be considered worthy of lifting Mjolnir?
output: So, the thing with Mjolnir is that it's not very clear what its standards are. We know Captain America can lift it but Superman ordinarily cannot. In JLA/Avengers Odin had to specifically disable to enchantment so Superman could use it in an emergency. So the conditions to look for are the qualities that distinguish Cap from Superman. It sounds like "worthiness" then probably has something to do with Norse values surrounding a warrior's spirit. Clark Kent is a farm boy at heart and really just wants to be a regular dude if given the choice. Steve Rogers meanwhile desperately wanted to fight in World War II in spite of his physical limits at the time. So whoever lifts it has to have some kind of soldier-like quality. But there's clearly a selfless element to it as well. Cap isn't a glory-seeker. He's not interested in fighting for himself. He just doesn't like bullies. It's not easy to find someone evil who is also a selfless warrior. You can find people who think that's what they are but those kind of people are straight up psycho. That's Claude Frollo "I'm doing this for your own good" shit. It'd have to be someone who does bad things but genuinely will fight on behalf of someone weaker when push comes to shove. So the names springing to mind are maybe Poison Ivy and Harley Quinn? There's also Ghaleon from Lunar who's the first game's main villain and by the second game checks all the boxes.

input: argumenta sobre: Starlight Glimmer My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic Vs. Amon Avatar: The Legend Of Korra Amon, the leader of the Equalist anti-bender revolutionary group, arrives in the magical land of Equestria to spread the influence of his goal to make benders and non-benders equals among each other after removing bending from the world. While traveling through the land, Amon takes notice of a small, mysterious village in the middle of nowhere, with ponies having strange, perpetual smiles on their faces, and equal signs on their flanks. Amon, curious about this strange place, walks towards the village to enter it, and comes across the village leader, the unicorn known as Starlight Glimmer, who takes notice of this stranger, and trots up to Amon and asks him what brings him to their home. Amon asks Starlight if she's the leader here, and Starlight says yes. Amon, sensing something wrong about Starlight, asks how exactly she was able to make these ponies in this town equal, and live in this "utopia", with Starlight saying that she used the "Staff Of Sameness" to rid everypony of their cutie-marks to spread equality across the land, and ensure that nopony will have to experience abandonment because of their special talents, and by removing them, true friendship will be preserved. Amon, not believing this, tells Starlight that she is removing everypony's individuality by getting rid of their special talents, and that she must be using her own form of bending to do so, and he's afraid that is something he can't allow to happen. Starlight, shocked that Amon has seen through her facade, angrily calls him out, telling him that she's saving these ponies from feeling abandoned by doing this, and if he's going to stand in the way of that, then she has no choice but to eliminate him. Amon laughs, telling Starlight that she's welcome to try, beginning the battle between the two equalists. The fight takes place in Our Town, Equestria at noon. Starlight is in her pre-redemption mindset, and has access to her magical abilities. Starlight cannot use Starswirl The Bearded's time travel spell here. Amon has access to his hand-to-hand combat, bloodbending, waterbending, and paralysis. Who wins?
output: Amon Avatar: TLOK - Respect Amon The Legend of Korra Equestria My Little Pony - Respect Equestria MLP:FiM Starlight Glimmer My Little Pony - Respect Starlight Glimmer MLP:FiM ^I am a bot ^| ^About ^| ^Code ^| ^Opt-out ^| ^Missing or wrong characters? Reply explaining the issue

input: argumenta sobre: Tony Stark crashes onto Tatooine, his armor destroyed, and in the middle of the Desert, how long until he takes down the Empire? Lets say after Avengers 1, instead of falling back to Earth in the portal, he lands in a Desert, Tatooine. His armor breaks his fall, but is not functional as a result. He's not too far from civilization. Lets say it's a year after the Empire has risen What does he do? How long until he takes down the Empire? Assume he knows nothing about the universe he inhabits, and has to learn their science from scratch. Round 1: MCU Tony Stark Armor non functional Round 2: 616 Tony, armor non functional Round 3: Same scenario, destroyed armor, but with 616 Victor Von Doom Winning conditions: Kill/Stop/Neutralize the Emperor
output: As long as he makes it past the raiders to a spaceport he has all the time in the world to figure out how to just neutralize the emperor. No one's hunting him. Why is everyone saying he just dies lmao. There's a pretty obvious path of him gathering intel, scrapping his way to a basic set of mandatorian or old trooper armor and going from there. I'm not a huge marvel fan or anything but this seems extremely doable. He can go stealth and blow up a shuttle with the emperor on it. He could use his intelligence/contract work to disrupt the emperor's hold. Most people will know way more than myself regarding feats but everyone's assuming he's going to get instantly murdered by sand people while he's close to civilization or hit by an orbital bombardment from an empire who has no idea who he is.

input: argumenta sobre: "Zombie" apocalypse but it's dogs and cats Instead of ppl turning into dumbass corpses, infected ppl turn into dogs and cats all different types, including animals like wolves and lions. The dogs and cats will not turn on each other like actual zombies. Dogs and cats will act like their animal self other than mindlessly pursuing humans. If a dog infects, victim turns into a canine and if a cat infects, they turn into a cat. Infection is via bite, scratch or excessive licking. Current dogs and cats will spread transmission and are now "zombies" but tbf, they won't spread transmission until 72 hours after initial attacks. Patients zero is a cute puppy in NYC in Central Park at peak times and another in Beijing as a stray cat during peak times. Ppl turn within 10 mins from bites or scratches, but excessive licking can take 24 hours provided the dog/cat saliva does enter the body and just stays on the skin. Does humanity survive? Bonus: humans that turn into cats and dogs still have their human brain/mindset. They can choose to side with humans by not "infecting" others. They can also now speak their native language. All current/wild dogs and cats will still be animals and try and turn humans. Edit: the cats and dogs are NOT zombies. They're normal cats and dogs. They act like their normal animal self. That's why licking is a way of transmission because a dog or cat can be affectionate that way
output: The animals all starve long before they completely saturate rural areas. Cities might be a different story, but all zombie apocalypses are like that.

input: argumenta sobre: Strongest character who, if time-travelled to the beginning of their series, could NOT stop the plot from happening. As the title says, which character at the end of their series could not, if sent to the inciting incident before it ever occurred, would be completely unable to stop it from ever occurring. They have a full decade of time to plan, scheme, or do whatever they want to stop it. They are fully committed to averting whatever threat they dealt with in the original timeline. Despite this, which character would be completely unable to succeed?
output: This is pretty much the plot setup for Doraemon. The gist of it is that the series protagonist, Nobita Nobi, was such an incompetent loser that his great-grandchild goes "let's send this futuristic robot cat with reality-warping gadgets back in time so his life ends up better". Despite its title character having access to among many others instant light-year-distance travel, a phone box that can alter reality based on a "what-if"-type question, an IRL delete button that can retcon any living thing, the ability to make voodoo dolls of anyone on the fly, and multiple methods of travelling to any point in time, none of this seems to have any effect on Nobita's life long-term. As an aside: I've been wanting to make a Respect thread for the character for the longest time, but it's proven to be a herculean task given the sheer scale of the franchise.

input: argumenta sobre: Who is the strongest character Steve from Minecraft can beat without inventory feats? Whenever people bring up Steve on this subreddit, they always say how he is absurdly powerful due to his inventory being a black hole. Well, that doesn't make for a very interesting fight, so in this battle we are going to assume Steve has a magic satchel that makes anything aside from what he is currently holding in his hands and wearing on his body weigh nothing. Hardcore mode is enabled so Steve can starve and won't respawn. Minecraft version is 1.13. Round One; Early Game Gear: -Iron Armor -Iron Sword -Iron Pick -Stone Axe -Stone Shovel -A Stack of Torches -Half Stack of Pork Chops -A Stack of Cobblestone Round Two; Mid Game Gear: -Diamond Armor -Diamond Sword -Diamond Pick -Iron Axe -Iron Shovel -Shield -Bow enchanted with Infinity + an arrow -A stack of Pork Chops -A stack of Torches -Two potions of your choice -A stack of Cobblestone -A bucket of lava and a bucket of water -A Horse with average stats OR a couple of Wolves Round Three; End Game Gear: Basically whatever can fit in your inventory that can be obtained without hacking. From Ender Pearls to Totems of undying. You can expand your inventory with ender chests and shulker boxes, but you must explain how Steve would access the items mid-battle without being killed. For example, if the opponent is tanky but slow, you could say Steve teleports 50 meters away with an ender pearl whenever he needs to restock Bonus Round: Steve cannot directly engage in combat with his enemy but instead must defeat them with some sort of contraption. He has 24 hours to build.
output: I never got people bragging about Steve's inventory feat. Lots of characters have very large amounts of inventory space. Of course there's some kind of magical black whole they can carry stuff around in, it's for gameplay. No one ever mentions it, it's hard to even assume it's canon.

Round 2: Since he has a lot of experience with his own equipment, he could work fast. 9/10 Bonus: Handy Mandy doesn't have a bunch of talking trucks helping, so it would probably take him 4-10 months.

input: argumenta sobre: Theodore Roosevelt vs the 43 Remaining Presidents in a "The Most Dangerous Game" Scenario Theodore Roosevelt has tired of hunting mere beasts, and so has acquired a residence on Ship-Trap Island in order to pursue a more worthy sort of prey. The other 43 POTUS's, past and present, are pulled through time to serve as his quarry. Each president including Roosevelt is at their peak during their tenure. The following scenarios then unfold: Round 1 Each of the 43 is released individually upon the island, and must survive for 3 days while they are hunted by Roosevelt. They are given a 3-hour head start. 1a Roosevelt is given a team of 3 hunting dogs. 1b No dogs Who survives? Round 2 The hunted Presidents are released in small groups, which are as follows: 1. Washington, Adams, and Jefferson 2. Madison, Monroe, and John Quincy Adams 3. Jackson, Van Buren, and Harrison 4. Tyler, Polk, and Taylor 5. Filmore, Pierce, and Buchanan 6. Lincoln, Johnson, and Grant 7. Hayes, Garfield, and Arthur 8. Cleveland, Harrison, and McKinley 9. Taft, Wilson, and Harding 10. Coolidge, Hoover, and FDR 11. Truman, Eisenhower, and Kennedy 12. Johnson, Nixon, and Ford 13. Ford, Carter, and Reagan 14. Bush 41, Clinton, and Bush 43 15. Obama, Trump, and...Washington... At least one team member must survive for the three days for the hunted to win. They are given a 3-hour head start. Teddy has dogs. Who survives? 3 All of the hunted Presidents are released at the same time. No head start. Teddy has dogs. Who survives? Equipment and such: Roosevelt is equipped with the best hunting gea and such that would have been available in his time. input: argumenta sobre: The Glue Gorilla has finally had enough...... The Gorilla from Gorilla Glue commercials has finally had enough of people not buying gorilla glue, how many CEOs of rival glue producing companies can he kill before people can catch on? He has shown the ability to: Teleport to a location as long as someone nearby has broken something Complete silence until he's in view summon gorilla glue from seemingly out of nowhere If I forgot any new abilities seen from new commercials please add on to the comments Assuming he has all the capabilities of a normal gorilla, and doesn't have blood made entirely out of gorilla glue, how many CEOs can he kill before he is stopped? Bonus round: Every time something is broken it spawns one new gorilla, what happens to the world?
output: For the first few months, the series of tragic deaths was simply a set of coincidences. The CEOs of Flex Seal, Loctite, and Scotch had their homes broken into and were terribly mauled by what appeared to be a wild animal, but oddly enough nothing was stolen. When the CEO of Weldwood went down, things started smelling sticky. Some of the top names in glue were murdered, and the international glue supporters were getting nervous. Who was next? Was this glue serial killer going to slay every producer of glue in the world? Horses everywhere felt a sense of hope for the first time in centuries. The new CEO of Scotch began investigating. What was the similarities between the killings? She began searching through their pasts, illegal dealings, financial rivals, anything that could give a clue to who had adhered themselves to this wicked gluesade. Eventually she came to a dead end and dropped the search. Two months later, the International Glue Convention found all of the CEOs of the glue world seated around a large table. Super Glue was heading the meeting, and began with a moment of silence for their fallen comrades. Scotch looked around the silent room, and noted that Gorilla Glue seemed to be missing. Oddly enough, they had been silent about the glue murders since the beginning. Once the meeting officially began, the CEOs began discussing whether or not the CEO of Michaels deserved to be there. Huntsman CEO was taking notes. He put a bit too much pressure on his pencil, a No. 3 graphite pencil. It snapped in half. What followed was a blur of motion. His head flew from his body and landed in front of the H.B Fuller CEO, who screamed in terror. The hulking beast began mauling and tearing at the weak, helpless humans, who could do naught but scream and flee. The new Scotch CEO was grabbed by Super Glue. "Come quick I know an exit! Quickly!" They dashed down the stairs, with roaring and grunting close behind them. "I've been preparing for this." Super Glue led her into a secret room behind his office, and sealed the massive iron door. "This room is impenetrable. The walls and door are 8 inches of solid iron, and everything in here is virtually unbreakable. What came after us is Gorilla Glue, the same beast that slayed our friends and your predecessor. It goes after anything that is broken, and is intent on killing every last one of us." "I knew it had to be something like that, I should've assumed it was Gorilla Glue." "We'll be safe here. We can stay for up to three months with these rations." And so the two lived like that. They were careful never to break a nail on a door jamb, never to break a container, never to rip or tear the bed sheets. Eventually, with no one else to turn to, they began to fall in love. They enjoyed each other's company, even though it was the only company they had, and actually became content with the life they had. Two months in, Super Glue made a confession. He had a wife and kids back home. "How could you do this to me!? Am I just your affair? Is that why you locked us up in here? Super glue... "You're breaking my heart." The realization of what she said came to her eyes which filled with terror. The last thing either of them saw, was a pair of meaty, glue filled paws.
