input: argumenta sobre: When Sokka and Katara broke open the ice of the South Pole, instead of Aang they find a man with a star-spangled outfit and a red white and blue shield. Could Captain America take down the Firelord before the arrival of Sozin's Comet? As Katara is lashing out at her brother's attitude, she unknowingly causes a massive rift to break in the ice and reveals the submerged wreckage of a strange metal craft unlike anything the two have ever seen. As they venture downwards to explore the metal husk they find buried beneath the snow a red, white, and blue shield made of the strongest metal they've ever known. Sokka excitedly goes to dig it up with his club when Katara notices another strange feature in the ice... a man frozen in time. Against Sokka's advice she melts the ice around the man's body and, to their surprise, he begins to breathe. The man introduces himself as Steve Rogers, a super soldier from a country that doesn't exist who brought an end to the greatest war of his time. The three become friends and make their journey back to the Southern Water Tribe where it's revealed Katara is the last waterbender in the South Pole while Sokka is the oldest male in his village as the rest have gone off to fight in the war. Heartbroken by the existence of another global conflict, Steve meets the two's grandmother who senses that the power Steve possesses, both in body and heart, is exactly what could help win the Hundred Years War. And if it's really true he brought an end to the greatest conflict of his time, perhaps he could stop the greatest conflict of theirs. Unable to turn down a call to help, Steve accepts this mission and asks where the rest of the village's men went. Not wanting to abandon their new friend or miss the chance to see their dad, Sokka and Katara insist they go too, and the three board a boat and set off to find the rest of the water tribe's forces. Now only one question remains: Can Captain America take down Firelord Ozai before the arrival of Sozin's Comet? THE CHALLENGE When Steve went into the ice in '45, he could have never imagined this would be the world he'd wake up in. Not only has he lost everyone he knew, but even the country he stands for no longer exists. But although he now lives in a world with elemental powers, he's still Captain America. His leadership skills are unmatched and he's still far tougher and stronger than the average soldier. Whether it takes an army or just a few close allies, Cap's going to be determined to do whatever it takes to stop the Hundred Years War. Seeing how there was no beam of light to alert of the Avatar's return, Zuko and the rest of the world would have no reason to suspect the gang as a threat for the time being. With the right help, Steve might be able to use the technology in the downed aircraft to help aid his advancement should he acquire the help of someone like the Mechanist Then again, so could the Fire Nation if they discover the wreckage. BONUS CHALLENGE The same time Cap is broken free of the ice, Zuko's ship comes across a strange glowing blue cube in the icy waters of the South Pole. As it's pulled onto the vessel Zuko senses the immense power that is held within it and soon enough finds out about it's capabilities. With the power of the Tesseract, Zuko poses far more of a threat to the gang and anyone else envious of his power. Ozai especially may have something to say about it. Just how differently might things turn out? Alternatively...
output: I think the gang would have a fairly good change cause Zuko would give zero shits about them if they didn't have the Avatar. No one would even see them as a threat until they finally choose to attack. By then they would probably have some sorta plan together. Zuko might try to fight them if he gets some ways-to-regain-honor-creatively skills but other wise I think he'd mostly ignore it. Maybe he'd be forced to come to some sort of 'oh-shit-wars-bad moment of his own though. Gang would probably need to do a lot more recruitment stuff cause Cap isn't as OP as Aang but he'd probably have some good knowledge and strategic stuff they could use. Plus his shield would be helpful

input: argumenta sobre: How the Hell can the cast of the Simpsons get their show cancelled in one episode? The entire cast of The Simpsons becomes aware that they're in a show and is determined to get it cancelled. They have one episode to do this, during which they are in control of their own actions, in-setting. However, they cannot simply do whatever they want in this episode - after it's done being "produced", a bored executive from the real-world network will look over it. They are not aware that the Simpsons are real or sentient, unaware that this episode is being sabotaged, etc - they think it's just a normal cartoon episode that they need to do a quick check for problems in. If they see anything obviously, glaringly wrong to the point where it can't be shown on TV, the episode will be skipped and the Simpsons lose. In short, the episode needs to look, at first glance, like a reasonable episode of the modern Simpsons, but have something so terribly wrong with it under the surface that it will get the entire series permanently canceled after it airs, all on its own. Is there anything they could do to accomplish this? If they're unable to do so, could they do it if the episode went straight to TV, with no review process? If they fail, after one episode everything will be reset and they'll forget they're in a show, forever. Nothing that happens in the episode is guaranteed to stick - eg. if they all die, the next episode can just treat it like a gag and have them be alive.
output: Juat put porn in the background of one scene. Like that Rescuers movie. Or that Maya the Bee show. If they're subtle enough with it, the reviewer probably won't notice, but once it's out there in front of millions of people, someone will spot it for sure. That, or bring back Apu.

Obviously, a nuke dropped on him from out of nowhere will do the trick, but what else could say, 5 average Stormtroopers / Rebel soldiers do to defeat Vader while his back is turned? His pre-recognition and durability are a huge obstacle. Could, say, running him over with a speeder at full speed be enough? What's the easiest way to kill Vader within a second of acting?
output: Don't shoot Vader. Shoot the window and blow him out into space.

input: argumenta sobre: Could Captain Jack Sparrow with his Pirate Ship and Crew survive each session of Game Of Thrones? Jack Sparrow has: The Black Pearl supernaturally fast, can sail even against the wind. His usual crew: Gibbs, Cotton, Pintel, Ragetti, etc. Pistols, swords, cannons, rum, and plot armor. His classic Sparrow instincts: cunning, deception, improvisation, extreme luck. No Davy Jones powers!
output: Unless he finds himself on the wrong side of a dragon, it's unlikely he will die. His ship and weapon are hundreds of years more advanced than anything in GOT, and at absolute worst he can outrun basically any enemy besides dragons.

input: argumenta sobre: In 20,000 BC all apes become as intelligent as humans. Who dominates? In 20,000 BC all apes gain human intelligence. Which apehumans included species can become the dominant species? Due to handwaving, all apes can do everything they can in the planet of the apes reboots.
output: In my opinion, humans have 3 "superpowers" that defined them as the dominant species. One of them is intelligence, yes. But the other two are superior endurance and the ability to throw. Humans can run for several kilometers or work all day, while apes get tired much quicker. Humans can also throw stones or spears - apes can throw too, but with much less force and precision basically useless for hunting/combat. To add to that, humans still have superior dexterity, especially in the fingers. Do you know how when your hands get cold, they kinda stop working very well? Apes have a similar level of control over their fingers 100% of the time, even when warm. Imagine tying a knot or chipping a piece of obsidian when your fingers are like that.

input: argumenta sobre: The United states military vs Every animal that has ever lived Takes place on a planet that is just a completely flat plain, The Military has access to all of its power and no restrictions on what it will do but the animals pure, sole goal in life is just to destroy the United States military. The planet is roughly the same as the earth. Who wins?
output: Do we have a chemical that will kill gajillions of insects but not harm us? If not, the animals win easily. Ants and mosquitoes could probably just handle this on their own.

input: argumenta sobre: A Message on AI Hello WhoWouldWin Community I hope you're all doing well! As your moderator, I wanted to take a moment to thank each of you for your passion and enthusiasm in our discussions. It's incredible to see so many different perspectives and creative arguments about the battles between our favorite characters. Remember to keep the debates respectful and enjoyable for everyone. If you have any questions or suggestions for improving the subreddit, feel free to reach out. Your input is always appreciated! Let's keep the discussions going and continue to make this a great space for all fans! Best, Wait a Second â€¦Something feels off, doesn't it? I would never say something like that! I hate all of you. Well, there's one simple reason behind this: I asked ChatGPT to write that segment up. Technology has progressed to such an impressive state, we're now able to flawlessly replicate the soulless husk of corporate America speak. With these newfound advancements comes one problem thoughâ€¦ the bots are amongst us. WhoWouldWin is facing a serious concern of increased AI activity. Why is this happening? From what I've heard, individuals are farming accounts with karma with the intent of selling them off, but don't take that as gospel. What I do know is that these accounts have no place here. While I'm sure we're all looking forward to the Singularity as much as the next guy, and would prefer to avoid drawing the ire of Roko's basilisk, it shouldn't come at the cost of human inconvenience. Bots that do stuff like provide links to Respect Threads are awesome! A bot pretending to be a person? Not so much. We're banning them on sight. That's why we need you to stay vigilant and report false accounts. What to Look For - Karma: A botted account will typically have no posts of its own, and therefore only have one post karma point. This is different from comment karma, but please be aware this is not always true, and AI users are capable of having widely upvoted posts. - Name: These accounts are manufactured quickly, so they'll usually again, not always select the usernames generated by Reddit itself. That means anyone with a word, a second word, and a number for their username is a viable suspect. Strangely, a lot of bots come equipped with first names as well with Luna being a popular one in an attempt to seem more natural. - Comments: Pretty simple one, which I'm sure many of you have picked up on already. These accounts have a tendency to not contribute to conversation, in favor of expounding about the epic magnitude of the battle. And when they do select a winner, it's a wordy declaration, rather than an argument. They also really like exclamation marks for some reason. This one's easy. - Lack of Response: The dead giveaway in my experience. If you're worried someone was sent from Skynet, merely accuse them and see what happens. If you hear nothing back, you were right on the money. Please be aware this means we'll be taking a 'shoot first, ask questions later' approach whenever we're on the fence for banning users. If we thought you were a bot, tell us how stupid we are in modmail and you'll be unbanned right away. No harm, no foul. Closing Remarks So yeah, if we all work together, maybe we'll be able to make the dead internet theory a little less plausible, and put artificial intelligence back where it belongs: producing movies, television and video games. This is also a problem affecting subreddits others than , so spread the word and keep an eye out however you can. Unfortunately, all of this is a bandaid solution until the admins of Reddit up their game, but what can you do? If you're more of a visual learner however, here are some examples of AI accounts which you can study at home. All of these have been banned already, so don't worry about reporting them. - Example 1 - Easy Mode - Example 2 - Normal Mode - Example 3 - Hard Mode - As a heads up this account is NSFW Also please note that our 'no downvoting' rule applies to people only. We don't really care what you do to the fakers.
output: >These accounts are manufactured quickly, so they'll usually again, not always select the usernames generated by Reddit itself. Uh, oh.

input: argumenta sobre: Can Society Survive: Every time Something Breaks, a Bloodlusted Gorilla Spawns In A bone, a bottle, a toy, a pencil, a chair, a pair of glasses, etc. if something breaks, a blood-lusted silverback gorilla spawns within a couple feet. output: Does Mr. Satan count? I'm pretty sure he's only a wimp for Dragon Ball standards.

input: argumenta sobre: The Terminator has come to assassinate Sarah Conner at the police station, but this time the station is filled with action movie hero cops! Can the Terminator fight his way through the station or will he be sent to the junkyard in a body bag? In the movie the Terminator, the Terminator killed 17 cops trying to get to Sarah Conner. Could it do the same thing if all those cops were replaced with the most badass cops cinema has to offer or at least the most badass without repeating actors? The following hero cops are inside the station: Riggs and Murtaugh \Lethal Weapon\ John McClane \Die Hard\ Harry Callahan \Dirty Harry\ Johnny Utah and Pappas \Point Break\ Yan Naing Lee and James Carter \Rush Hour\ Tequila and Alan \Hard Boiled\ Axel Foley \Beverly Hills Cop\ Marion Cobretti aka Cobra \Cobra\ Nico Toscani aka Steven Seagal before he got fat \Above The Law\ Rama \The Raid\ Vincent Hanna \Heat\ Lahey and Randy \Trailer Park Boys\ these two start in the drunk tank Here is the police shootout in case you need to refresh your memory Everything starts the same with the Terminator smashing through the front doors of the station and killing the officer at the reception desk. All the hero cops are in the office area and have whatever weapon they would realistically have at their desk plus whatever they can get from the armoury. The Terminator wins if he makes it to the rear parking lot of the police station to see Sarah Conner escaping. The cops win if they destroy or immobilize the Terminator. BONUS: Judge Dredd \Karl Urban version\ versus the Terminator in an empty police station. Can Dredd take on the Terminator solo?
output: People are massively underselling John McClaine, who is a straight superhero in his later movies. We are talking about a dude who wins fights against helicopters and harrier jets among other things. Additionally both Axel Foley and the duo from Rush Hour have low level Toonforce. Others in the group like Johnny Utah and Dirty Harry are basically fodder, but I'm pretty sure the higher power ones can take this. Action Heroes 7/10

input: argumenta sobre: Can Humanity Survive: Every Domestic Dog is now a Hippo Every domestic/feral dog, even including wolfdogs, is now a hippopotamus. Can humanity survive man's best friend becoming hippos? The hippos arent bloodlusted and will act like regular hippos.
output: Hm. A confused hippos is already kind of bloodlusted though. Does it retain the same personality, trusts, and memories as the dog? I think either way it'll be bad, but humanity for sure survives. There's a very narrow range of Earth where hippos can thrive. Ecosystems will be a bit fucked until winter comes and kills them all off. Although, given how well they're doing \in Columbia\ it's likely they'll stick around anywhere the climate allows.

input: argumenta sobre: Wolverine Marvel vs Katana Man Chainsaw Man Round 1: no prep time Round 2: 24 hours of prep time Round 3: bloodlusted and enraged
output: Gonna go with Wolverine here. Katana Man's specialty of blitzing his opponent won't be of use here when said opponent can regenerate without needing blood, and has nigh-indestructible bones so he can't even slice him to pieces. Unlike him, Katana Man can't really afford to get hit even with his regen, cause he needs the blood for it. So it's game over if he's decapitated, bisected or his limbs are lopped off. He doesn't even seem all that fast outside of his special move considering how well Aki performed against him. I don't think the prep time will be of any use here. I can envision Wolverine doing more with it since he's more cunning and experienced. But I don't recall him doing anything special with extra time to prepare.

input: argumenta sobre: Necrons 40k vs Tau, Covenant, and GE. Inspired by our resident eldar fan. Current Tau empire get joined by the covenant at their peak and the Galactic Empire. output: So basically, the t'au get two forms of FTL that don't suck, a bunch of forerunner tech, and a galaxies worth of resources. Maybe if they had like a few centuries to build up that territory and expand their fleets they'd give a fair fight, but with no prep time they just lose, the tau and covenant do have some pretty powerful weaponry but they can't field the numbers necessary to fight the necrons. The empire isn't really worth much other than the resources and planet cracking tech they bring to the table

input: argumenta sobre: Gordon Ramsay can breathe underwater. Can he fix The Chum Bucket Some rules and reminders: The Kitchen Nightmares cameramen are present Gordon will not help Plankton steal the secret formula. He's willing to help, but not break the law Gordon has access to his pool of money Gordon can take as long as needs to fix the Chum Bucket Plankton is fully aware of how poor his food is While Gordon can't help Plankton steal the formula, that doesn't mean Plankton won't attempt to
output: On a long enough timeframe, pretty much anyone not named Plankton could turn the Chum Bucket into a successful restaurant, because there's nowhere to go but up. Plankton has only rarely turned his true genius towards accomplishing that. I'm pretty sure the whole restaurant is just an extension of his desire to one-up Krabs. The real limiting factor is that Plankton is unlikely to quit his supervillian bullshit just because Ramsey is around trying to fix his business. Plankton will wind up doing something outside the realm of the restaurant proper that results in the police hauling him off or the heroes kicking his crap in. This is only going to be accelerated by the fact that Ramsey is filming everything and will get Plankton's ranting on camera. It's not a question of "can Ramsey fix the business," it's a question of "can he fix the core problem of the business being owned by a supervillian who only superficially cares about the success of the business."

output: If you could figure out how to live in the air for a year maybe? Like a luxury blimp that was thoroughly inspected inside and out before take off.

Who Is the weakest character Batman can't defeat? Round 1: His adversary will come to Gotham looking for him. Round 2: Now Batman must hunt his adversary. PC Batman.
output: It's hard to find a proper 'weak' answer, but I think Adam Sandler's character in Click could reasonably take R1. input: argumenta sobre: Rational Man with a Shotgun vs Rational Man with a Home Depot Rational Man with a Home Depot is inside an abandoned but fully stocked Home Depot and gets 24 hours to prepare using anything one might reasonably expect to find in a Home Depot. He has no internet access or helpers, but he must find a way to defend himself. After 24 hours are up, Rational Man with a Shotgun enters the Home Depot and attempts to hunt down RMwaHD. RMwaHD has basic adult competency with the tools available to him, but has no specific scientific, carpentry, or engineering training. RMwaS gets one fully loaded pump shotgun, but no additional shells, so only 10 rounds. Once the fight starts, neither may leave the store. Fight is to death or incapacitation. Round 1: Prompt as stated Round 2: RMwaHD gets access to an internet enabled smartphone. RMwaS carries infinite ammo, but must reload after every 10 rounds fired. Round 3: RMwaHD gets access to an internet enabled smartphone and a store employee who is familiar with the store and can do things like fetch items and assist with rote construction tasks but must leave before the fight starts. RMwaS gets infinite ammo and police-level body armor Bonus: As round 3, but RMwaHD now has the composite engineering and scientific knowledge of Walter White and Jamie Hyneman. RMwaS now additionally gets his choice of any civilian-grade small arms and a full set of riot gear. Bonus 2: Since we seem to have reached a consensus that RMwaHD has a huge advantage here. How many of the bonus round version RMwaS would it take to 5/10 or better RMwaHD?
output: Without a time limit this could go on until one of them gets too dehydrated or otherwise exhausted. An HD is large, easy to hide in, and complicated with few open area, and while there are ways for the RMwaHD to defeat RMwaSG, all of them are risky and this man is rational. Assuming neither can leave, this becomes a war of deadly hide and seek. There isn't much food in a HD some snacks at the front but there's running water and probably something that can be used as a water bottle. I feel like if these men are truly rational, this fight is a lot more boring than you might think.

input: argumenta sobre: Corvo Attano from Dishonored is tasked with assassinating every Health Insurance Executive in the USA. Does he succeed? First challenge: Corvo Attano from Dishonored is transported to the US and is tasked with assassinating every health insurance executive . He is max level and has all the powers and passives given to him from Dishonored 1 only. He researches and reads everything about the world he is living as well as all the health insurance executives in the US for a month or two before he begins his assassination spree. He's got like 50k in cold US cash to help him support himself. How far does he get? Optional win condition: If all the Health Insurance companies choose to change their policies to be more humane and less scummy then Corvo will stop. Second challenge with modifier: Same as the first but after Corvo finishes researching and kills the very first executive, ALL other health insurance executives becomes aware of his existence via a very detailed email/message. Can Corvo still succeed?
output: To get the policy change he'd have to target shareholders. It's actually a crime for CEOs to do things that reduce revenue because shareholder's financial interests having supremacy over ethical or safety concerns is part of the Law. But yes, corvo could absolutely kill all of them, possession, teleporting and seeing through walls with friend/foe colours are very strong assassin powers.

input: argumenta sobre: Every continent on earth now has 2 Xenomorph Queen in it, can they take over the world? Every continent on earth now has 2 Xenomorph Queen scattered in it, Can the Xenomorphs take over the earth?
output: I admit I'm comparing modern weaponry to that from a sci Fi universe, but it seems like the colonial Marines are able to pretty easily kill xenomorphs when they aren't being ambushed. Assuming planetwide cooperation I think we would wipe them off the face of the earth but have difficulty fully eliminating them from enclosed sewer systems l/subways/etc unless we can think of some bioweapon.

input: argumenta sobre: Who would win between the entire world population of crows and the city of New York? So sources estimate 27 million crows in the world and rising The population of New York City is about 8.09m as of this year. Take away any outside forces, only the people within the city. The crows are aggro to every human but don't act anymore violent than regular crows. They're just pissed at every person in the whole city.
output: Based on the US Census data around 3.8 million New Yorkers would be adults within the 18-50 age range. Let's take another 10% off to account for the disabled and the sick, and that leaves us with 3.5 million people against 27 million crows. So every able-bodied adult has to fight off 7-8 crows on average. I'd say in a life-or-death situation, most adult humans can cripple or kill that number of crows without sustaining life threatening injuries themselves. And that is before taking into account that someone like a riot police would practically be immune to any and all crow attacks, so they can kill an inordinate amount just by themselves. I think the humans have this.

input: argumenta sobre: Who would win in a fight: 6 peak humans with various weapons, or a sentient, mobile Volkswagen Beetle? The battle takes place in a much-larger-than-normal parking lot, with lamps sticking up out of the ground every so many meters. Let's assume it's around the size of a mall parking lot. The Beetle is the 2010 version, and can drive and steer all by itself, with the expertise of the top demolition derby driver. Round 1: The men have an infinite, hammerspace supply of hatchets. Yes, they can throw them. Round 2: The men have shotguns, with infinite ammo as well, but the Beetle has a Porsche Boxter frame and engine and spikes on the front. Round 3: The Beetle is Bumblebee Bumblebee Movie, and the men have rocket launchers.
output: Round 1 and 2 are humans 10/10. Cars are actually kinda fragile. One good shot to the grill will damage the radiator and cause it to leak coolant, which will eventually kill the engine. Even successfully running over one of the humans would probably damage the oil pan, which will eventually kill the engine, on a car that low. All the humans have to do is cause a leak then play keep away using the lamps until the car dies. Actually, unless the car has infinite gas, they can just climb the lamps and wait for the car to run out of gas. Round 3 Idk enough Bumblebee feats to say for sure but he probably takes it. It depends on whether BB can dodge and/or tank 6 rockets cause each human's only getting one shot before BB just stomps on them.

input: argumenta sobre: For the next 5 years no child can be sired, would humanity survive, would our current civilazation fall? Title.
output: A reproduction shortfall of five years may cause a lot of trouble socially demographic issues down the road, retirement funds, people popping out kids like crazy once it becomes possible again, school systems with a lack of five whole years, etc., but is not a dealbreaker for society's survival. Secondary issues of how people react to the absolute absence of newborns globally would be more severe and the bigger issue, imo.

input: argumenta sobre: Every animal in the US suddenly wants to eat the Declaration of Independence. Can they do it? The US has 1.5 hours of prep before the animals get a sudden, insatiable urge to eat the Declaration of Independence. The country is told that something wants to take the Declaration of Independence and that it's a very big threat, but nothing more specific than that. They are not allowed to move the Declaration of Independence from its current position, but they can fortify its location with the little time they have. The animals are bloodlusted and this is their only goal. The animals won't fight each other. If the animals can't get it after 2 days, the US wins. Bonus round: The US gets 3 hours of prep and knows the exact situation
output: historical live deserted run agonizing chase rude beneficial puzzled smell This post was mass deleted and anonymized with Redact

input: argumenta sobre: An 11-year-old girl in North Korea has been invited to study at Hogwarts. Can Hagrid successfully deliver her the acceptance letter and get her safely from her home in Pyongyang to the school? The 11-year-old girl is a Muggle-born witch whose parents work for the government. Hagrid is permitted to use any means he considers necessary to accomplish the mission. Can he do it?
output: Yes. Most of NK's defense grid is oriented at the threats presented by SK, the U.S., Japan and the U.N., not a big burly dude on an itty bitty bike. His radar cross section would be small and irregular, and his thermal borderline nil, so even if they did spot him in the air they'd be hard pressed to engage. Early Hagrid before having his name cleared has the handicap of not having a fully working wand, but could still use magical devices like the deluminator, hand of glory, etc to both cover is entry and exit and avoid the attention of the parents. Speaking the language might be a problem I don't recall if HP has "universal translator" magic, but he could cheat that with a Pensive and a memory of someone who spoke fluent Korean delivering the sales pitch for Hogwarts. Late Hagrid after he gets his name cleared for the Moaning Myrtle incident has all that and actual magic. Obliviation and body bind curses would be sufficient to get past the parents and most other defenses.

input: argumenta sobre: Could the USA beat 3 million dragons Assumptions: -dragons will be the western kind in terms of body shape4 legged type/"classic fiction" type -every dragon will be organized into a structure where all of them somehow get info on what to do from a 'commander' dragon. -the USA is not aware of the dragons before they appear. -the dragons will prioritise preventing infrastructure that lets the military workairports,farms,factories ETC. rather than fighting the military besides what is needed to allow for prioritised goals. -dragons spread out evenly over the USA -no NATO help besides normal economic transactions R1:the USA instantly starts a response as soon as they can move troops/airplanes over to the dragon R2:10 hour grace period for the dragons to destroy whatever they seek. Edit: due to realizing just how fucked the USA is. I have decided to make a new round in spite of one of the assumptions I set above. R3: the USA has an entire year to prepare with knowledge that dragons with the intent to destroy them will appear at that exact date a single year before dragons come. and there are only 500.000half a million if I wrote it wrong dragons Edit 2: Dragons stats for those asking. Dragons weigh 40 tons on avarage, are 7 meters tall and 10 meters long without the tail. Or 15 with the tail. Dragons cannot be killed easily by anything below 50. Cal or much everything besides elephant hunting rifles that easily because they are so large they can sponge much everything else to an inordinate degree due to basically having too much tissue to destroy with less penetration power, with .22 lr being the only caliber that cannot penetrate beyond skin at all. They can still die from hitting the ground if their wings are damaged enough.most damage can quickly stack up due to their wings being a membrane like structure Any military assault rifle round to the head sustained for a second or two will reliably kill them within short order due to them having an insane amount of blood vessels there to take the heat from fire away from the brain. They cannot take anti tank weapons at all without being disabled. And all missiles WILL kill them if they land. Their fire is hot enough to reliably melt basically any metal if exposed for a minute.
output: 3 million is way too many imo, that's a dragon for every 100 people. Even pretty small towns in bumfuck nowhere are dealing with like half a dozen dragons.

input: argumenta sobre: The army of Mordor took a wrong turn and goes up against the Roman Empire at its height.. Their army camps in Germania their base of operations and prepares to annihilate all human kind. We assume the barbarians Franks, Germans have been wiped out or have fled to Rome. Rome responds by sending its entire army to face off against the enemy. It is currently 117AD under Trajan's reign. Rome has scouted at their foe and deduce that Trolls, mumakil, goblins, orcs, wargs and so on are killable yet are obviously still terrifying and foreign. The battle takes place on a flat land in Northern Italy. Both armies being everything they can muster. Rome has amassed every professional soldier in the empire no sudden influx of recruits due to drafting Round 1: No retreat, the winner of this battle conquers. Round 2: Rome can fall back and use attrition and fortifications. The army of Mordor needs supplies to feed its army. Round 3: Julius Caesar leads the Roman army, Sauron without the ring leads Mordor. Edit: This really blew up and I saw a lot of great comments and points on both sides. Fucking awesome everyone : Edit 2: shit we made it near the top spot.. Can we push through? Oh, as for my opinion.. Rome takes it baby ; Legionaries smash orcish mobs all day Edit III: I wanna thank everyone who made a point and joined this epic discussion.. 700+ comments as of right now! It seems like Rome has this taken.. But not for lack of Mordor trying. Maybe if I have time I'll count up every vote and see what thinks : thanks again guys and gals
output: I believe people are seriously underestimating the Roman legions. First, let us talk about the size of the Roman Army under Trajan. The largest number I can find for the orcs is 250k at Pellanor Fields. This represented the vast bulk of Sauron's strength, if memory serves. The Roman Legions under Trajan are estimated to be around 350-400k. Keep in mind that a large majority of these troops are battle-hardened career soldiers. While there may be initial shock value in the first engagement, the hallmarks of the Romans were adapting their tactics to suit their enemies. The Romans developed sophisticated methods to deal with war elephants, for example. It is unreasonable to assume they would not do the same for Mumakil etc. Keep in mind that Mumakil where effectively routed by a force of 6,000 Rohirrim cavalry. To say that the Romans are not capable of the same with their already established superior number is ludicrous. As to the orcs themselves, they are usually portrayed as generally being inferior to men in their fighting abilities. They have less morale, fighting skills, and arguably worse equipment then then the Romans. They lack the discipline, unit cohesion, and fighting experiences of the Romans. While Mordor would be able to make initial strides with what I would consider specialized shock troops, they would soon be cut off and surrounded as Mordor's basic line infantry falls to legionnaires. Keep in mind the martial mentality of the Romans, these are the people who lost an estimated 50-70k men at the battle of Cannae. To put that in perspective, the Romans took as many causalities in ONE DAY as the United States took in the ENTIRE VIETNAM WAR. Further consider population levels at the time: loosing 60k men when the entire population of Rome was around 400k was an enormous loss. This is also not counting the casualties they had already sustained from Trebia and Trasmine which approximates to around an additional 40k losses. Even after sustaining these horrendous loses against arguably the greatest general in history, the Romans absolutely refused to surrender. They went so far as to outlaw grieving in the city itself. After these setbacks, the Romans adapted their tactics weird! and continued fighting for another 10 years before finally claiming victory. This should give a small glimpse into the absolute single-mindedness of the Romans--they will not be intimidated, they will not back down, and they will not cut and run. You will have to kill each and every single one of them to defeat them. Ok, that last sentence was a bit of hyperbole, but you get the point. So before this gets any longer: 1. Unless Mordor can effectively disorganize and completely rout the Roman army in the opening engagement of the battle, they will be outmaneuvered and defeated. 2. Without the prospect of a decisive battle to thoroughly defeat the Romans, this is even worse for Mordor, again they are defeated. 3. While Sauron's presence greatly enhances the capabilities of Mordor, if he does not have the ring, the Romans still win. Albeit with significantly greater casualties. Ninja edit: also people, think about how Mordor has to advance through the fire OF THE ENTIRE ROMAN ARTILLERY CORPS. Think of the beginning of Gladiator, now multiply that by a thousand. Edit: I figured I would hop back in and address some points that people brought up. The reason I left the Nazgul out is due to their small numbers. While yes they would undoubtedly cause hundreds if not thousands of Romans to flee, there are only 9 of them. Their numbers are far too small to affect the outcome of a battle involving perhaps 1 million plus combatants. In fact, in some regards the Witch King is wasted as a combat asset. He is of far more value actually commanding the armies of Mordor than as a combatant. As to the points of the nine attacking the Roman artillery positions, while this sounds good in theory, in application it has major issues. 1. The numbers they are attacking. There is only 9 of them, and while they may be extremely difficult to kill, the felbeasts are not, relatively speaking. You cannot logically say that felbeasts will survive tens of thousands of archers, scorpions, and ballistas shooting at them. 2. Assuming that they survive the fall from the felbeasts, they are now cut off and surrounded by literally the entire Roman army. They will kill dozens, hundreds, hell, maybe thousands, but eventually Pullo will throw a pilum through the back of the Witch King's hood, or he will catch a ballista bolt to the chest. 3. Even if they couldn't be killed, do you understand how large a battlefield this is going to be? One side of the army will have no hope of even seeing the other side, let alone the middle. In the amount of time it will take them to walk around and kill everyone, the battle will be long over. Mumakil: these are honestly the best hope Mordor has of winning, but they still have a number of critical weaknesses that I think the Romans would be all too happy to exploit. 1. The Romans don't need to kill the Mumakil--they just need to panic them. In fact this was one of the primary strategies the Romans employed against actual war elephants. Someone may correct me if I'm wrong, but is not this essentially what the Men of the West do in the battle of the Pelanor fields? 2. The Mumakil are extremely tough, but the riders are vulnerable to a shot from an arrow, balista, or scorpion. The Romans will no doubt seek to exploit this. 3. An extremely good historical point was made below that the use of catapult on the battlefield was not exactly a thing until the Mongolians pioneered it. However, we must consider that the entire Roman army is here, which means all of their siege equipment. When Flavius Flave sees the giant building-size elephants bearing down on them and he has a onager that can hurl massive stones designed to crush city walls, or pots filled with combustible liquids tell me one of those on the face of an Mumakil would not panic it, is it that hard of a logical leap to make that he might decide to use them on the Mumakil? Even then, I have a hard time imagining a ballista bolt could not pierce the hide of a Mumakil. Remember, necessity is the mother of invention. People seem to not know what I mean when I reference elite shock units. From the historical perspective these where units designed to cause overwhelming casualties and morale "damage" by executing devastating charges into infantry formations. Historical units that fit this classification are: Cataphracts: Scythed Chariots Syrian or Africa Forest War Elephants: War Dogs The point is that most of the elite units of Mordor armored trolls, Mumakil, and Nazgull fit this exact description hence why I referred to them as elite shock troops. Their power lies in their initial charge as it breaks up formations and causes panic. This is perhaps the number one thing that Roman Legionaries drilled to prevent. Desertion or running from battle was punished by being beaten to death with clubs by the men of your own unit that you put in danger. I am not saying that Legionaries could not be broken or forced to rout--far from it--but to assume that it would be "easy" is a gross underestimation of Roman training and military tactics. Orc canon fodder tactics are common throughout the books, in fact, I don't think there is a single case where the Men of the West outnumber their enemies in the entire series. Orc strategy usually involves overwhelming the enemy through sheer numbers. Even if we are to assume that Mordor has a 2-1 advantage, which I believe it has been thoroughly established that they do not, then this is not nearly enough to adopt this kind of strategy. Also keep in mind when armies get this large they cannot all possibly fight at the same time, as there is so many people there is just simply not enough room. This means that while the front lines are fighting the legionaries, the back is constantly being shot to shit by archers etc. The initial orc forces are also going have to deal with the largest pilum what would be the proper pluralization of this? volley in history. Pilum: OK. I finally think that is it. As I said before, if Mordor can break the Legions in the opening engagement of the battle, they can win. I think they have virtually no chance of pulling this off. I am not saying that Rome will not take heavy or even extraordinarily heavy casualties, but the historical records shows that taking massive casualties, usually causes the Romans to fight harder not surrender or rout. The Romans also have war pigs, nuff said. edit: I actually went back and did some proofreading. I apologize for any eyeballs that people may have lost. edit: last edit I swear, since this post has become so popular, I feel obliged to point out there are some historical inaccuracies in how I have the Legions fight. 1. Firstly, field artillery was not really a thing around the time of the Romans. Considering the circumstances of OP's scenario, I simply felt that it was logical that the Romans would use them instead of just leaving them to acquire dust. 2. Gladiator is a very historically inaccurate movie. The way the Germanic Barbarians are portrayed for example is laughably inaccurate, also Legionary helmets. 3. Since I was intoxicated when I initially composed this post, I counted the Roman Legion's as consisting of only Roman Legionaries. In reality about half of the strength of the Legions where comprised of Auxilia units. 4. Also, I am sorry, Flavius Flave is a highly fashionable Roman of my own making. Information on the Auxilia for those who desire it: I have been gifted internet Aurum! Thank you kind Senators!

input: argumenta sobre: European Settlers Vs DnD High Elves So inspired by post and because said I should I'm going to re-try this challenge and make it a bit clearer so yall can't kill the thread XD The challenge is simple: The European settlers Britain, France etc must successfully establish settlements on the eastern seaboard of what is now the US and defend themselves against the now Elvish native population Settler win conditions: Minor; Successfully create and defend their settlements Major: Successfully push westwards, successfully establishing and defending these western settlements Final: Genociding the elves Native/Elves win conditions: Minor; successfully block any westward expansion, locking the settlers in to only their eastern seaboard settlements Major; driving the settlers completely out of the US and clearing all their settlements Final: The Elves not only drive out the Settlers but successfully stop any future attempts at settling Caveat's: All elves can cast magic, classes aren't a thing, and all elves can cast magic up to the fourth level using DnD 5e spell lists and have the maximum amount of spell slots/spell points/whatever alternate casting thing Wizards fancies making they can have at that level Elves have access to material components alternatively they can create arcane focuses from regular materials as they can in DnD The Elves are High Elves with their racial bonuses etc The Settlers are from various European countries but they can all communicate easily and are willing to work together, unite and won't fight amongst themselves and have the best weapons available at the time of the American settlement Neither side can surrender or flee but moral can affect individual soldiers/units, it won't make them flee but will affect their combat effectiveness The Elves can die to wounds that would kill a human, so without magical healing, they will die just the same as normal people; wounds to major organs, bleeding out etc The elves are partly immune to diseases and illnesses brought by the settlers, they won't wipe out the elves but they can cause some damage The Elves are split into different tribes but are willing to unite to face the outside threat Settlers get reinforcements as long as they have one settlement still in their control to act as a landing zone I'm not really expecting the Settlers to win , at least not their higher victory options, but I'm curious to see how well people think they will do, what strategies they can use to gain a foothold etc Edit: just try and make it a little more fair, all the settlers can reload really quickly, to help increase fire rate Fun/silly addition: this can be ignored but just a fun little change the settlers have access to weapons commonly associated with the Western period/Cow boys such as the Winchester 1873 Edit 2: thread killers will be given to Shovel for her amusement
output: I'll talk about the spells. I think this is really easy with up to 4th level spells. Invisibility, Disguise self, and Suggestion could all wreak havoc as you impersonate and magically compel the leaders/captainsor crewmates. Poisoning enemy supplies would be easy. Guerilla warfare would also be incredibly strong with magic. Invisibility, Pass without trace, and or just sneaking to get into position, and the right spell could kill a camp. Here are more spells I think would be very impactful, but is by no means exhaustive: Offensive: fireball, shatter, Hail of thorns, magic missile, sleep, enemies abound, conjure animals, Conjure woodland beings, Hunger of hadar, spirit guardians, all the other summon demon/fey spells, tidal wave, Fireball will kill everyone in a 20 foot radius, can be cast multiple times, and can probably burn the ships down. Conjure animals and woodland beings could wreak havoc too, especially choosing pixies which have more magic. Hunger of Hadar could be used at a chokepoint to make it impossible to cross without dying. Defensive: silvery barbs, shield, silent image, mage armor, Mirror Image, Leo's tiny hut Utility: Find familiar, speak with animals / beast bond, minor illusion, unseen servant, Augury, Calm emotions, Darkness, Detect thoughts, Silence, Polymorph, Leos tiny hut, Major Image, Plant growth, Revivify, Speak with dead, dimension door, Greater invisibility, Polymorph is offensive, defensive, and utility for sneaking as well. Leos tiny hut means they cant be ambushed while sleeping, can sleep anywhere, and you can even attack from it and they have no counter besides running away Major Image, they could conjure their God to tell them to never come back Healing: good berry From this list, the elves will have the ability to layer magical defenses on themselves, cast AOE attacks that all kill at a range of up to 120 feet, sneak into any position easily, turn the enemies into betraying eachother, create illusions and the ability to hide, ask god if their plans are a good idea, and change or abandon plans that won't work out well, magically calm the humans, obscure areas, silence areas, read their minds, and pretty much heal anyone. Goodberries mean they don't have to worry about food and could just burn all the supplies and farms. And they will have much better communication than anyone else with skywrite and animal messenger.

input: argumenta sobre: normal guy who knows the rules of chess but never played it before but has the ability to rewind time vs Magnus Carlsen or whoever is the current best chess player. Thought it would be interesting because there is no fixed moves in chess. Basically a normal guy with infinite possibilities vs the best player with finite. Since there's no way for the guy with rewind to lose the chess battle, the losing condition for him is the time he loses his sanity or becomes braindead. Round 1: Only has a single savepoint and can't go back in time past that one but he can replace it whenever he wants to a more recent savepoint, and one bad savepoint placement could make him lose all his new playthroughs. Round 2: he has no loads and starts the game from the very begining when he feels like he's going to lose. basically a reset Round 3: He can rewind at any point he wants but can't rewind to the future, like if he decides to rewind back to the first move, he can't use rewind to go back before he went to the first move. Bonus Round: Carlsen knows that he's facing a guy who can rewind time and plays even more careful. He's life is on the line and will die if he loses or something so he'll play to the best of his abilities.
output: His best chance in any of the rounds is Magnus spontaneously dying or having a psychotic break.

input: argumenta sobre: Two average guys with immortality each have a task: Guy 1 needs to win a Nobel Prize, and Guy 2 needs to win an Olympic gold medal. Who would achieve their goal first? Two average guys in Florida who are 5'9" tall, weigh 150 lbs, and have an IQ of 100 are both very dedicated to reaching their goals. They are granted immortality, meaning they don't age and are always in their physical and mental prime. Their immortality won't grant them superhuman powers or a healing factor, but each time they suffer a life-changing injury or terminal illness, their bodies will simply return to the time before they sustained the injury or illness. Who would achieve their goal first? Bonus round: How long would it take for one of them to win both the Nobel Prize and an Olympic gold medal?
output: Neither is easy, but Olympic gold is an order of magnitude easier. There are more categories, and far more gold medals given out every four years. Also, to win a Nobel, you have to be the best of the best. You can win gold by being just barely good enough to be on the same team as the best of the best. The worst rugby player on the winning team still gets gold. The guys who work in Madame Curie's lab only get radiation poisoning.

input: argumenta sobre: Who could punch more nazis? Captain America VS Atomic Robo It's hard for me to say that Cap could punch Nazi's harder, but I think that there is an argument to be made that he could punch more nazi's in the same time as Atomic Robo. What do we got?
output: It depends. If we dropped them both in a big room full of Nazis to fight in a contest to see who could punch more out, Cap's speed and martial arts might be enough to carry him. But if they were just a conveyor belt of Nazis and we had to see who could punch longer? Even if he has superhuman levels of endurance, Cap's human body would start to slow him down after a while. Bruises on his knuckles and muscle fatigue would eventually slow him while Robo could keep on punching.

input: argumenta sobre: Who wins WWIII? No nukes With the various armed conflicts going on Russia vs. Ukraine, Pakistan vs. India, and Israel vs. Palestine & Iran, it feels like we're in the runup to WWIII similar to what was happening in the 1930s. My coping mechanism has been to try to understand what would happen if things did escalate to that point. So, here is a map I assembled of how I think the chips might fall with my novice understanding of current events and geopolitics. Let's assume mutually assured destruction keeps the WMD's out of the conflict. Scenario 1: The USA reverses its course towards authoritarianism and falls back in line with the other Western countries most likely, IMO. 1A With President Trump still in office, where he caves to internal pressure from protests and external pressure from the EU and Canada, and/or is aligned by a worsening relationship with China. 1B With President Trump out of office, either by forced removal or by election in 2028 Scenario 2: The mask comes off and President Trump aligns himself with Russia and then China by default. This assumes that civil unrest in the USA is at least partially quelled, enough that the military still takes orders from the Commander in Chief and is able to have an expeditionary force. In terms of armed conflict, this scenario looks pretty lopsided toward the Axis, so the question is just as much about if this could really happen. Who would win? For a longer read -- my rationale for the alliance and goals of a few of the bigger / more active players: Axis: USA if Axis: Annexation of Canada and Greenland, control of Panama Canal. Long term view: control of trade routes and freshwater resources. Russia: Annexation of Ukraine, Georgia, and the Baltics. Long term view: control of Europe. China: Annexation/established control of Taiwan and Hong Kong, destabilization of the West and Japan. Long term view: control of South Asia and Africa. Pakistan: Annexation of contested regions of India. Long term view: destruction of India Iran/Egypt/Etc. in the Middle East: Destruction of Israel. Long term view: Caliphate? Sunni/Shi'a conflict not resolved. Saudi Arabia drops the facade and joins its neighbors. South East Asia: Recruited by China as buffe against India and Australia Turkiye: Muslim solidarity, buffer against EU. South Africa: BRICS solidarity, control shipping around the cape. NOTE: this and the Muslim bloc's control of Suez could force Panama into play as the last viable East/West naval route. Brazil, Bolivia, and Uruguay: proxy war to gain control of Panama. Venezuela: Opportunistic annexation of contested Guyanese oil resources North Korea: Opportunistic reunification of Korea Allies: USA if Allied, Canada, EU and Nordics: Defense of Ukraine, Baltics, Georgia, Israel, India, and the Panama Canal. If Axis USA: Defense of Greenland & Canada, Iceland also pulled in as staging point. India: Annexation of contested regions of Pakistan. Long Term view: Destabilize China and Muslim Bloc to become eminent Asian superpower. Australia, NZ, Japan, & Oceania: Recruited by USA and EU to defend Taiwan/HK and divide China's attention from India and Russia's attention from Europe. South Korea: Defend against North Korea. Long Term view: Counterattack and reunification of Korea. Israel: Annexation of Palestine and defense against Muslim Bloc. Long Term view: potential control over Sinai Peninsula and Suez Canal? Argentina & Paraguay: Proxy war to divide Brazil's attention from Panama Columbia: Proxy war to provide buffer for Panama and divide Venezuela's attention from Guyana Wildcard: Bangladesh. Among South Asia: 2nd largest economy, 3rd largest army. Could turn the tide on the Asian front. Reasons to join Axis: They have a defense agreement with China and they have the 3rd largest Muslim population in the world Muslim solidarity. Reasons to join Allies: They conduct joint military exercises with India, they are part of the UN largest contributor of UN peacekeeping forces. and they have a history of conflict with Pakistan. Reasons to stay neutral: They recently 2024 overthrew their government and the instability could descend into civil war if they take one side or the other. Notable Neutrals: Switzerland, as usual Nepal & Bhutan: Could be deemed not worth the cost in mountainous terrain. Might side with India anyway. Africa besides Egypt & South Africa, plus Yemen & Oman: focusing on their own issues. Proxy wars could develop, with Libya and Somalia joining the Axis and Ethiopia and Kenya joining the Allies. UAE, Bahrain, Qatar, & Kuwait: Insulated by the rest of the Muslim Bloc. Let the dust settle and see if Western relations can be maintained in an Allied victory, or go with the tide in an Axis victory. Mexico & Central America: If Axis USA, don't poke the bear and let them focus north. If Allied USA, focusing on their own issues. Eurasian Steppes: insulated from the front line. Soft alliance with Axis powers. Non-EU Balkans: Yea I'm not touching that. Pacific South America: Don't cross the mountains and there won't be a problem.
output: US has the largest air force in the world The US also has the 2nd largest air force in the world the navy planes. The US mops the floor. Edit: some users have pointed out that the army air branch is the 4th largest So out of the top 4 largest air forces, the usa has 3. And in a world with no nukes, air superiority is the name of the game.

input: argumenta sobre: Could the Western Allies have defeated Nazi Germany without the USSR? Similar to my post about the USSR fighting Nazi Germany without Western aid, could the United States, Great Britain, and France have defeated Nazi Germany if the Germans hadn't broken their nonaggression pact with the Soviets and we assume the reverse doesn't happen either?
output: Yes. They invaded the USSR because they had begun to rapidly deplete their oil and fuel resources. They were losing more combat aircraft over the English Channel than they could replace. They would have eventually weakened to the point where Stalin would have seen an opportunity to break peacetime formation and possibly strike first. It would have taken longer and nukes would have landed on Germany, but the Axis blew its load attempting to take Britain and support a mechanized war machine that they didn't have the logistics to sustain on their own - especially without properly trained soldiers many were conscripts and impressed into service from other countries that they annexed.

Shadow monarch from solo leveling vs strongest anima in tower of god Both of them command creatures and because of their own respectove skills, it is impossible to take control of others summons Shadows would not probably even live without monarchs power and souls of animals are in skill of traumerei, and they can also regenerate as long as traumerei lives Both traumerei and Sung jin-woo scale to planetary level with lots of hax Who would win this battle? input: argumenta sobre: You must fight Batman. You get to choose any one power for yourself for the fight. However, Batman gets to ask 20 yes/no questions to try and determine what power you have. If he guesses it, you lose the power and you have to fight him barehanded. What power can let you win? Rules: - Batman/Bruce will simply be in his underwear with no weapons or armor. You can wear your regular street clothes if you like. - To avoid him instantly speedblitzing you, you start at opposite ends of a football field. - He can ask any question he wants, and will be doing his best to whittle down entire categories by asking things like "will it let you hit me from a distance?" or "will it affect my ability to perceive you?" or "if a 10-year old had this power, is there a reasonable chance that YOU could beat him?". - He gets 3 minutes to prepare a strategy before asking the first question, then 30 seconds after your answers to ask each additional question. - His guess needs to be pretty close, but it doesn't have to be exact. He needs to have the basic ideas behind your powers down, but doesn't need to have the exact incidental details. If you choose "Spawning 143 northeastern bald faced hornets per second out of my left hand" as your power, and he guesses that you can summon or generate stinging insects, that's a win for him. - If he doesn't get your power within 20 guesses, his memory of the conversation will be erased to keep him from deducing which powers you do or don't have, and all he'll know is that he needs to incapacitate you. - Should go without saying, but you have to answer honestly. Edit - I specified in the title that the power is for the fight. I'll clarify that that means you don't get the power while you're being questioned by him. Otherwise you could obviously just take 'person deleting powers' and obliterate him the second you both sit down.
output: I would choose the power of plot protection. It breaks the 4th wall, which old Bats can't handle. If I learned one thing from Saitama, its that nothing beats plot protection.

input: argumenta sobre: Harry Potter, but everyone tells Harry the truth from the beginning. 1. As soon as he's able to understand it, Petunia and Vernon tells Harry about how his parents died and of the magic world, as much as they know about it anyway. They let Harry express his magic without restrictions. 2. A few years later, Dumbledore himself visits Harry, tells him about Hogwarts, about Voldemort, Sirius Black, Harry's mother's sacrifice, and whatever he knows about horrokruxes at the time. 3. At age 11, Harry is accepted at Hogwarts. Hagrid helps him with everything just as in the first book. When asked about the philosopher's stone, Hagrid explains everything he knows about it. He meets Hermione and Ron in an ordinary fashion. 4. When arriving at Hogwarts he meets Dumbledore again, who explains everything he knows again, just to be sure. He also tells Harry about Snape. 5. When the event of the third book occurs, Lupin tells Harry about him being a werewolf at their first patronus class. When shown the Marauder's Map, he tells Harry about Sirius, James Potter, Wormtail and of how Wormtail betrayed them. Also about how a grown ass man has lived in Ron's room for a century. 6. When Dumbledore learns something new about the Horrocruxes, he immediately tells Harry. 7. Dumbledore is killed by Snape, but Dumbledore and Snape have had a conversation with Harry about it earlier. If I missed any crucial point somewhere, the premise here is that no one lies to Harry about anything and tells him about everything they know of importance, as soon as they can. Can he still defeat Voldemort in the end?
output: Unlikely because there are reasons he wasn't told, particularly as the books go on. Voldemort was both watching Harry and had inside info through their connection. If Voldemort catches on to the plan early, he has more time to react and respond to Dumbledores plan. Realistically Harry won through a confluence of luck and timing, without which even his best efforts wouldn't have succeeded. Remember that Harry never really beats Voldemort in any kind of a fight. He gets lucky and escapes, and otherwise Voldemort defeats himself due to his arrogance and not understanding Dumbledores plan. Giving Voldemort any breadcrumbs at all spells doom to Harry and Dumbledore. And the more Harry knows, the more he does.

input: argumenta sobre: The Avengers encounters a rather violent and unkillable lizard SCP-682. Is there any way they can at least incapacitate, and if possible, kill it? R1: All 6 avengers from the first film minus Hawkeye and Black Widow considering they're basically cannon fodder, 682 would just use them as food. R2: All supers present in sekovia minus Hawkeye and Black Widow yet again. R3: every super who fought Thanos at some point in IW. No one has any knowledge of SCP-682's abilities or nature beforehand, battle occurs at noon on each of the respective film's largest battlefields NYC, Sekovia, and the Wakandan field. All fighters are in prime condition. No prep time. Win condition is near permanent incapacitation, preferably banishment or death for 682, with the latter simply needing to kill or incapacitate all of the characters in each fight. BONUS ROUND: R3 but all have basic knowledge of 682's abilities and nature, with Banner, Stark and Strange all having spent weeks researching every bit of info they have on him before prep time shuri can help too. 2 week prep time for all fighters save 682. EXTREME BONUS ROUND: Same as bonus, but all characters other than 682 are at 3X their current abilities and bloodlusted, have the assistance of doctors Bright, Kondraki, Clef, and Gears, along with MTF Omega-7. 682 teleports straight onto the battlefield after a nice long soak in his acid bath 50% mass. Edit: holy cow, I just got back from school and I had no idea this would blow up like it did. Thanks for all the comments, I love the situations and solutions you're coming up with! As for those asking what 682 is, he's an insanely strong, fast, intelligent reptile who can regen from nearly any wounds and adapt to become immune to said attacks for a short time. If you want to read more, I have the link here
output: Short answer: No they can't. Long answer: SCP-682 has literally only died once. That one time was when literally the entire universe ceased any form of life, from elephants to microbes. It has survived, in no particular order: Being thrown into the sun Being nuked until only 0.02% remained Being written out of existance SCP-2719 Several reality benders 682 is a metaphysical construct with only one guideline - Survive. And so, it does. 682 wins all rounds.

input: argumenta sobre: George Washington leading the modern US military vs. General Ulysses S. Grant leading the modern US military Alternate dimensions collide. There are two clone copies of the United States military in 2020. One is on the east coast and the other is on the west coast. The one in the west is led by Grant and the one in the east is led by Washington. Both magically have the supplies, logistics and resources of America in 2020 behind them. Both can parlay with foreign governments. One must wipe out each other. Who comes out on top? Grant or Washington?
output: Grant would have better understanding of modern military weapons and tactics. George Washington on the other hand was a fantastic leader but not all that great of a strategist. Neither side has much relevant military experience. Grant would grasp modern warfare a tiny bit better but not in any ways that matter. They would probably both just relinquish most decision making responsibility to their generals and commanders. Assuming their underlings are equal I'd say the win goes to George just due to the morale boost of being led by the big G and from Washington's charisma. If they have to command the troops themselves I imagine Grant would win as his military experience is slightly more relevant. Semi-auto rifles, attack copter cavalry, artillery bombardment etc would be a bit easier for Grant to grasp. tl;dr George wins the popularity contest but Grant would be a much better commander.

input: argumenta sobre: Could a Starfleet runabout solo the entire solar system in The Expanse at the start of the show? I'm struggling to see how it wouldn't. We know a runabout's shields can survive hits from dangerous ships Jem'Hadar attack ships in particular, so I don't think railguns and PDCs would do anything at all, and they move so much faster than any ship in The Expanse so I don't see how a nuclear torpedo could ever hit it they could just warp away for a second anyway if one was locked on. And without energy shields, phasers are going to slice up even a Donnager-class battleship. Am I missing something? I personally don't think this changes until book 7-9 spoilers... >!the Magnetar-class comes onto the scene, and even then who the heck knows. Its main gun is so weird who knows what would happen if that and shields interacted. !< Edit: Danube-class runabout, to be clear, technically runabout is a generic term.
output: ST is a very high tier series focused on space combat, their shuttles are absurd. The shields are literally supposed to deflect away anything like a mass driver round, regardless of speed/power, without really affecting anything. The torpedos aren't going to manage the speeds the ship can, and if they could the phasers are more than capable of just destroying all of them. Worse, ST phasers can fire at light second ranges, while most of the weapons in the expanse have effective ranges into the thousands of kilometers. So ON TOP of the fact that if they could get in range they couldn't hurt the runabout... the runabout can detect them at absurd range and destroy them before they even approach weapon range. No idea about the USM on Trek shields, my gut is no but maybe.

input: argumenta sobre: People of Manhattan see a large health bar forming in the sky; it reads 'The Wither'. How much damage can the Wither Minecraft do to Manhattan before it's killed? Inspired by this thread awhile back. Some meticulous and devious reality warping Minecraft player managed to bring a Wither from Minecraft into the real world. The Wither starts 20 feet above the middle of pre-COVID 19 Times Square exactly at noon on a Monday, ready to cause as much destruction to the city. Wither Gameplay example Wiki Sadly no respect thread yet. Rules: No prep time for both the Wither or the borough, unless stated otherwise. A large number of people in Manhattan will have previous knowledge of the Wither. New York and the U.S. government can consult experts and sources when the Wither is spawned. Rounds: Round 1: The Wither immediately spawns in Times Square. Round 2: The Wither takes 5 minutes to fully spawn, therefore Manhattan will have 5 minutes of prep. Round 3: Same as round 1 but there are now two Withers. Round 4: Same as round 2 but there are now three Withers.
output: I think people are discounting the amount of pandemonium it would cause. Mass hysteria as our whole worldview is upended would cause major damage to the city all by itself. The fact that guns will take it to half health but no lower is almost worse. I don't know what percentage of Times Square pedestrians are armed at any given moment probably not many, or what percentage of those will start squeezing off shots rather than running in terror harder to estimate, but I would expect some small arms fire in the first couple minutes. When people see the health bar start to drop, within a few more minutes there'll be a LOT of personal firearms being discharged by people who probably have very little idea what's going on and are freaked out and surging with adrenaline. A lot of bullets are going to go a lot of places. Eventually artillery gets there and will finish the job. Someone better informed than me might be able to estimate how long it would take for the military to mobilize, but with the implausible reports coming in, that might take a bit longer than expected. And explosives are likely to cause their own collateral damage too, especially if they start dropping bombs. All told... for R1 I'd wager near complete destruction of a few city blocks, and mayhem causing millions of dollars in damage throughout the rest of the city. The other rounds don't change much except getting the military there five minutes earlier, which will mitigate some of the damage.

input: argumenta sobre: Someone is set back to America on July 4, 1776. They have to be elected president of the United States before 2025. Can it be done? input: argumenta sobre: Can Walter White prevent his son's new BFF Peter Parker from interrupting his drug empire? The timeline is very early Season Three of Breaking Bad. This is MCU Peter Parker circa Spider-Man: Homecoming. Walter White is conducting his criminal activities, having to deal with Jesse's mental spiral over Jane's recent death, the recent Wayfarer 515 plane crash, his wife having just found out about what he really does for a living, and a million other things, when his son Walter Jr aka Flynn introduces his mom and dad to his new friend, Peter Parker. Flynn's best friend Louis and Peter are taking part in a student exchange program for gifted students, Louis spending the rest of the school year at Midtown High in New York City, while Peter enjoys the joys of the golden west here in Albuquerque. Walter and Skyler put on a brave face for Flynn and his new friend, hiding the truth from both young men. Walter even takes a liking to Peter once he realizes how scientifically minded he his. One evening after coming back from Gus's superlab, Walt notices Peter sneaking back into Walter Jr's bedroom. Walt didn't believe it at first because Peter was moving so fast. Walter, as he often does, overthinks a lot about this, and over the next week makes a point to come home around the same time every night, and yep, Peter is always sneaking in and out of the house via Flynn's bedroom. This aligns with the recent activity of Gus's street dealers being webbed up by a mysterious assailant. Walt even asked Gus to procure some of the webbing for him, which Walt tries to study, but it always dissolves within an hour, making it difficult to do so. But the reality is obvious. Walt whispers a single, frightened word to himself: Spider-Man. Scenario 1: Walt tries various non violent ways to get Peter back home to Queens early. He is willing to use Saul, Gus, Mike, or whatever means necessary to make this happen. Scenario 2: Walt is willing to use violence, poisons, etc to stop Peter from interrupting Gus's and thus his business. In both scenarios, Peter is completely unaware that Walt knows his secret identity.
output: Spidey sense would go off non-stop around him, I mean he is the danger, so Hank finds out even quicker

input: argumenta sobre: How far would Spider Man realistically make it in our world Was inspired by a question that asks this but with Superman. How long would Peter last if he was in the real world? Peter in this scenario has the exact same origin and was born in New York and decides to be a hero. What would be the realistic reactions and thoughts to him and how far does he last in our world?
output: The government discovers his identity in a week flat as he gets tracked to his home with satellite imagery and the like. Honestly, though, even when they can then threaten harm to Aunt May to get him to do what they want, he probably then just becomes an officially sanctioned hero. Not much reason to stop him doing what he's doing, as long as he stays in line; it's just good PR for the government. And he's probably willing to straight-up kill himself rather than be turned into a puppet assassin on foreign soil or what have you, so they can't really make him do anything truly bad. At most they might put him on the Secret Service once he's forced to explain how his Spidey Sense works; he's the best bodyguard possible.

input: argumenta sobre: Roman Empire at its peak Vs the Mongol Empire at its peak Assuming no civil wars start, who would win
output: The Romans historically had a very hard time with horse archers, which are pretty much.a hard center to the heavy infantry army that Rome employed. The Mongols are also benefitting from 1000 years of technology and advancements in military tactics. If this battle is on flat, open land, the Mongols win easily. However Rome fielded heavy infantry for a reason, and that reason is that most of Europe is hilly, wooded, rocky, or all three. The Mongols themselves had problems when they started to move into Eastern Europe. If the war took place on rougher ground with little forage i.e. most of Europe, the Romans could do quite well.

input: argumenta sobre: A killer keyboard exists somewhere. Who can find it before it dooms humanity? Somewhere in a random location on Earth 5 miles underground, there is a reinforced bunker containing a magical keyboard. This keyboard has as many keys as there are living humans, so somewhere above 8 billion keys. When a person's key is pressed, they die. This keyboard exists as the floor of the room it's in, and it coats the entire floor in typically-sized computer keyboard keys. The room is as big as it needs to be to contain the keyboard floor of 8 billion souls. Enter a cat. He lives here and really likes the keyboard flooring. Since he lives here, he is always standing on the keyboard, and he is always pressing at least a few keys. He also does things that press more keys, like walking, sitting, laying down, and running. Conceivably, after enough time a LONG time he could press enough keys to doom humanity. Assume his food/wate needs are taken care of/don't matter. The Challenge: Find the bunker. It's 5 miles underground somewhere, fairly durable, and has a door that's sealed but openable with machines or explosives. Round 1: The keyboard bunker appears in the real world. Which real county finds it first, and how long does it take to find it? Round 2: Same scenario, but on Earth-616. Round 3: Who in all of fiction finds it first? Bonus: Any of the other rounds, but the cat is sentient and intends to press every key.
output: Harrier DuBois with high shivers and Inland Empire would do it.

output: The 300 lb guy takes all rounds more often than not. It's possible the smaller guy can win round 1 due to the competitive setting, but a 300 lb athlete sitting at 15 percent body fat is an absolute gigachad, and weight classes do exist for a reason.

input: argumenta sobre: Reddit plans to remove CSS. We here at support the continued use of CSS. Recently the Reddit Admins have announced that they plan to remove CSS from the website. For those unaware, CSS is a web design language that basically allows us to edit the design of the subreddit. comes out in favor and support of continued use of CSS on Reddit. The use of CSS has been integral in 's growth and community in more ways that just making the sub look nice. We have 750 flairs available to users, with different characters across different media and genres, allowing anyone who has a particular interest to find their place here. Furthermore, we offer specially made Custom Flairs as rewards for users for making accomplishments such as winning a tournament or exceptionally high content. We have weekly and bi-weekly posts created by our community that feature a relatively obscure character or team that go into great detail explaining who they are what they are capable of. These posts can't just be constantly stickied at the top of the subreddit, but thanks to CSS we are able to promote these posts and keep them constantly visible. These graphics also serve as a reward and incentive to keep a constant flow of featured content submitted by the community. We use CSS to hide downvotes to discourage and minimize the use of them as a "disagree button" in a debate forum. It's used to create post flairs, incorporate spoiler tags, provide a night theme for those browsing in the evening. All this provides a functional use, and by removing CSS would be affected in a drastic manner that would cause us to lose a lot of what makes the sub special in both its content and community. Because of the uncertainty and limited use of the CSS replacement in widgets, wholeheartedly comes out in favor of support in keeping CSS on Reddit.
output: I would be happy with a compromise, adopt a grandfather clause. Any subreddit prior to the change can keep CSS and on top of that if that sub opts to use the new system they can't go back to CSS. We're not resistant to change here on this sub, however we don't want to lose the functionality and charm we've cultivated. If the widgets work just as well we'll test them on another sub, then change over, but they have to work as well or better than what we've got going on now. Also, if the admins are changing stuff, can we monetize this sub? The top guy wants to pay off a few loans while his kneecaps are still in tact. Or just let the Rangers win the Stanley Cup... either or.
