input: argumenta sobre: DC and Marvel Mercenary Soldier Type FFA Bloodsport Peacemaker Deadshot Deathstroke Taskmaster Deadpool I am going to say no regen for Deadpool. Yes, I am nerfing him, yes, it is unfair, I know, but we all know how this would go otherwise and that would be boring. Actually I will be nice and say really weak regen. If he gets his brain sploded rex style ðŸ˜, it takes a day to regen Hawkeye He doesn't really fit the tag the same way the others do, but I am curious They are all in random places. They are informed that they have to meet in a day and kill each other or they will all be killed. And for arguments sake, let's say Hawkeye decides to go along with it even though he is a hero. Anyway, in the day they can plan however they want, prepare, get weapons etc. They can't bring friends. Side note : Hawkeye has his Ronin sword as well Additionally, presume all the characters know nothing about each other. For me it goes something like this Dead shot and Hawkeye both go on different rooftops to snipe. Deadpool skips in smiling Deathstroke hangs back to assess everyone else Peacemaker just walks in and starts fighting Bloodsport and Deadpool who did the same. Peacemaker and Bloodsport die Deadpool is way more skilled. Deadpool is then headshotted by Deadshot and Hawkeye at the same time. By looking at the angles, they work out where each other are. Purely because pulling a trigger is faster than loading a bow I will say that Hawkeye dies. Sorry Hawkeye, I wanna glaze and say you win but I can't right now. Then, Deathstroke suits Deadshots neck as he has been behind him the moment he heard the gunshot. Taskmaster, realising Deathstroke is the last one makes his presence known. Taskmaster watched the whole time to learn how everyone fights and let the crowd thin out. Deathstroke is good but everything Deathstroke can do Taskmaster can do better. Taskmaster just manages to kill him, goes home and puts his feet up whilst watching F.R.I.E.N.D.S. At which point Deadpool shoots him because he has regenned by now. Deadpool wins in spite of the nerf I gave him lol, a bit of sneaky misdirection haha. Say what you would think would happen please
output: generally a KO counts as a loss even if the target is not "dead" for the purpose of the board. Otherwise some characters like Mr. Immortal, Granny Smite, or Immortal Hulk would never lose to anyone. I agree taskmaster generally takes this. Only Deadpool is capable of out-fighting him because his style is too unpredictable for Taskmaster to neutralize him using predictive MA but like Wolverine his style is ALSO very dependent on being able to soak hits with his healing factor. With a heavily nerfed version he's probably out of the fight pretty quickly. As for the rest, Taskmaster's standard loadout is simply too ridiculous for anyone else to deal with, combined with "perfect aim" stolen from Bullseye and that's all she wrote.

input: argumenta sobre: Who can survive the center of a black hole 12000 times the size of the universe? One million decibels is an absolutely insane amount of energy, and this would likely result in the instantaneous creation of a supermassive black hole. I did some lets be real, probably wrong math and ended up with the size of this monstrosity: It would be 12,000 times bigger the size of the universe. Discounting intangibility, obviously, because otherwise Casper solos
output: Alien x is a reality warper, and was unscathed while a universe destroying weapon was a few feet away from him so yeah he'd be chillin in the black hole deliberating and debating forever or until they agree to recreate the universe.

input: argumenta sobre: An average man has unlimited money, can we stop him from taking over the world? He is of average health, intelligence, fitness, charisma, knowledge, etc. but somehow gained the ability to produce any currency out of thin air in unlimited quantities. This includes existing fiat currencies as well as any new currencies they might establish as well as commodity currencies, but does not include any other objects. He decides to use his powers to take over the world. Can the world stop him, and how? Edit: to clarify, by the world I mean the world's governments or anyone else not on his payroll.
output: Yes. The value of anything depends on its rarity; when someone just starts printing money you end up with massive inflation and economic collapse dumb countries have tried this. Smart nations tie their money value to something- no, not gold or silver, that's dumb- but the US for example, more or less ties their money to their GNP.

input: argumenta sobre: If Zuko, Katara, and Toph were with Aang in the final battle, could Ozai have been defeated and subdued without the Avatar state? Inspired by this post The fight takes place in the same area as the final showdown between Aang and Ozai. Sozin's Comet is on. Aang has morals on, so isn't trying to kill. The other characters may try to kill if their code allows. Zuko will fight his father.
output: Ozai would focus on Zuko because he is fucking pissed. But he would remember that Zuko would redirect lightning, so he would have to use big blasts of flame. Zuko is also comet enhanced and with Dragon Dancing should be able to deflect his barrages for a bit. Toph is actually almost a liability here. Ozai can fly and that is primarily what he is doing, after whatever Toph's first move is, he will likely keep to the air and she will have little idea where he is. She should honestly just literally tunnel and try to launch suprise attacks when she can. Katara should stay near the waterfalls and ocean, so that she always has a large supply of water. She is even more outclassed than Zuko but she intercepted comet enhanced Azula's lightning with just water and she would have a bunch more here. Even if Ozai tries to dry up the area with big blasts, it will create steam that Katara can use to freeze him and slow him down at least or use the steam as cover while the other two/three attack. Also Aang is there. I think if all hunker around an area with a lot of water and Toph is nearby in a pillar of rock, they could beat him. But narratively Aang is going to be trying not to kill him and preventing others from doing so, that it will all fall apart and Ozai will all blast them probably non-lethally because it's Avatar and the same ol same ol will happen anyway.

input: argumenta sobre: Which is the weakest modern military which can take over the world in 1500? The country really only has access to their population, so it cannot train soldiers from the people it conquers. Once a nation/kingdom is conquered, they no longer fight or contribute. The country can only use domestically produced arms some small inputs can be ignored.
output: Key here is: domestically produced arms! A helluva lot of the world doesnt produce their own armaments, from the smallest sidearm to the mightiest fighterjet! Now, China, USA and Russia are complete overkill. Brazil, too, just by number of people alone. Japan, South Korea, Germany, France and UK are natural contenders, but they, too, might be overkill. Italy, too, come to think about it. I propose Sweden. They either make everything they could need themselves, or could easily do so - they have the tech, the factories and all the steel they could ever ask for. Sure, they're not many, but once they can show that they can destroy anyone or anything at will, the rest of the world will either bend the knee or be destroyed.

input: argumenta sobre: 10 Protoss colossiStarcraft2 vs 500 M1 Abrams tanks The colossi are lore-based vs 500 modern M1 Abrams on a plain battlefield 500 meters apart.
output: Colossi lore based would win. They have AI that coordinates better than tankers, and their plasma shields are strong and provide a significant advantage. Even if their shields get taken down, which is a big if, they are made from extremely durable minerals, meaning they will shrug off small arms and HE shots, and are resistant to any other. The only thing that poses a threat is APFSDS, but since Collosi are over 50m tall it would be like getting poked by a needle. The thermal lances are much more potent weapons than the Abrams main cannons, each swipe could disable dozens of tanks by melting their optics, if not outright destroy them in one go. If it is a close engagement the Abrams also lacks gun elevation angle to shoot the body of Collosi. The Collosi AI will likely exploit this fact and use the cover of their shields to close the distance. The sheer weight of Collosi could probably crush tens of Abrams underneath them.

input: argumenta sobre: Kratos vs Goku, but both are now reduced to regular humans. Both Kratos and Goku will battle it out in a fight, but both of them are now reduced to human bodies. Meaning they feel the same as humans in a fight. No powers. No one uppers. Just straight hands. Who wins? R1: Fist fight. R2: Grappling. R3: To the death. Someone must die.
output: R1: Without powers or transformations, Kratos is nearly double the mass of Goku. Have you seen those videos of smaller guys trying to fight bigger dudes? Edit: From estimates I found online. Goku is 175cm tall and weighs at best 90+ kg if we are generous on his most bulk forms. Kratos is 194 cm tall though some scripts and rigging show him at 213 cm and weighs about 110 kg at his lowest estimate, 129 at others. He is smaller on the Norse Games. On average I dare say a 30 kg difference. R2: Grappling is kind of THE Greek martial art. Wrestling is big on Greece as well as boxing. Goku has never shown any particular grappling talent while Kratos does stuff like slams, chokes, pinning, etc. R3: I think nearly all of Goku's kills except the Red Ribbon Army of Mooks were ki-based. Kratos is an expert on killing with his bare hands. And in terms of a number of battles he far outpaces Goku in experience killing. Goku spends most of his time training, not killing. The soldiers of Kratos' world are also expected to fight monsters even as regular humans, so their skills and brutality must be far more advanced than RL Greece. Goku's martial arts are great, but also dependant on ki and other superhuman abilities such as ki sensing, super reflexes, and flight to use at their best. He is adaptable though, as losing flight on the ToP was not that much of a problem, but he still needed ki to fight. He never really had to fight as a regular human and has been able to resist attacks from super beings that should've killed anyone else. Kratos has trained as a human well into adulthood and lost his powers many times. He is well aware of how to fight like that.

input: argumenta sobre: Could Sheldon Cooper Produce 99.1% Pure Meth Like Walter White? Let's imagine a scenario where Sheldon Cooper from The Big Bang Theory is challenged to produce methamphetamine with the same 99.1% purity as Walter White from Breaking Bad. Sheldon has no prior experience in drug manufacturing but has a genius-level IQ, a Ph.D. in theoretical physics, and an eidetic memory. If given a reasonable time frame let's say a few months, could Sheldon learn enough about chemistry to match Walter White's 99.1% pure meth? Or does the lack of practical chemistry experience mean that no amount of theoretical knowledge would allow him to reach that level of purity? How do you think Sheldon would fare in this unconventional challenge?
output: Cooper is a physicist and routinely underestimates other disciplines. In the Breaking Bad universe, he simply can't do it. In the the Big Bang universe he initially laughs at the ease of the challenge, then there is an "hilarious" back-and-forth with Leonard who warns him that chemistry isn't trivial. Sheldon gets increasingly frustrated and snappish over the next of couple of days as he rapidly hits 97% but can't go over it. He gets the idea that he can crack it if he simply plugs away day and night and increases his caffeine intake to help. Soon he gets into a sleep-deprived delirium and decides to sample the product, which allows him to stop sleeping and rapidly get the purity to 99%. There are more "hilarious" scenes of methed-up Sheldon pinging around the apartment, to Leonard and Penny's increasing concern. Eventually Sheldon triumphantly shows Leonard a pile of sparkling blue meth with an astounding 99.2% purity, but it's revealed to be a dream sequence. The final part of the episode is Sheldon having to close the operation to avoid arrest. Credits roll with another "hilarious" dream sequence parodying the desert murders from Breaking Bad, with Sheldon as WW, Leonard as Hank, Howard as Gomey and Kripke as Jack the Chief Nazi.

input: argumenta sobre: Can Goku bring the Orks from 40k to extinction? Goku's goal is to completely purge the universe of Orks. In theory, this should be very easy for Goku. Unfortunately, Orks reproduce by spreading their spores like a mushroom, making them a challenge to wipe out. Goku only wins if there are none left. The Orks are as powerful as usual and Goku is at his current power in the manga and can't use Dragon Balls or the Zeno button Round one: All the Orks are on a random planet Round two: The Orks have spread across the universe Round three: The Orks have spread across the universe and they're on earth. Goku likes earth and doesn't want to destroy it
output: R1 and R2 are easy stomps for Goku. R3 not so much. Orks spread like fungus, through spores. It's what makes them so insidious - you clear a world of orks, and then after a few generations pass, they just show up again. If Goku is commited to it, he could probably keep returning to earth and yeeting squigs and shrooms into space, but he'll never "win," he''ll just keep delaying the inevitable.

input: argumenta sobre: Palpatine must use his considerable manipulative skills to turn somebody to the LIGHT, while Yoda must turn somebody to the DARK. Who wins? Palpatine is arguably the most manipulative individual in the entire SW universe, but could he turn somebody to the "light"? In contrast, could Yoda -- a beacon to the light and the Jedi -- turn somebody to the "dark"? Success will decided by these particular factors: How long it takes to turn their respective targets If their respective targets STAY in the light/dark R1: No Force abilities allowed that would do things like cloud judgement. Giving up would count as losing. Yoda's target = Luke ESB; Palpatine's = Dooku ROTS R2: Yoda and Palpatine can 'give up' for ONE day; if they do not return to turning their respective targets, they lose. Friends/Family/Allies etc. of the targets will show worry and may be able to tell that something is amiss. Yoda's target = Luke ROTJ; Palpatine's = Vader ESB R3: Yoda and Palpatine are allowed to bring in one individual to help turn their respective targets. This helper must be on the same side as them, i.e. Sidious cannot choose Luke. Friends/Family/Allies etc. know that SOMEBODY is behind things but not who. Yoda's target = Obi-Wan ROTS; Palpatine's = Vader post-ROTS, but pre-ANH Bonus: Palpatine has to convert a version of HIMSELF TPM to the Light-Side, as does Yoda -- but to the Dark-Side. Who is most successful?
output: It is quite easy to tempt somebody to the dark side. The lust for power, the fear of loss or failure, etc are all such human motives. They cause us regularly to justify bad behavior and to trick ourselves into thinking we're on the right path. Yoda has simply to tap into this. To show force sensitives times when more power, less restraint, and more domination of the dangerous other would help them. The light side requires a ton of monastic teaching to get them to accept the abnegation of self and feelings. And even still, after a lifetime of monastery life, or being removed from society, many fall back.

input: argumenta sobre: All gangs merge into one, what's the strongest military they can beat? We are going to presume ALL crime syndicates cartel, gang, whatever name you give them will simultaneously merge into a single entity and are all teleported into the ground of a single country. The winner is whoever manages to make the other side give up in totality/disband to the point of being ineffectiveso getting the mega crime group to split up into their originals won't work, you need to make then ineffective in totality or reduce them to singular rouge members all doing their own thing. Edit:if you want to spice things up. You can consider an R2 where terrorist organisations/nations are added into the toll of crime syndicates.
output: I think this goes a lot better than you'd think, a lot of governments are under armed right now. Assuming the gangs keep their resources when teleported and don't just appear outside in the street, I'd say France is the weakest nation they couldn't take out. So pretty much any EU member state, any state in Africa, any state in South America, and possibly even Turkey would be kind of helpless to a multimillion man military force appearing in side their defenses. Only 6 or 7 countries are equipped to handle that right now. Although criminals tend to be more profit motivated than anything, so if we stop considering open warfare, a coalition of all organized crime on earth, could probably conquerer America by just bribing the right people to make the army stop existing and then getting brought in to replace the police as private contractors.

input: argumenta sobre: How many space marines wh40k are needed to conquer earth from "the Matrix"? How many space marine chapters are needed to conquer the real earth from the Matrix universe? Only space marines, no other human forces are allowed. Exterminatus and orbit bombing are not allowed.
output: People are sleeping on The Machines ITT. We dont' know an exact number of Sentinels, but it's a LOT. A chapter Astartes with 1,000 battle-brothers, each space marine is going to be outnumered at least 100:1, if not more. And the Space Marines won't have the benefit of a fortified undergound location with a single chokepoint. With superior maneuverability, far superior numbers, and a hyper intelligent hivemind, it's going to be pretty easy for the Sentinels to overwhelm exposed Space Marines on the surface. Now, heavy bolters will shred Sentinels, and I'm assuming it would only take a few shots from light bolters to drop a single Sentinel. And chain swords probably one-shot. Moreover, the power armor will be tough for the Sentinels to get through. But they can eventually pry/plasma torch the armor. And when a marine gets dogpiled by 100 Sentinels, what's he going to do? Now, Armor would change things. Most of the Space Marine's vehicles can go faster than Sentinels in open space. But once it comes to the tunnels or city ruins, the Sentinels could use their maneuvarability and coordination to latch on. And we saw what happened to the Nebuchadnezzar once the Sentiels latch on. TL;DR: It would take more than a single chapter to overcome the Machiness advantages. I estimate at least 5.

input: argumenta sobre: Ant-Man MCU, instead of changing size, instead has the ability to turn into a 500-foot tall ant. How does this change the MCU? Can he defeat Thanos in Infinity War? Assume there are no mental issues, square cube law, whatever; Ant-Man has full control over his body as a giant ant. Also assume he can lift 5,000 times his own weight, like most ants can. Bonus: What if he transformed into a 500-foot termite instead?
output: I'm going to use Bullet Ants because they were one of the ants Ant Man has used and I could find their size and weight. At their largest, they are 1.2 inches long and have a mass of 60 milligrams. A 500 foot ant would be one scaled by a factor of 5000. The weight should scale with the cube, so if I did my math right, would weight 7500 metric tons. Assuming that he can lift 5000 times his weight I'm pretty sure that it generally stated to be 50 times an ants weight, he can lift approximately 37.5 million metric tons. For comparison, an aircraft carrier displaces about 100,000 tons, the empire state building is 365,000 tons, and the great pyramid is roughly 6.5 million. While I couldn't find any stats on the Sanctuary 2, there is a very real chance that this Gi-Ant would be able to lift it and smash it into the ground. This means the Scarlet Witch probably tears Thanos apart and Spider-Man returns the gauntlet to the past. Captain Marvel cleans up.

input: argumenta sobre: The Flash joins the Olympics, what game can he join where he can win always but no one will suspect him of having powers? Also he cannot intervene on the game itself or other players, for example: He joins the 200m and before the formation starts for running he proceeds to break everyone's toe to hinder them to running at their full capacity. THIS IS INVALID Also he cannot be suspected even after winning the game so using his powers in camera will be a problem.
output: He'd be an incredible boxer. His reaction time means nobody would be able to lay a glove on him, and he could break down his opponents with volume striking, peppering them with lightning fast jabs to set up power shots. He wouldn't be suspected of having powers, just as being absurdly athletic and nimble. There are plenty of smaller boxers in real life who look borderline superhuman when they move. He'd fit in perfectly. He also has superhuman healing factor, so there's no real risk of injury. The only chance of suspicion being raised would be if he sustained a cut or a broken nose in a fight, which then instantly healed. So he'd have to make sure he didn't get hit hard in the face.

input: argumenta sobre: Who could win, Rambo vs. Predator, the one from the first movie? They both fought in the jungle, only the Predator attacked an entire team, and Rambo is an expert at fighting at a disadvantage. , knows how to hide and ambush, who could win
output: I agree that Rambo is on the same level of skill, if not slightly better, as Dutch's team. The issue is, if neither side knows about each other's capabilities, the Predator should be able to fuck him up before Rambo ever gets the chance to learn about how the Predator's stealth cloaking works, it's weapons, it's thermal vision, etc. Dutch had the advantage of having his team die one by one, and with each death more info about the Predator was revealed. There's no way for Rambo to tell where the Predator is, even if he's made aware that something is after him in the jungle. And the Predator would just see him, and hunt him from a distance. If Rambo has any weaponry, the Predator is shooting him with plasma, ripping out his spine, and calling it a day. With prepared foreknowledge on both sides, I can see Rambo getting the win.

input: argumenta sobre: How deadly would xenomorphs be in real life? Imagine if xenomorphs were real and we had to deal with them. How long would civilisation last? How dangerous would they be? What would be the response of governments? Police force? The army?
output: This is absolutely lethal. A biological species that is invulnerable to disease. A biological species that is inedible for any other animal, fungus, plant, or bacteria - but can itself eat all of the above. A biological species that reaches maturity and combat capability from a single cell in less than a day. A biological species that, when there is a shortage of prey, does not die of hunger like normal animals, but hibernates and can wait for centuries for new food to appear. Compared to this, rabbits in Australia and rats in the New York subway will seem like endangered species from the Red Book. This is absolutely the end of any ecosystem. Yes, a pack of xenomorphs is not dangerous for a well-armed and disciplined military unit in a direct confrontation. But even the coolest military unit has to eat something. And it will soon have nothing to eat. As a friend of mine used to say, "Competition is not a battle between monsters. Competition is when one species eats the food of another. It's not the strongest that wins, it's the fattest."

input: argumenta sobre: You must fight Batman. You get to choose any one power for yourself for the fight. However, Batman gets to ask 20 yes/no questions to try and determine what power you have. If he guesses it, you lose the power and you have to fight him barehanded. What power can let you win? Rules: - Batman/Bruce will simply be in his underwear with no weapons or armor. You can wear your regular street clothes if you like. - To avoid him instantly speedblitzing you, you start at opposite ends of a football field. - He can ask any question he wants, and will be doing his best to whittle down entire categories by asking things like "will it let you hit me from a distance?" or "will it affect my ability to perceive you?" or "if a 10-year old had this power, is there a reasonable chance that YOU could beat him?". - He gets 3 minutes to prepare a strategy before asking the first question, then 30 seconds after your answers to ask each additional question. - His guess needs to be pretty close, but it doesn't have to be exact. He needs to have the basic ideas behind your powers down, but doesn't need to have the exact incidental details. If you choose "Spawning 143 northeastern bald faced hornets per second out of my left hand" as your power, and he guesses that you can summon or generate stinging insects, that's a win for him. - If he doesn't get your power within 20 guesses, his memory of the conversation will be erased to keep him from deducing which powers you do or don't have, and all he'll know is that he needs to incapacitate you. - Should go without saying, but you have to answer honestly. Edit - I specified in the title that the power is for the fight. I'll clarify that that means you don't get the power while you're being questioned by him. Otherwise you could obviously just take 'person deleting powers' and obliterate him the second you both sit down.
output: 20 is too many, I think he would whittle it down without using them up regardless of what I chose.

input: argumenta sobre: What would happen if Gothem was a real city in the US? So to any comic book reader it is abundantly clear Gothem is a shit hole with few redeeming qualities. You have like four or five active serial killers running around one of which likes mass murder. The courts are corrupt AF and never put down the villains despite the fact so many of them would get executed in 2 seconds irl, ESPICALLY JOKER. And there is quite literally a place called "crime ally" where if you go there you will be mugged and shot. Why does anyone live here? I mean seriously is everyone ok with dying by some lunitic every few days? That aside, lets say Gothem, Batman the villains and everyone are all real. How would our government restore peace and civility and make Gothem a "nice" place to live. Is it even possible? Even places who suck balls to live in irl like Detroit do not have mass murderers running around everywhere. And genocide isn't carried out once every few days. Could anything be done about Gothems situation?
output: Cool prompt. Gotham must be prosperous since it can be home to one of the greatest fortunes / companies on the planet. It appears to have a massive amount of wealth inequality, corruption, organized crime, and lone wolf vigilantes. Real life Gotham would probably elect a hard-line "law and order" mayor who is mildly corrupt how else do you get the job? and committed to taking down the lone wolves and vigilantes. So Joker and Batman would both go down, but Penguin and the Falcones would prosper. Catwoman would go down in hours. Freaks like Clayface and Poison Ivy would mobilize a national response and martial law. The current USA could handle all of Gotham's rogues, but I fear the city will be fucked going forward. There's just too much chaos for it to be a safe economic investment. Start a business in godforsaken Camden.

Mutaguchi Renya leads an army of the most incompetent soldier in recorded history ISIS fighter Abu Hajaar. Assuming following conditions, what army, fictional or nonfictional, LOSES to them? Background Inside For purposes of brevity, we will refer to the army of Abu Hajaars + Gen. Renya as the Dream Team. Due to poor planning by Gen. Renya, 55k troops out of 90k died during the campaign, mostly from sickness and starvation. Historians argue that the disastrous loss of life and eventual retreat without gaining anything of substance hastened Japan's defeat at the hands of the allies. Due to his actions, Lt. Furthermore, Jungles are host to thousands of species of plants, many of which are poisonous. When we are surrounded by the verdant jungle, it is impossible for us to low run on food. Honestly this guy is a gold mine for stupid quotes, but this post is already getting too long. Our Incompetent Soldier: ISIS Fighter Abu Hajaar This Video shows you everything that you need to know, but it can be summed up in this one quote: "What is wrong with you, Abu Hajaar?" Video Summary of his incompetent feats: Pelts his friend who was preparing an anti-vehicle rocket launcher with hot bullet casings from his machine gun Doesn't set up his MG3 Machine Gun properly, causing himself to be knocked backwards by the recoil and peppers the interior of the vehicle with bullets, nearly killing his allies Stands on ammunition so that his mates can't get to them Roasts his friends from backdraft from an RPG Can't tell the difference between anti-personal vs anti-vehicle rockets Doesn't take off safety cap off of his rockets prior to firing THROWS HOMEMADE GRENADE TO THE FLOOR IN FRUSTRATION WHEN IT DOESN'T FIT rolls around in the open with no cover, thinking it will protect him when he is forced to exit the vehicle. The Rules of the Battle: Remember, the goal is to pick a commander and an army fictional or nonfictional that is so dysfunctional, it will lose against the dream team. The army that goes against our dream team should be composed of at least 1 commander. The Dream Team will adjust its number of men i.e. Abu Hajaars to match that of the opposing army. The Dream Team is armed with armaments and vehicles that can be seen in the video. They also gain access to equipement and vehicles that the Japanese Imperial Army would have had in the year 1944. For balance, the challengers should at least be on similar level of weapons technology as the Dream Team, or should have hax that will let them fight vs the Dream Team on even footing. However, if the challengers are so incompetent that they will lose vs the dream team even with more advanced technology, that is allowed. You may mix and match the challenging commanders and army. You can take a commander out of the appropriate time period to command the opposing army example: if you want to use a really incompetent 13th century army general from France, you may use him to command an army with appropriate tech level. In such a case, assume that the commander is familiar with modern technology. The commanders of both sides are responsible for organizing logistics/communication/strategy and making sure the men in their command carries out their orders. The battle conditions are as follows: Both sides must capture and hold a jungle island that is separated by 1000 km of ocean from their home nation/main base. The island is a perfect circle with a diameter of 100km with gentle sloping beachheads, But rises up to a single mountain, 1000m above sea level in the center. The mountain slopes are gentle. The jungle starts 500m away from the shore, and quickly thickens. There are some sources of fresh water on the island. An array of 20 freshwater springs are present on the island. Each spring can supply up to 500 men per day, and they are located 50km away from the center of the island in a way that they form an evenly spaced circle. Suppose that both sides have landed at the exact same time on opposite sides of the island. Bonus: What is the most technologically primitive army that can beat the dream team?
output: The Spanish Army as it was on the eve of the Battle of Talevera, 1809. A squadron of dragoons french light cavalry was wandering around near the spanish position, out of musket range, when the entire line fired without orders. The resulting noise caused four whole battalions, those same battalions who had JUST FIRED, to drop weapons and run. They routed themselves into panic with their own volley! Lt Gen Renya and his army of Abu Hajaars could probably stay in bed...

input: argumenta sobre: Could the Mongol Empire conquer the New World? One week after the Mongols conquered the Khwarazmian Empire in 1221, Genghis Khan and everyone in his army is suddenly teleported across the ocean and end up in what is now modern day Alaska. Confused by this sudden change in scenery, the Mongols immediately become bloodlusted and start a new campaign, intending to conquer aa much of North America as possible! Could the Mongols conquer 1221 North America? If they can't realistically conquer ALL of North America, how far can the Mongols realistically get before being permanently stymied by the North American terrain? Breakdown of the combatants: All the Mongols are given their standard issue weapons including siege weapons, armor and horses. Objective: Conquer as much of 1221 North America as plausibility allows.
output: They would all die in Alaska. There's a reason the Mongols never conquered Siberia. Okay, let's assume they spawn in the American Prairies instead. The main problem I see is that the Mongols would have a very hard time replenishing their horses. There were no horses in the Americas before the Europeans brought them back over. Meaning any Mongol that loses his steed would just be a walking target until more horses are bred. I see them conquering all of the Great Plains without too many problems. The more organized states of Mexico would be very tough, but the Mongols would probably win through the influence of Old World disease ravaging the population. Their cavalry-based armies absolutely cannot cross the Central American jungle, the deserts of the west coast, or the woodlands of the east coast. At max, I think you'd have an empire stretching from the center of Mexico to Alberta, with the Rocky Mountains as the western border and the Mississippi or Appalachians as the eastern border.

input: argumenta sobre: Could Denjichainsaw man hold down a job as a member of the sevenThe Boys for a year? Denji replaces Starlight in the first episode of The Boys TV show. He really needs the money and being a supe pays well, so he is motivated to hold on to the job. This means he isnt fired and doesnt get into any serious fights with the other supes. Can he do it? R1: Denji right when he gains his powers in part 1. R2: Denji after eating Makima in part 2, he needs the money to care for Nayuta. R3: Denji at the current point in the CSM manga.
output: Every member of The Seven is going to look down on Denji. Denji is a teenager who knows very little in the world and wears his naivety on his face. Not only that, but the practicality of his powers are very difficult to see in the situations The Seven are typically deployed, which are military deployments where they stomp down a bunch of normal soldiers, which he can do, but just in a offputting and animalistic way. In other words, no member of The Seven is going to have a positive impression of him other than maybe Black Noir. Denji is willing to tolerate a lot from a woman, but he has little to no tolerance to a man. He did kick Aki in the nuts for trying that "tough teaching" method on him and that's part 1 Denji who was desperate for an upgrade in life from eating fucking cigarettes everyday. All of this is to say that he will be harassed and Denji won't be able to just take it. Homelander will consider him unmarketable and will try to bully him off the team or try and "clean up his act", Denji would be a smart ass because Homelander isn't a hot woman, Homelander would get physical and... yeah, that's the end of that for pretty much any round. I don't think Denji even lasts long enough on the team to know the shady shit Vought is up to. And lets be real, it doesn't even need to be Homelander specifically, it could be the Deep too that ends things. input: argumenta sobre: A single Tyranid is dropped into ancient Rome, what's the body count? A single Tyranid organism is plucked from the WH40k verse and dropped down in the middle of historic ancient Rome, 100 AD. For the sake of discussion, it cannot propagate or reproduce. It's sole objective is to feed and keep itself alive. What's the rough body count? R1. Termigaunt. R2. Genestealer. R3. Warrior. R4. Carnifex. R5. Hive Tyrant. Bonus Round: assuming the Hive Tyrant can kill everything in Rome, is there a year in history, pre-modernity, where Rome could collectively kill it?
output: People are massively overestimating the Tyranids in this thread IMO. R1: Pretty easy but with moderate body count. Termigaunts don't regenerate especially fast and it will eventually run out of ammo if it's not brought down with sheer numbers. Termigaunts are also not smart so it'll just a brief rampage. R2 & 3: Brought down but with significant body count. There's plenty of cases in the lore where the guard or a named character kill these with just a melee weapon. Eventually someone will get a lucky stab in or it will get drowned by a roman legions numbers. Biggest threat is the genestealer hiding in the sewer and terrorizing the city for weeks / months. R4 & 5: Now things get interesting here. Both the carnifex and tyrant can survive even hits from a tank and regenerate from them quickly. There's nothing in rome that can kill either in a straight fight. Small chance the romans could lure the carnifex into a trap and kill it that way, say by dropping a large building on it or something. I give the Carnifex 8/10 and the Tyrant 10/10. The other rounds 0/10, no way they're taking rome on their own.

input: argumenta sobre: One lightly armed 7 year old every day for ten years, or an ordinary military aged male. Who would win? The male knows all the rules. The 7 year olds can only attack once every 24 hour period. Each 24 hour period is 6am to 6am. Only one 7 year old can attack at a time. Only melee weapons a 7 year old could reasonably handle may be used by the 7 year olds. No ranged weapons or projectiles of any kind. Knives, daggers, small clubs, spears etc. The 7 year olds have not been trained for this but are given enough info to use their weapons decently for a 7 year old. The male has access to clean water, food, and shelter, but must venture outside to tend to crops and livestock at least twice a day if not more. The male also has access to a small workshop with limited supplies. He can fashion reasonable traps and weapons but supplies are hard to come by. He might be able to go scrap searching once a month to refurbish supplies in small quantites for such things. He has enough electricity to power an alarm clock and charge batteries for a dim crappy flashlight, otherwise his light comes from a kerosene lamp and stove at night. He lives isolated in a forest near the edge of an abandoned town. Edit: Update So far the consenus boils mostly down to two schools of thought. 1. 10 years is a LOT of time. One slip is all it takes, 7 year olds for sure And 2. 7 year olds are laughably non-threatingly, naive, and predictable, any self respecting adult with a mote of intelligencewould go big brain time and the 7 year olds wouldnt stand a damn chance.
output: Nobody's commented on the psychological stress this would place on the man. Ten years of very physically taxing subsistence farming all alone, with zero human contact like he's the last man on earth. He doesn't have any distractions, zero entertainment, not even any books. He'd go insane and lose his will to live within a few months even if this prompt didn't involve a sneak attack he has to watch out for every single day, where he has to be surprised by, and brutally kill, a small child.

The fight takes place in New York City, and the humans are all random New York citizens that had suddenly grown, so no prep. R1: The humans are to fight barehanded, and are prohibited to throw or climb on buildings to lesses as much casualties as possible, but the GOAT doesn't give a shit, and the GOAT can still use whatever it takes to survive. R2: All bets are off, and the humans are free to do anything they want to kill the monkey. R3: There are now 3 Kongs. R4: Instead of King Kong, Godzilla is now the enemy. King Kong is also working with the humans in this one.
output: Monsterverse Kong should scale to other titans who all have capabilities exceeding what a natural animal can physically achieve even in a hypothetical no-physics scenario where you scaled a real creature to their same size. His strikes moved Godzilla around more than any missiles, artillery or even entire national military responses have been able to. And as far as durability goes the monkey took no damage from depth charges, later in GxK Kong also got shot through the Hollow Earth into the ground and immediately resurfaced with zero damage. Honestly he should be tearing through 100 giant humans. That power gap far exceeds 100 normal humans and a Tyrannosaurus rex.

input: argumenta sobre: Weakest character who can beat a D&D PC which has reached max level in every class? This is a fair duel. The PC is not ambushed in their bed, nor do they have their meal poisoned secretly. The PC only has official 5E classes. As far as the Wish spell, let's be realistic and assume that the Dungeon Master is not willing to grant a wish that neutralizes this encounter they prepared, but is fine with the suggested uses within the description of the spell. Let's also assume that the player is reluctant to risk a 33% chance of losing the Wish spell forever.
output: Nerevarine from Morrowind who abuses the alchemy system. In Morrowind potion effects stack. Keep in mind at 100% magic and elemental resist in Morrowind you become immune to those types of damage. Morrowind also has spell absorption which at 100% just absorbs the spell while taking no damage. Reflect just reflects the cast spell back at the caster at 100% reflect. All of those effects can be made with alchemy. So that takes care of the magic aspect. But wait there is more. Alchemy can be used to boost the attributes themselves. Say strength or intelligence. Like I said potions stack. Potion strength and length scale off of intelligence. So if a player so wanted they could chug a bunch of intelligence potions and then make more intelligence potions and cause a feedback loop of making stronger and stronger potions that last longer and longer. It is possible to make potions that boost attributes into the 100s of thousands that last real life years. Not in game years real life years. As in you could leave the game running for years and the potion effects would not go away. After they have what they consider intelligence enough they can start to work on potions for the other stats. Like speed, strength, agility, and luck. In game no one boosts speed that much because the character becomes to fast to control in game. Strength can be boosted to high that you can one shot just about anything in existence. Agility effects hit chance and dodge chance. Enough said. Luck effects everything you do in a small way. Not very useful at low numbers. But a few million luck well now that makes luck effect everything you do in a big way because you are officially the luckiest son of a bitch in existence. The type of guy who is banned from playing the lottery because you won it 10 times in a row and they thought you were cheating somehow. As far as the melee Morrowind also has a spell effect called sanctuary. What sanctuary does is make you harder to hit in melee. Throw that in with a super high enough agility and luck stat and you are not getting hit by anyone unless they really got lucky. So if the Nerevarine does all this we have a guy who is immune to all types of magic. Who can run fast enough to break the sound barrier or even a good fraction of the speed of light depending on how much they boosted speed. Who has enough strength to kill a god with one punch. Is so agile that he can dodge just about anything. Is the luckiest son of a bitch in existence. And is so hard to hit that your odds of doing so might as well be 0. Yeah there is a reason no one who plays Morrowind plays like this unless they are just messing around. But you can and that is why we love it.

input: argumenta sobre: Everyone in the world fights everyone else. Who comes out on top? The fights happen independently of one another, assuming every fight is fresh. Who is the most likely to come out on top as in beat everyone else. Or at least win against most people. Assumptions: 1. No weapons 2. Perfect refresh after every battle 3. Knock out, death or surrender count as victories 4. There is a flat arena 5. People fight in their prime Thinking about it, UFC is one big part of it but at the same time heavier weight competitors, such as strong men jump to mind
output: Not offering a winner, but ill thin out the herd based on your conditions. To fill in some points you have missed, ill assume combatants are in a no holds barred match, and they are forced to fight physically, and in a set time frame ie no running away forever, or other weird tactics. I am also assuming here that fighters are able to watch footage of their competions prior fights and learn from these. To address your specific conditions: 1st condition : Everyone in the world. Let's rule out anyone without extensive 1 : 1 fight training. We can also rule out anyone that's weak, infirm, etc. You did say "In their prime" but some peoples prime just isn't that prime. Not to be too sexist / agest , but with 1 : 1 fighting of everyone in the world in their prime, we could probably rule out almost all females and anyone under 17 or so immediately. Result : Very fit and strong males, with extensive fight training only 2nd condition :Perfect refresh after every fight Assuming refresh time is given, you have essentially ruled out anyone in the lower weight classes as that is the major advantage for not carrying heaps of weight. I am also assuming you mean all injuries are healed before the next round. result: light heavyweights and above only 3rd condition : knockout, death or surrender count as victories. 8 billion people participating in a knock-out tournament would take a surprisingly short 33 rounds. 33 rounds however is way too many to rely on luck, or a gimmick so, we could rule out any one trick ponies, or single discipline fighters. 33 fights to the possible death would also take a fair toll on a person mentally even with full physical recovery, so we could rule out anyone that was mentally not prepared for full contact fighting. Result : multi displine fighters with an extensive toolbox of moves and a very businesslike attitude to fighting 4th and 5th condition. Flat arena, and people fight in their prime. result : no change from whats covered above, So. in summary, our champion would likely be a male, over 100kg / 220lb but likely a lot more. extensively trained in striking, standing and ground work, and almost psychotically prepared to do what it takes to win. eye gouging, nut shots etc. Candidates would be a fighter in the physical style of Emelianenko, Couture or Ngannou, but prepared to be utter assholes in the fight to get the win.

The US team took home 121 medals in 2016. If Steve fails to medal in more than 21 events, it's a loss. -Eligible Event Categories: Archery x2, Athletics/Track & Field x24, Basketball x1, Badminton x3, Beach Volleyball x1, Boxing x1, Canoe Slalom/Sprint x11, Cycling x9, Diving x4, Equestrian x6, Fencing x5, Football/Soccer x1, Golf x1, Gymnastics x8, Handball x1, Hockey x1, Judo x1, Pentathlon x1, Rowing x8, Rugby x1, Sailing x5, Shooting x9, Swimming x18, Table Tennis x2, Taekwondo x1, Tennis x3, Trampoline x1, Triathlon x1, Volleyball x1, Water Polo x1, Weight Lifting x8, Wrestling x2 Bonus- If too hard, you can give him Bucky as a teammate for the doubles/team events and/or allow Black Widow to participate in all women's events. Make it like a 50/50 when it comes to ranged and melee combat. I was inspired for this one based off of Wonder-Woman 2017. What kind of boost would be required for melee divisions to be added to warfare?
output: > People need to be faster than bullets Lol, no they don't. If we are talking line infantry, in WW2 25,000 rounds were shot for every kill. Want to look at a modern war? It was 200,000 rounds per kill in 'Nam. Let's use the WW2 figure. That's 99.996% of shots missing human sized targets moving normal human speed. Trying to hit something the size of a human moving the speed of a car is going to be exponentially more difficult. Especially if we are basing this off superheroes and assuming no loss of mobility and agility. Acceleration is probably more important than top speed, but being able to move at 100+mph is probably fine, even if you are still subsonic. Your 100 mile-an-hour Supe isn't going to be beating an artillery strike or a carpet bombing. But neither is your normal human with an M16.

input: argumenta sobre: An average guy is wearing every corrupting magic item there is, including the One Ring, The Ice King's Crown and a Red Lantern Ring. Which one wins control over him? If there is a corrupting magic item that activates in some way other than wearing it, assume that he has activated it in that way. Some more ideas: the necronomicon, the monkey's paw, various haunted houses. Edit: So far, the one I find most convincing is the Mask's mask. It could probably turn everything else mentioned so far into a plastic toy. Edit 2: Of the suggestions here which I'm familiar with, I think the answer must be the white lantern ring, Sukuna's fingers or, again, the Mask's mask. Here are my reasons. White Lantern Ring: White Lanterns are able to use all of the colors without their corruptive side effects. Not only can the white lantern ring bring its wielder back to life from the other items which would kill him, but the fact that using it destroys any black lantern ring which the wielder has means it would likely destroy the Lich King's helm of domination and frostmourne, and maybe even the One Ring and SCP-350. As for the rest, lanterns generally have powerful resistance to mind control. Even if they are able to instill impulses in him, the limited free will of white lanterns means that he probably wont be able to act on them. All in all, a much better ending than I would have suspected. The only things that make me question this one is I'm not sure if we can call the white lantern ring "corrupting" and I don't know if it can defend against Sukuna physically transforming the guy's body into his own. Sukuna's Fingers: I think they might win by technicality, just because if the guy is transformed mind and body into Sukuna,, then Sukuna has completely acquired the guy even if Sukuna then is targeted by all of the curses himself. The Mask's mask's complete bodily control might be able to prevent Sukuna from taking over.
output: Not just the one ring, but also the 7 dwarven rings and the 9 human rings. That's a lot of rings

input: argumenta sobre: A lion the size of a T-Rex vs an actual T-Rex. The biological implications doesn't matter. Both are exactly the same animals, but resized. Scenario one: modern-day Savannas. Scenario two: a North-American forest from 70 million years ago. Bonus round: a T-Rex the size of a adult male lion x an actual lion.
output: Lion, all rounds. The T-Rex is used to hunting smaller prey. While it will occasionally battle creatures its own size, its going to be typically going after creatures that are smaller than it because that's how you take less damage hunting as a solitary hunter. How does it get up when it gets knocked over? Awkwardly, for example. The Lion is used to engaging things at or larger than its size. That's what its built for. If a creature knocks it over it gets right back up. Scaled up, its claws will hurt the T-Rex even through its feathers. Also its bite will be sufficient to damage the T-Rex.

input: argumenta sobre: Every vehicle in the world will become evil and bloodthirsty against animals and people. Can mankind and the animal kingdom survive? Truck, car, sedan, bicycle, emergency vehicle, helicopter, and boat will attack humans and animals. If they cannot directly reach us, they will release chemicals or cause their own destruction through any means necessary solely to spite us. Carriages, wagons, and anything pulled by a horse is unaffected. Round 1: It's us versus every major car manufacturer in the world. Round 2: Boats, helicopters, and planes are unaffected. Round 3: Cars not considered "modern" are unaffected. How many rounds do humans/animals survive?
output: I can't see "vehicles" doing enough to kill all of the animal kingdom so I'll focus on humans. In all rounds bar 3, I take four cars directly into my front door, though they're likely not designed for the offroading required to push through it. There isn't enough space to build up speed. They try to smoke me out and fail through either engine failure or ventilation. In Round 3, 3/4 cars in the driveway are quite old, and one of them is parked conveniently in the way of the car new enough to try. In all 3, assuming I don't get a plane landing on me I'm fine short term. 1: Humans are long-term put back to the mid 19th century I am assuming the same rules for horse and cart apply to buggies with transportation. Humanity survives, though climate change is put into overdrive and billions die. OP, are steam driven wagons allowed? If trains are then I assume they are, and they'd likely take over from cars, though in much more "car-like" bodies. 2: Probably far better: there's simply far less capacity for environmental damage, which will be the biggest long term problem. Logistics is properly fucked until train lines are expanses enough to take over from trucks and international travel goes back to cruise liners, but it's not terminal. 3: Define modern. The median age of a car in the US is 2013 right now for example: is that fair? Or do you mean like a classic Mini, or a Model T, or... Either way we win, but it's a hell of a lot easier to rebuild the more modern you go.

input: argumenta sobre: Link The Legend of Zelda tries to capture Shantae Shantae using an Empty Bottle. Can he do it? Rules â€¢ Link has decided to try snatching Shantae to put her into an Empty Bottle, so he can mock Ganon for now having a genie albeit half-genie at his disposal. â€¢ He has to get his hands on her and press her against the bottle. She will become small enough to be forced inside. â€¢ Shantae will not try to fight back, only willing to run from him. Only if she has nowhere to run will she fight. â€¢ If an hour goes by, Link will give up on capturing Shantae. â€¢ In all rounds, Link starts 100 meters from Shantae. â€¢ Each version of Link gets all their feats and abilities from their universes. They will start off easy with moderate-level equipment, armor, and dozens of arrows and other projectiles, but will switch to their best loadout if desperate. Shantae gets all her feats, abilities, and standard equipment, except from possible Blaster Master crossover showings. R1: Ocarina of Time Link; location starts in Hyrule Field R2: Wind Waker Link; location starts in Scuttle Town R3: Twilight Princess Link; location starts in Faron Woods R4: Skyward Sword Link; location starts in Sunken City R5: Tears of the Kingdom Link; location starts in New York City Can Link make a genie bottle out of the half-genie, or can Shantae prove the Hylian needs to go back to encaging fairies?
output: All their feats and abilities? A'right then. I'm just going off Shantae's RT cuz I don't know the character, but assuming I'm not missing anything drastic in there, the answers to the first three should be... R1\ This is also Majora's Mask Link, so he equips the Stone Mask to become invisible and walks right up to her. R2\ This is also Phantom Hourglass Link, so he stops time and walks right up to her. R3\ This is probably the strongest Link without needing any strength-boosting items as OoT Link does, so he can easily pull her in with his Clawshot given his strength feats crush hers. The question is if she could just dodge it. I'm not seeing any feats from her which would let her do so, but you probably know the character better than me. If she can, then it becomes an extended chase, but I still favor Link in that; his Wolf mode seems faster than her, and he can literally teleport him to multiple sites in and around Faron Woods. Unless the bird she summons with her whistle can just fly her straight into the sky out of his reach, in which case that's that I guess. I honestly hate Skyward Sword so much that I don't really remember all his capabilities, so no comment on that one. And I haven't gotten around to playing TotK yet. cute battle though \^\\^

input: argumenta sobre: Slappy the Dummy gets sent into the household of the Adams Family. Could be take it over? Slappy, somehow, teleports into the living room of the Addams Family residence. Everyone will likely assume he just belongs to one of the children of the home and they definitely won't question it when a dummy starts talking. For the sake of this, Slappy will be considered the "winner" of this if he is able to kill, enslave or otherwise evict every single member of the Addams Family, without it happening to him in return. R1. Slappy is doing his usual routine, and he's under the impression he's just in a normal family household R2. Slappy is bloodlusted, and he's gonna be gunning to kill them immediately, he will also know off the bat this family is not normal R3. Same as before, but all the Addams are also bloodlusted
output: R1: Slappy is immediately 'sussed' by grandma or cousin it. Is offered a happy position in the family. Ruins it by being selfish, and ends the movie as a pile of wood in some fire he caused. R2: Slappy is viewed as the best toy Pugsley and Wednesday have ever played with. Ultimately however he is broken during one of their games and put into a corner of the attic alone and unable to move. He bemoans his fate and a broken Chucky doll in the storage unit tells him to pipe down. R3: Cousin It or Grandmother rends the soul from Slappy the Dummy and puts it in a different toy that has movable eyes, but no other movable appendages.

input: argumenta sobre: Who would win Levi Ackerman vs ezio in a fist/regular sword fight Based on feats/scaling My opinion: I know Levi is like op character in aot with odm gear But this is a fist fight and I doubt that Levi is that good in fighting in a h2h He has great durability tho from that thunder spear explosion But ezio is a lot smarter, more experienced, probably a lot stronger and faster in a fist/regular sword fight

input: argumenta sobre: 5 people with no legs vs 5 people with no arms Round 1: In an empty flat field the armed group have wooden clubs and the legged group have steel toe capped boots. Legs stomp &x200B; R3: arms stomp &x200B; R4: legs stomp, can't learn breakdancing in 24 hours &x200B; r5:arms stomp, prosthetic arms arne't very good &x200B; Edit: R3, I think legs probably win on reflection

input: argumenta sobre: Tu-95 vs A-10 guns only dogfight Who would win in a dogfight between modern versions of the A-10 and Tu-95 if they can only use guns? Obviously it's an attacker vs a bomber which doesn't make much sense but they do both have guns meant to be capable of killing other aircraft and at least in the same ballpark of burst mass. 20 kg/s The Tu-95 is also quite a bit faster in a straight line meaning that it can probably prevent the A-10 from chasing it and the tail turret is radar-controlled i.e. it's an aimbot and has something like 60 degrees of traverse in all directions except only 40 degrees of depression. It only has about 500 23mm rounds as opposed to 1125 30mm rounds for the A-10 so clearly there is a lot less ammo for the Tu-95.
output: This is like asking which boat wins in a drag race. On land.

input: argumenta sobre: Could the entire U.S Military be strong enough to take down 1 Star Destroyer? The Military will use the best jets, most powerful guns and so on but No nukes but Missiles are allowed. The Star destroyer is high up in the sky, not in space, specifically in the Stratosphere above New York with the Tie Fighters ready to Deploy and Attack
output: Sort of. The U.S. probably wouldn't be able to get close to it, but the TIE fighters are no match for the ludicrous amount of anti air the U.S. has at its disposal. Plus the air force make up these scenarios as training exercises, of which they have a contingency plan for alien invasion. No nukes is tricky, because these contingency plans rely on them. A direct attack would be suicide thanks to the stupid amount of turbo lasers and unmanuaverable aircraft. Artillery would most likely have the best chance because star destroyers rely on energy shielding and can't really stop an artillery barrage except by shooting it down. But, since it is one star destroyer, there is plenty enough artillery to go around. Edit: with nukes off the table can we null the orbital bombardment? In legends nukes are the easiest way to take down a star destroyer, so I feel like glassing a continent should also be disallowed

input: argumenta sobre: evil man with size manipulation power vs our modern world This evil man has gained superpower in a lab accident. He can now manipulate the size of anything he touches at an atomic level changing it proportionally from up to 100 times bigger or to 10k times smaller by either length or weight as he desires. The objects remain their property and for organisms they retain their biological functions and do not suffer from any otherwise scientific drawbacks like they are supposed to. He also has a passive aura that automatically shrinks down any hostile things within 10 meters around him to 10k times smaller, including projectiles, hostile animals, any gas,liquid meant to harm him etc. He can also touch himself to either increase/decrease his own size and has stats scaled accordingly. The world does not know of this evil man's power, yet, until anyone figures out. He can either lay low or go on rampage to cause as much chaos as possible and to destroy the economy and major world powers could he do it?
output: Assuming he has range limitation like 10 meters he could: He could use a pistol and change bullet weight to low when it accelerates and change it to heavy when it exists. 9mm bullet used like this would have very roughly 459 million joules of energy without any recoil. That would easily destroy dozen tanks in one shot if they were lined up. Shotgun would be hilarious. He could basically create vacuum tunnel for the bullet too so that air doesn't slow it. He could make aura that diminishes incoming fire by making it weigh nearly nothing He could make vacuum shield to avoid shockwave damage at the same time too. Missiles would kill him easily with their heat release. Powerful laser would melt him too.

input: argumenta sobre: Could a regular guy with 1000 resets kill a guy with a gun? Everytime 1000 reset guy dies, time reverses itself and reset guy goes back to his spot at the start of the challenge completely unharmed and 1 reset is spent. Only reset guy remembers what happened in the timeframe before his death. Once the 1000 resets are spent, reset guy could now be killed permanently. Other than his reset ability, reset guy still has the stats of a regular human male and has no weapons other than his fists. The guy with the gun is armed with an m1911 with only 1 magazine containing 9 rounds. Gun guy has some experience in shooting a gun and how to use it. Gun guy takes 3 seconds to aim at reset guy so reset guy gets a 3 second head start in every reset. Both combatants start 15 feet away from one another. Battle takes place in an empty storage warehouse. Who wins?
output: Totally doable. 3 seconds to cross 15ft is plenty of time its just a matter of what he does when he gets to gun guy. Reset guy likely still dies a bunch before he figures out a good way to wrestle the gun away and kill gun guy.

input: argumenta sobre: 150 Death Angels from ''A Quiet Place'' arrives right after the invasion of Poland ends in 1939 The Death Angels arrives in 1939 after the germans invades Poland. A meteorite crashes in Hamburg, and the death angels are released. 150 of them only. This interupt Hitler's plan to start his conquest of Europe because the angel aliens will attack anything nearby that makes sound. So can the german military resist against 150 of these fast and agile aliens?
output: They could potnetially destroy anything in that era because modern weapons don't work on them. as long as they don't get drowned or having their weakness exposed they are kinda invincible. In the source material its pretty weird that other people didn't figure out their weaknesses before the protags but in a realisitic scenario, i think people might be able to figure it out then its pretty easy to exploit it and kill them.

input: argumenta sobre: Who would win in a fight: one Space Marine in a murderous rage without his armor and weapons VS 100 bloodthirsty male silverback gorillas on meth and steroids? Assume the fight takes place in an open, neutral battlefield - no weapons for the Space Marine. The gorillas are hyper-aggressive, enhanced beyond natural limits by a cocktail of meth and steroids, essentially turning them into unrelenting, muscle-bound killing machines with no fear or self-preservation instinct. The Space Marine is in full combat armor, trained for centuries in warfare, and currently in a berserker-like rage. He's not holding back. This is a fight to the death. No retreat, no reinforcements. Just pure, brutal chaos. Who walks away?
output: Bullets annoy him like splinters. Apes can't hurt him.

input: argumenta sobre: Super Mario vs Nazi Germany The year is 1942. Adolf Hitler has kidnapped Princess Peach and has her locked up in his bunker in Berlin. Mario is facing his biggest challenge yet, so he has mustered the ability to use a multitude of his powers and skills from the different games to beat this. These are his attributes: He is 120cm tall and is wearing his standard red and blue outfit. He can run and jump without getting tired. He can jump 3m vertically triple jump and 8m horizontally long jump. He can spin jump on all animals, enemies and plants without getting hurt. He can jump on walls. He takes no fall damage. He can breath in space and underwater forever. He can twirl in the air to fly longer. His gravity is halved during nighttime. He can throw his cap to damage and kill enemies, and to slam open doors. He can jump on bullets and missiles, grab them and throw them back. He can eat any red mushroom to grow twice in size and to receive one extra hit point. He can eat any red flower to receive the ability to throw infinite fireballs from his hands. He can eat any acorn to receive the ability to fly with a wingsuit. He can eat any feather to receive a cape and the ability to fly. He can eat any blue mushroom to become very tiny 10cm. He can shoot any crystal he finds as a fast projectile that stuns enemies. He has 5 lives as a start. If he is hit by anything explosion, enemy, bullet, punch or similar, he loses one hit point or a life. He is invulnerable for three seconds after being hit by something, unless he has no power-up. If he collects 100 gold coins he receives one extra life. He can have at most 99 lives. He can teleport through paintings to wherever the painting represents. Mario can only use one power-up at the time, just as in the games. Germany is the real life equivalent back in 1942 and they all know that Mario is coming and will shoot him on sight. They cannot harm Peach, only lock her up. No other country will help Mario either, so he is all alone in his quest. Hitler dies if Mario jumps on his head three times, or by 35 fireballs. All other enemies die from one hit. Vehicles are invulnerable. Mario starts in Paris. His mission is to kill Hitler, rescue Princess Peach and escape Germany unharmed before the war ends in 1945. Can he do it?
output: If Mario gets very lucky then I say he can do it, since I doubt he's fast enough to dodge bullets consistently

output: The orks win. Even if the viltrumites killed all the living ones, new ones would grow. Them.having to conquer rather than destroy Essentially means they would just be fighting orks forever. And eventually the orks will become krorks, as they get stronger by fighting stronger foes. And krorks will kick the shit out of the viltrumites.

input: argumenta sobre: Choose 2 to protect you, the rest are bloodlusted coming after you: 1 Human with a rifle, 3 Grizzlies, 4 Lions, 5 Gorillas, 7 Bulls, 10 Crocodiles, 15 Wolves, 50 Eagles, 10,000 Rats. Saw this "meme" and thought it was interesting. Some ground rules: You choose two of the following "groups" to protect you. They will follow basic commands and will protect you with thier lives if necessary. The rest are bloodlusted and will stop at nothing to kill you. Your choices are: 1. An average human male with 7 years experience hunting deer. Armed with a Ruger American Rifle No sight. He has 50 rounds of .308. 2. Three male grizzly bears weighing in at 600lbs each. 3. Four Male Lions weighing in at 400lbs each. 4. Five male silverback gorillas weighing in at 400lbs each. 5. Seven adult bulls weighing in at 1800lbs each. 6. Ten male saltwater crocodiles weighting in at 1600lbs each. 7. 15 adult grey wolves weighing 110lbs each. 8. 50 adult female golden eagles with 7ft wingspans weighing 14lbs each. 9. 10,000 large brown rats weighing about 1lb each. You're on an island that is 1 square mile, it is surrounded by saltwater, and has four equally sized quadrants. 1 is a wetland, but the water is no deeper than 2 feet anywhere. 1 is a Forrest. 1 is Rocky and mountainous. 1 is a grassy plain. You're dropped in the very middle and the groups you choose are with you. The groups attacking you start in the area most like thier natural habitat. They don't know exactly where you are but know you are on the island and will hunt you. What do you choose and what is your strategy for survival?
output: The first choice is, without question, the 10k rats. That's a lot of rats - they kill everything they can hurt. They also are good at inducing panic. The ones I'd say can stand up to the rats most effectively are the crocs and the eagles, so we take one of them. I think smart use of foliage can let your rats deal with the eagles, so we take the crocs and go to a marsh or swamp area.

input: argumenta sobre: The Gang Vs The Gang Vs The Gang. Friends Vs It's Always Sunny In Philadelphia Vs Scooby Doo Frank, Dee, Dennis, Charlie and Mac. Ross, Rachel, Chandler, Phobe, Monica, Joey. Perhaps, Monica and Phoebe would be able to take on Charlie and Mac and Dee- but Frank and Dennis would destroy. The only way the Sunny gang loses is if they infight and get in their own way. Chandler alone could handle the Scooby Foo gang, single handedly.

What would happen if we were to go into a conventional war against another country? Would the small arms matter? Are bolt action rifles enough?
output: Yes, by far. Small arms aren't very relevant in modern warfighting.

input: argumenta sobre: At what distance would Eliud Kipchoge Marathon World Record holder vs. Usain Bolt 100m World Record holder be a 50-50 race? Assume both athletes are in their prime. Eliud Kipchoge - Has the world record for a marathon at 2:01:39 average speed of close to 13mph. Widely regarded as the greatest marathon runner of all-time having won 11 of the 12 marathons he has entered. - Enjoyed success at the middle distance range with a 1500m PB of 3:33 and mile PB of 3:50. - He's no slouch at sprinting either and is capable of sub-55 laps when he kicks at the end of a race. Usain Bolt - Considered to be the greatest sprinter of all-time with world records in the 100m 9.58 and 200m 19.19 clocking speeds in excess of 23mph. - Began his youth career in the slightly longer 400m, of which he has a PB of 45.28. The question is at what distance would endurance vs. speed balance out and Kipchoge vs. Bolt produce a 5/10 race for both athletes? Just to get some numbers out there I would guess around 600m, the second lap would be an absolute killer for Bolt and any longer he will be completely gassed, any shorter and Bolts sprint background will be enough for him to stay ahead. Bonus question At your chosen distance both are given one year to properly train for the race, who wins now?
output: My answer is a 600m race. We had a very similar post a few years asking Mo Farah vs Usain Bolt where I argued that 500m is the shortest distance Mo Farah can win against Bolt But Farah runs more 5k and 10k races, and previously 3k. He has a competitive 800m on his record. Kipchoge has never competed at such a short distance, so for him 600m seems more reasonable than 500m. 400m is something Bolt has run and is still considered a "sprint". 600m is the shortest distance considered "middle-distance" implying the necessity of pacing throughout the race. I don't think Lipchoge can compete on anything shorter than that.

input: argumenta sobre: Can Tarrlok Legend of Korra beat the Thunderbolts MCU? Thunderbolts: John Walke Agent, Bucky, Red Gaurdian, Yelena, and Ghost. Assume that the force can sense something's off with an assimilated person, but only if the force user is within 20 feet of them. Round 3: In addition to Vader, Palpatine and the his Royal Guard are also on the station. Bonus round: The Thing's assimilation is going on while Luke and his crew are trying to rescue Leia.
output: Honestly, once Vade, maybe even Tarkin realized what was going on, they'd be more than willing to seal off a wide perimeter around the infected and open it to space, killing all the personnel in the area, and then after sealing it back up and restoring atmosphere, come back in with flamethrower troopers to toast anything still moving. Part of what made it difficult for the people in the original movie to stop the infection was their unwillingness to kill their friends and/or sacrifice uninfected people. The Empire would not give a shit.

output: Which Shredder are we talking about here? Cause there's quite a few versions of him.

input: argumenta sobre: Dark Lord Free-For-All: Sauron Lord of the Rings vs. Voldemort Harry Potter vs. The Night King Game of Thrones vs. Darth Sidious Star Wars vs. Ganondorf The Legend of Zelda vs. Fire Lord Ozai Avatar: The Last Airbender vs. The White Witch The Chronicles of Narnia As the title implies, we're gonna have ourselves a Dark Lord free-for-all here. Who would die first, who would be the last man standing? All feats are allowed e.g. we're going by Voldemort in both the books and movies. Note, for all rounds: I'm going to say that Fire Lord Ozai is under the influence of Sozin's Comet since that's the only time we see him fight. Round 1: They duke it out using all their weapons, powers and invulnerabilities presented to them. Round 2: Same as round 1, only we remove the invulnerabilities they possess. So, in other words, Voldemort's Horcruxes are gone, you don't need to toss the One Ring into Mt. Doom, you don't need dragonglass to kill the Night King and Ganondorf's and the White Witch's immortality is removed. They're all perfectly mortal. Would that actually change anything? Round 3: Same as round 1, only now they have the full might of their respective armies backing them up. Once again, Ozai's Fire Nation is under the influence of Sozin's Comet. Round 4: Same as round 2, only with the armies backing them up once again.
output: I feel like Sideous at his prime would beat them all. He was a master at all seven forms of lightsaber combat and could wield two lightsabers simultaneously against two opponents Maul and Savage. He was THE master of the Dark Side and was the most powerful Sith Lord to exist in thousands of years. In addition, he was an expert politician and plotter which allowed him to start a civil war in the galaxy and make the public cheer for him as he took on more and more power. And considering his army consists of the Death Star I think he could definitely best any of the other "dark lords".

input: argumenta sobre: An average man gets stuck in a time loop, and the only way to escape is to beat Garry Kasparov at chess. How long until he gets out? Average man has never played chess, but he knows all of the rules. Each time he loses, the loop resets and Garry will not remember any of the previous games, but average man will. Cheating is utterly impossible and average man has no access to outside information. He will not age or die, not go insane, and will play as many times as needed to win. How many times does he need to play to win and escape the time loop? Edit: Garry Kasparov found this post and replied on Twitter!
output: I actually think he can convince him to let him win by convincing him he's a crazy person believing themself to be stuck in a time loop until he "wins" a game of chess against him before beating him on his own merit.

Also it's possible to rip of branches and use those as weapons. Round 3: Arms group can throw the coconuts more accurately. Round 4: No idea. Round 5: I'll assume they have been working out their respective body parts, otherwise this is just two groups of people whaling on each other. In that case, the arms group can do more things with their arms than the legs group can do with their legs, so they win 6/10.
