input: argumenta sobre: A T-800 replaces Frodo as the Ring Bearer. Starting from the Shire, can it get the One Ring into Mount Doom? Round 1: A factory default T-800. Its only directive is to get the ring into the volcano. The Fellowship will try to help it, but they can not reason with it or explain why simply walking into Mordor is a bad idea. If they get in the way, the T-800 will register them as enemies. It does not understand stealth or tactics. Can it make the journey without getting stopped by magic, cave trolls, or simply overwhelming numbers of Orcs and Uruk-Hai? Round 2: Arnold's well-educated T-101 from Terminator 2. It appears human, can converse semi-normally with humanoid races, and does understand stealth and tactics. It will also be far more willing to work with the Fellowship. Round 3: Same as above, but its directive is to protect Frodo at all costs and follow his orders to the letter. Instead of replacing Frodo, it replaces the Fellowship. It can not take the ring from Frodo. Bonus Round: Round 1 but it's a T-1000.
output: Probably helpful to look at what in Middle Earth is physically powerful enough to do a T-800 serious harm: Mumakil/Oliphaunt Cave Troll Olog-Hai Armoured Troll Balrog Various assorted artillery pieces Saruman magic only Gandalf magic only Dragons fire only And a couple which might badly impede it but aren't reliable: The Watcher can certainly grab and eat a T-800, but it probably bursts it's way out Shelob can probably incap it temporarily, but certainly can't kill it Rohirim Lance-point multiple piercing hits will degrade it, each impact probably kills the rider and horse The Witch King, with Fell Beast and massive flail Finally, a few human-sized fighters which might be able to take a few chunks out of it or temporarily hold it up but have no chance individually: Aragorn Uruk Hai Berserkers Uruk and Ork captains Lurtz, etc The Nine So, although a T-800 is far tougher than any member of the Fellowship, it's not infallible. For example, if it follows the route Frodo took, it doesn't even survive FotR - either the Cave Troll or the Balrog destroys it. That said, it can choose a different route. R1: 2/10. It equips a heavy steel bow and sword. It bypasses Moria by taking the high pass, at which point the Fellowship can't follow. Saruman's crows track it, and Lurtz's company is sent to kill it. It fights them off, but sustains injuries - it's peppered with arrows, a bit dented, etc. It makes for Mordor, attempting to climb the mountains. It isn't trying to hide, so it suffers relentless attack by orks, the nine. Once it reaches the plains of Mordor, it gets punched around by dozens of trolls for hours until it's shaken to pieces. 2/10 just in case by some miracle it happens to avoid being spotted. R2: 9/10. Travels with the Fellowship, but due to it's abilities they are more successful, Gandalf still lost, Boromir doesn't try to take the ring, Fellowship doesn't split. Galdriel's gift to the Terminator is a Phased Plasma Rifle in the 40 Watt range. This is then used to dispatch anything and everything which gets in their way. R3: Either 6/10 or 0/10. If it has to always obey Frodo's orders, it's a 0 because Frodo won't destroy the Ring in Mount Doom, and the Terminator will have already killed Gollum. If the Terminator is allowed to disobey him once just to destroy the Ring, it's a 6/10. That's an improvement on the 3/10 I'd give Frodo in the actual story, because it reliably protects him more effectively than Sam, and Frodo's good-sense removes most of it's own weaknesses.

output: From what I've seen of Jim, Cloud wins. He just outclasses Jim in every way.

input: argumenta sobre: Who would win: 4 bloodlusted Dwayne Johnsons with aluminium bats or an adult Grizzly Bear? The Rocks all have aluminium baseball bats and are bloodlusted. Both parties will be given 1 month to prepare. Fight takes place in an open field. Round 1: Aforementioned rules. Round 2: The grizzly is bloodlusted and he is wearing full riot gear, however the Rocks now have 3 Prime Mike Tysons with aluminium baseball bats. They also have an extra Conor McGregor wearing brass knuckles and bloodlusted.
output: The sheer and freakish powe of a grizzly bear would be too much for 4 Dwayne Johnsons to handle. Add to that the blood lust, and it would easily overpower the group of Johnsons. Grizzly Bears are massively strong, agile, and muscularly dense as well as having very strong skeletons. The baseball bats strikes, even from an aluminum bat, would just enrage it more. If all the Rocks could offensively corner him in such a way as to be all hitting him simultaneously with their aluminium bats - with the swings timed only a few seconds apart and in all the right places - then maybe. The chances of that happening are slim to none, even with 1 month prep. Why? As soon as the bear started displaying his alpha posturing, which is as much of an offensive maneuver for them as it is defensive, at least half of the Dwayne Johnsons would collapse in fear. They would cower out to defensive positions. The 2 that are left attacking assuming they are still advancing at this point would likely be charged at. Then it would be an absolute massacre; tossed about like rag dolls, being beaten/pummeled/clawed, and quite possibly ripped to shreds arms torn off, etc.. Grizzly bear 6/10 if he's doing all defense and no offense. Grizzly 10/10 if he is trying.

input: argumenta sobre: Hulk dies in the 2008 film. How much does the MCU change? Let's say that in the 2008 Hulk film, Abomination wounds Hulk much more grievously to the point that, though he still wins, Hulk dies of his injuries shortly afterward. How would this change the rest of the MCU going forward? Can the surviving cast still manage to win in their films?
output: Without Hulk, Loki probably escapes after Avengers and isn't captured, which means Thor 2 goes very differently. Jane probably dies, which impacts nothing directly except perhaps reducing Thor's ties to Earth. It's possible that the Aether is then contained by Odin, but the Dark Elves continue being a threat. Odin keeps the Aether and the Tesseract on Asgard as long as someone is actively trying to collect the stones. It's also possible he uses the power of both stones to destroy the Dark Elves in revenge for the death of Frigga. Without Loki mindwiping him, Odin possibly also doesn't die when he does, meaning Hela isn't released, meaning Asgard isn't destroyed, meaning Thanos may not start collecting the stones when he does, and the whole timeline goes sideways. On the other hand, with Loki loose, we really don't know what he'd do. He's Loki.

input: argumenta sobre: Harry Potter on his broomstick vs. the Green Goblin on his glider The Goblin starts attacking Muggles near the Leaky Cauldron to draw Harry out, because he knows Harry is there. Norman: "Can Harry Potter come out to play?" Harry: "I've seen scarier goblins than you at Gringotts." Harry is 18, post Deathly Hallows. Win by KO, incapacitation or death. Harry is able to get into the air before the fight begins, so they're on an even footing. He has his wand but not his invisibility cloak.
output: Harry Potter has a few one hit kills. In theory he could cast the killing curse however the text says you have to mean to kill for the Killing Curse to work fake Madeye Moody says if every student in the class tried it he might get a nose bleed. He struggled with casting the torture curse when he was wanting Bealitrix to feel pain for killing Sirius Black, so I doubt he could muster the will power to kill a complete stranger. Even if Harry shoots the spell, it does not have instant travel time. Fawkes intercepted one shot, and Dumbledore threw several statues in the ways of others during the ministry fight. Harry has never presented beyond human levels reactions before, outside of being a better seeker than most other wizards, but the Goblin has shown the ability to react much faster. He has dodged magical beam attacks and blitzed a guard pointing a gun at him so should be able to dodge any killing spell Harry fires. Other spells would be a no go. Sectumsempra could do a lot of damage but he has survived getting impaled in the chest by his own glider so should be able to shrug off the massive bleeding for a time. Mind control might work although it can be beaten through sufficient will power and Osborn has fought off mind control before Disarming spell won't do much as much if Goblin's weapons are in his suit, and he can remotely control his glider if separated. Harry's best bet would be to try to activate one of Goblin's bombs, although he has survived his own pumpkin bomb explosions, but I do not recall "hightechus explodicus" being a spell. Norman could kill Harry in all kinds of ways, and I do not think the power of love protects from a glider stabbing you through the back.

input: argumenta sobre: Hawaii declares independence, and the US Navy vows to defend it, the US government is determined to take it back. How long will it take? Hawaii declares independence, and the entire US Navy and coast guard decide to guarantee it's independence. They are prepared to fight without pay. The US government orders the armed forces to take Hawaii back whatever it takes short of nuclear war. -The Navy had two weeks advance warning, allowing them to supply their ships and leave potentially hostile ports. -They were also able to expel all non -naval personal from Hawaii prior to the announcement. -The US Navy is allowed to keep their ports and facilities elsewhere assuming they can hold them. -The Navy was able to transfer the families and love ones of it's member to Hawaii prior to the announcement. -All US allies stay neutral unless provoked, they consider it an internal matter. - Other countries, are allowed to trade or offer other support to the new island nation if they consider it is in their interest and worth the consequences. - The Navy is allowed to invade other countries of they wish, but normal consequences apply.
output: Considering Hawaii imports its food, gas and oil and many other important things, it would be a matter of time, depending on import and coming in from someone like China. I think China would happily help, if it meant the new Hawaiian navy is no longer helping the USA to project power, in which case Hawaii is lost.

input: argumenta sobre: You must fight Batman. You get to choose any one power for yourself for the fight. However, Batman gets to ask 20 yes/no questions to try and determine what power you have. If he guesses it, you lose the power and you have to fight him barehanded. What power can let you win? Rules: - Batman/Bruce will simply be in his underwear with no weapons or armor. You can wear your regular street clothes if you like. - To avoid him instantly speedblitzing you, you start at opposite ends of a football field. - He can ask any question he wants, and will be doing his best to whittle down entire categories by asking things like "will it let you hit me from a distance?" or "will it affect my ability to perceive you?" or "if a 10-year old had this power, is there a reasonable chance that YOU could beat him?". - He gets 3 minutes to prepare a strategy before asking the first question, then 30 seconds after your answers to ask each additional question. - His guess needs to be pretty close, but it doesn't have to be exact. He needs to have the basic ideas behind your powers down, but doesn't need to have the exact incidental details. If you choose "Spawning 143 northeastern bald faced hornets per second out of my left hand" as your power, and he guesses that you can summon or generate stinging insects, that's a win for him. - If he doesn't get your power within 20 guesses, his memory of the conversation will be erased to keep him from deducing which powers you do or don't have, and all he'll know is that he needs to incapacitate you. - Should go without saying, but you have to answer honestly. Edit - I specified in the title that the power is for the fight. I'll clarify that that means you don't get the power while you're being questioned by him. Otherwise you could obviously just take 'person deleting powers' and obliterate him the second you both sit down.
output: Something eclectic.. weird and unexpected seems to be way to win. But depends how exact he has to be? If my power was to cause Batman's fingers and toes to suddenly weigh 40 tons each when I said the word 'daffodil' is it enough for him to guess that my power involves restricting movement or does he have to be waay more specific Or if my power was to equalise us in some way, like by averaging us both out to match each other, is it enough for him to guess the power will somehow weaken him and strengthen me honestly this wouldn't be a bad idea for some kind of game night scenario. If I ever DM again I'll totally try a 20 questions, guess my power type thing

input: argumenta sobre: The Penguins Of Madagascar are tasked to assassinate Megumin Konosuba who has seized all stock and production of the entire Nuclear Arsenal in Russia. Can they succeed? Therefore, the Penguins of Madagascar are here to stop her. â€¢1 Month of prep-time. â€¢They can communicate with humans normally. â€¢Have all the funding they need. â€¢The penguins are in their prime. â€¢They lead a Russian Rebellion, along with Vladmir Putin. input: argumenta sobre: 10 Protoss colossiStarcraft2 vs 500 M1 Abrams tanks The colossi are lore-based vs 500 modern M1 Abrams on a plain battlefield 500 meters apart.
output: it depends on the interaction between the colossi plasma shields and the 120mm bore cannons. an experienced M1 crew can fire 8 to 12 rounds per minute, with an effective range of 3 km. Range in SC is hard to determine, and collosi are anti infantry units, but in game, they fire at about 2/3 the range of a siege tank so it's safe to assume they can fire at approximately the same range as the Abrams. The protoss in SC2 have updated their shields. They don't regenerate under fire anymore, but they regenerate faster while not sustaining damage. Another advantage the colossi have is that they never miss thanks to their advanced AI targeting systems, and their plasma shields would melt the Abrams in one hit. That's like 100 tanks melted per 10 colossi salvo. 500 is still a lot of tanks. if the colossi fight in any terrain that isn't an open field, they would win, especially if they can bottle neck the tanks. in an open field, the Abrams should win, as they can more easily spread out, surround, and avoid being aoe targeted.

input: argumenta sobre: Could Percy Jackson circa The Lightning Thief book win the Hunger Games? He is armed with Riptide from the start but has no other supplies. Can his at this stage largely un-trained powers compensate for his lack of experience and age enough for him to win the Games?
output: Assuming riptide works on mortals, and assuming hes willing to kill the other tributes, he should win pretty easily, assuming no cheating by the gamemakers. Sure he only has a few weeks of training, but that's more than the rest of the tributes, minus the careers. Before leaving for his quest, he won fights against Luke and Clarissa, who were two of the best fighters in camp, and beat the Minotaur. He should also be stronger and faster than everyone else, despite being smaller and younger. Most half bloods naturally have some degree of enhanced physicals. If he finds a water source, it's game over. Water gives him a healing factor, enhanced physicals, and ranged attacks. His biggest weakness is his lack of survivalist training. If he can't find food, he'd probably have to attack the career base to take their's, and there's a solid chance he dies to the land mines. If he can manage a consistent food/water source, he wins 10/10. If he struggles with food, he probably wins 7-8 out of 10, with a chance he dies attacking the career base.

Even without computers, ants if smart enough could possibly gain cultlike devotion from traitor humans and use them as sleeper agents. Imagine ants, who find a way to write/talk to humans, identifying malleable humans and promising them something in exchange for... whatever they want. "Drive 1 million of us in a car to Washington DC, and we will give you the passwords to any person's login to any website you want." He is immediately familiar with the body, so he can has no trouble doing the things he already knows how to do if he could crochet before, he could do it the same now. The other has no physical change but now has all the knowledge of technique and strategy that the elite fighter has. If the elite fighter also knew how to crochet, then so could this guy. Fight is whatever standard fighting they do in MMA, I don't know I've never watched it.
output: As someone who trains BJJ and some striking on the side, the average guy with elite knowledge will wrap the elite body dude like a pretzel before he knew what was going on. Sure the guy with the elite body can start throwing haymakers, but if you have shit form you'll still just be betting on getting lucky. Throwing a head kick is a lot more than being able to physically throw a head kick. As long as they are in the same weight class I'd say mind wins 9/10 times. With the more physical dude landing some lucky punches and getting the KO the 1/10 times.

input: argumenta sobre: Which is the weakest character that can permanently kill Deadpool? There are a few reasons why Deadpool is an "immortal" character, whether it's Marvel science experiments, dealings with death I believe etc With all this plot armor, who would be the weakest character capable of killing him forever and ever?
output: I mean hes not been actually unkillable for a while since thanos took the curse off, so its a matter of actually just stoping his insane healing. Id just say Solem or Wolverine with their muramasa does it.

input: argumenta sobre: If James Bond was transported to John Wick's world, could he survive the High Table? Imagine James Bond is suddenly transported into the gritty, lethal underworld of John Wick. Now Bond finds himself hunted by the High Table, the secretive council that controls the assassin world. How do you think Bond would handle this? Could his spy skills and gadgets give him an edge or would the High Table's assassins overwhelm him? For this scenario, the Bond in question, is Timothy Dalton's version, reimagined as a 28-year-old MI6 agent who has been trained by both Gene Lebell and Jean Claude Van Damme, with special expertise in disappearing without a trace. Oh, and Dalton's Bond is armed with Q branch technology plus a Walther PPK that is only tailored to his fingerprint.
output: So not hunted by Wick himself, but by the High Table so basically put in Wick's shoes during the events of the films. Short answer is probably not. Wick made it through a combination of being an unstoppable killing machine and leveraging key connections/favors in that world. Bonds skills are more suited to spy craft / getting intel / exploiting character flaws of his enemies, and working as part of a broader team; he's not suited to brute force sustained combat on his own and he's rarely the most dangerous person in any given story. Bonds not a super soldier like wick is, and even wick barely survived.

input: argumenta sobre: An ordinary man vs an exact clone of that same ordinary man, but the clone is wearing a Tapout shirt. The ordinary man: Steve Smith. Steve is a 31 year old HR worker from Pennsylvania who hates it when you confuse him with the NFL player of the same name. His hobbies include going to the gym once per month in half-hearted attempts to drop from an overweight BMI to a healthy weight BMI and attempting DIY projects before giving up and hiring someone to clean up his shoddy work. He was married briefly in his mid 20's, but she divorced him and his attempts at online dating since then have been lackluster at best. He lives in a suburban area, drives a Honda Civic, wears loose fit jeans and plain monochromatic T-shirts casually, and has little to no fighting experience. He's watched a few MMA highlight clips on YouTube though, and that one encounter in 7th grade when he came in from the side and shoved a kid down was pretty tough. The clone: The same memories, personality, emotions, and build of Steve... but the clone has a super sick Tapout shirt on. -------------------------------------------------------------------- Scenario 1: Deathmatch. No weapons. Set in a neutral environment without advantage given to either party. Simple yet effective. Scenario 2: Same rules as scenario 1, but now they have an unlimited supply of pool noodles and Bud Light.
output: I don't know, man, the clone might have a slight disadvantage due to all those sweet honeys drawn to the pure animal magnetism of the shirt

input: argumenta sobre: The Avengers encounters a rather violent and unkillable lizard SCP-682. Is there any way they can at least incapacitate, and if possible, kill it? R1: All 6 avengers from the first film minus Hawkeye and Black Widow considering they're basically cannon fodder, 682 would just use them as food. R2: All supers present in sekovia minus Hawkeye and Black Widow yet again. R3: every super who fought Thanos at some point in IW. No one has any knowledge of SCP-682's abilities or nature beforehand, battle occurs at noon on each of the respective film's largest battlefields NYC, Sekovia, and the Wakandan field. All fighters are in prime condition. No prep time. Win condition is near permanent incapacitation, preferably banishment or death for 682, with the latter simply needing to kill or incapacitate all of the characters in each fight. BONUS ROUND: R3 but all have basic knowledge of 682's abilities and nature, with Banner, Stark and Strange all having spent weeks researching every bit of info they have on him before prep time shuri can help too. 2 week prep time for all fighters save 682. EXTREME BONUS ROUND: Same as bonus, but all characters other than 682 are at 3X their current abilities and bloodlusted, have the assistance of doctors Bright, Kondraki, Clef, and Gears, along with MTF Omega-7. 682 teleports straight onto the battlefield after a nice long soak in his acid bath 50% mass. Edit: holy cow, I just got back from school and I had no idea this would blow up like it did. Thanks for all the comments, I love the situations and solutions you're coming up with! As for those asking what 682 is, he's an insanely strong, fast, intelligent reptile who can regen from nearly any wounds and adapt to become immune to said attacks for a short time. If you want to read more, I have the link here
output: In rounds 1-2, their lack of knowledge of SCP 682 proves fatal. At some point the lizard is going to eat somebody and acquire their powers. My bet would be on Captain America. After that it's all over. Round 3 is the same except that Doctor Strange can send the lizard away or trap it in a falling dimension at least for a while. Avengers win by BFR. In the bonus round they have a chance. Tony Stark would be ready with various fire/freeze/acid projectors. Strange would be ready with appropriate spells. Shuri can probably create a vibranium cage or something. The Avengers should be able to incapacitate or imprison SCP 682. If it eats someone Strange is the vulnerable one here, then they might be in trouble. Bonus round 2 they have an even better chance, and can easily incapacitate the lizard. It can't be killed. Period.

input: argumenta sobre: Jon Jones vs every single human in the planet Jon Jones is considered the best MMA fighter in the world and in extension, the best fighter in the world. Meaning if he is put up against anybody, Jones will most likely always come out on top. But can he really? Rules: - No time limit per fight - Every person fights Jon Jones 1 versus 1 - An opponent is defeated if they get KO'd, submitted, becomes unable to fight anymore broken legs etc. or dies - Everytime an opponent is defeated, Jones gets automatically replenished and healed before the next person can fight him - Everybody can fight however way they want to fight as long as there are no weapons - They start in an open field and the fight can go anywhere. If a person was able to drag the fight away from the field and got defeated, the fight will continue to where the last setting was. - There are no limitations to where they can go - Everyone has to fight. If someone doesnt engage in battle within 24 hours, it will be considered a forfeit
output: Being the best/highest rated doesn't mean you never lose. An athlete or team can be the best but that doesn't mean it's likely they'll have a perfect season. There's enough competition in MMA to make it very unlikely Jones will win against all of them. Besides, Jones hasn't fought a lot at heavyweight so it's hard to say if he's the best to begin with.

input: argumenta sobre: Could Trevor Phillips GTA V stop 9/11? Let's imagine that Trevor Phillips, one of the major protagonists of GTA 5, attempts to stop or at least alter the events of 9/11. This hypothetical branches into the following scenarios: 1. Trevor Phillips boards American Airlines Flight 11 the one that hit the WTC North Tower. 2. Trevor Phillips boards United Airlines Flight 175 The one that hit the WTC South Tower 3. Trevor Phillips boards American Airlines Flight 77 That one hit the Pentagon 4. Trevor Phillips boards United Airlines Flight 93 The one that crashed into an empty field after the passengers and crew attempted to fight back. Which scenario would present Trevor with a higher chance of success at either thwarting the hijacking entirely or foiling the hijacker's attempts at crashing the plane into a building? Rules: 1. Trevor must stop the hijackings without dying himself. 2. Trevor doesn't have a firearm so he's left with his fists and any melee weapons he can find. 3. Trevor is allowed to use lethal force against the hijackers on any of the 4 scenarios.
output: If Trevor is on the first plane he can easily stop the highjackers and then turn the plane around to crash it into the second highjacked plane before it hits the towers. Naturally, he somehow survives doing this. The damage is still catastrophic, but the Twin Towers aren't going down. And before anybody who hasn't played the game asks, yes, this is entirely in character for him to do.

input: argumenta sobre: WW2: Nazi Germany with respawning soldiers vs the Soviet Union How would these two powers match against each other if the Nazis had a re-spawning system in place for their soldiers? This ability would have several ground rules; 1. Every German soldier that dies in combat respawns at the nearest German Army Base 2. The respawn ability is only limited to 1 time per soldier. This means that the Â´respawnedÂ´ soldiers cannot respawn again, as they have already used the one-time respawn ability. 3. The soldier respawns with all their equipment/weaponry intact, also removing their previous equipment from the battlefield. 4. If larger units get wiped out together ie. a German tank & whole the crew gets taken out at the same time, they respawn with their tanks intact aswell. Of course this assumes that all the soldiers in the tank have their one-time Â´respawnÂ´ ability ready. 5. German High command are aware of this ability, and can plan their military tactics/strategies accordingly. Meanwhile the Soviets remain completely unaware of this at all times. Suppose Operation Barbarossa starts as usual in June 1941, but Germany can solely focus on it, without France/the UK/the US to worry about. R1: Aforementioned rules; zero outside interference, just Germany and the USSR. R2: Soviet Union gets the Lend Lease program help from the US. Italy helps Germany. Also the German soldiers now have 2 respawns per soldier. R3: Same as round 2 but the German soldiers are now bloodlusted.
output: I think one of the biggest reasons Germany wins this is morale. According to the prompt, German high command are aware of the respawn ability. They will quickly and loudly ensure all their troops know about it, too. A major issue in any conscript war is conditioning soldiers to actually want to fight, to overcome the fear of death, etc. If Germany can promise AND DEMONSTRATE to their soldiers they can't die, it will be VERY EASY to convince men to take on suicidal, heroic efforts knowing they are 100% safe, at least once. Hell, Germany can conscript every woman and child for a single life of duty, knowing they are risking ZERO to their long term population. They could encourage brutal kamikaze tactics, strapping bombs and chemical weapons to kids, etc with no risk. If the Germans are very smart, they can even use this ability for purposes other than sheer attrition. You could, for instance, send a soldier ahead as a spy or as deep recon on what would normally be a suicide mission. Instead, personnel can now traverse FAR deeper into enemy territory and cities for intelligence without having to figure out how to get home or get their findings back to base. Get secrets from deep within enemy territory Take a cyanide pill Respawn at base with the intel in your mind, transmitting it FASTER THAN LIGHTSPEED across an entire continent Also, the prompt says Russia isn't aware of the ability during the fight, but I don't see how that's possible. Because Germany would surely publicize this via propaganda, etc. Capture some prisoners, have THEM kill a German soldier and show them THE MEN THEY KILLED RESPAWNING. "Go tell your leaders, the Aryan race cannot be killed." Massive strike on enemy morale if even a whisper of this is believed.

input: argumenta sobre: How many Episodes of Game Theory does MatPat need to track down the Zodiac Killer Matthew Patrick wakes up in his room. It's all been a lie. There never was a Scott Cawthon. There is no such thing as Five Nights at Freddy's. In the words of Biggie, It was all a dream. With no other lore left to solve, except for Petscop but who the hell could ever solve that, Mat turns his attention to the one lore worth solving: the identity of the Zodiac Killer. He plans to expose the identity of the famous killer through the only means he knows how, Theory videos on YouTube. He will not goof around, like the whole Ness/Sans incident, but will give his true intellect and dedication to his work, as if it were the work of Cawthon himself. How many clickbait-y YouTube videos will it take to uncover the real purple guy, The Zodiac Killer? R1: MatPat is taken to the late 1960's, to piece together this murder spree. MatPat has access to the future internet to post oddly edited videos, correspond with his team/commenters, and research, but no one else can. He has access to all information on the Zodiac Killer that is available, and everyone is compliant with his work. MatPat can't interact with his future victims, directly witness the killer, or prevent their death. R2: R1 but the Zodiac Killer knows about MatPat, and his use of research to stop him, as well as his ability to use the internet/crowdsource info R3: R1 but the Zodiac Killer must confirm at least 2 of Mats Theoriesâ„¢ï¸ R4: the Zodiac Killer forgets all of his previous targets and attacks MatPat directly. MatPat knows this, but must still expose him. Can he do it, edit, and upload the final video before dying?
output: Well matpat is a rather smart individual but he doesn't strike me as a detective, he seems more like a speculator than a straight up detective. He can research but that won't always stop his videos from being more fiction based than fact based. I would be willing to bet he might pin-point someone as being the zodiac killer in about 1000-10,000 videos if he went full conspiracy nut in R1 solely because of his use of the internet and his research and whatnot, but I doubt it would be the actual zodiac killer unless he is lucky. Like I said, he's smart but he is more "find an answer no matter what" then he is "find an answer based in fact" which in modern day works fine because it's just fun speculation and an interesting take on video games, but for this prompt that doesn't pan out too well. Maybe he would take away his "answer at all costs" knowing what's at stake, or maybe that would cause him to try even harder to leap in logic toward an answer but still the odds don't look great. R2-R4 he is probably killed only because a guy with a gun can be an effective killer in almost any circumstance, the internet doesn't make you bullet proof unfortunately. In R3 again if he is lucky maybe he could get a theory confirmed if he researched enough but I doubt it would be a straight "this is the guy" theory. They had a very skilled detective on the case and he didn't figure this out in the slightest, and we're looking at a man who just goes for the theories so it doesn't bode too well. That's my two cents anyway

input: argumenta sobre: How long would it take Ancient Rome to make a Big Mac? In 98 AD, every individual within the Roman Empire is given an obsecely long document listing off exactly how to produce a McDonald's Big Mac. This includes the exact locations of the plants needed to produce the Burger's ingredients, how to properly process them, and how to construct the machinery needed to create the burger. Every person within the Roman Empire is convinced it is their state's ultimate goal to create this Big Mac. No matter the leadership of Rome or status of the state, their goal will remain unchanged they will still fight wars to protect their territory and resources however if needed.
output: It depends on how strict you want your Big Mac to be. \- \- Not Strict: You the idea of a Big Mac, but it doesn't have to be exactly exact. \-- You can do this I'd say in a few decades, maybe 100 years. Wheat was domesticated in the fertile crescent, cows are old world animals and you can make cheese with them, you can get cucumbers from India, make vinegar from wine, trade through the silk road for sesame seeds, etc... With the knowledge of HOW to make all of the ingredients and the locations, that won't be difficult. The issue will be tomatoes. Tomatoes are New World plants. The Roman Empire will have to develop a new method of seafaring to make it across the ocean and trade with the natives for tomatoes to slice for the burger and to make ketchup for the Big Mac Sauce. \- \- Strict: You want a Big Mac, an EXACT Big Mac. Exact ingredients, exact preparations, exact taste. \-- This might take a few hundred years. You'll need to AT LEAST wait a few thousand of generations of genetically modified wheat/tomatoes/cucumbers/lettuce to get the right varieties to have the same taste. They'll have to invent the industrial milling and refining process for white sugar to get the right taste in the ketchup. The cheese is made by blending melted cheeses with sodium citrate and other chemicals, then letting it cool in a flat sheet and cutting it to size. They'll have to invent industrialization and a few different kinds of science to get all the ingredients to perfectly match. \- \- \- EDIT: I've been informed that Big Macs don't actually have any tomatoes in them, and I have realized i was wrong. You don't have to go to the New World for Tomatoes, but you do have to go to the New World for Paprika and cornstarch

input: argumenta sobre: An outside force decides to kill Spider-Man at different points in time across the MCU. How do the movies play out? An outside dimensional force known as "Sony" takes an interest in Peter Parker, and decides to play a little game with him by taking him out of the timeline in order to see how things play out. R1: The portals open just before the battle in Endgame, and everyone is there...except Parker. For some unknown reason, he's the only person to not come back from the snap. Tony becomes very distinctly aware of this as everyone begins to get ready to fight. R2: As the alien ship comes down onto New York in Infinity War, a bridge collapses and kills thousands. Among the casualties is a bus full of students, including Peter Parker. Stark is not aware of his death. R3: Vulture discovers Spider-Man's secret identity at the beginning of Homecoming. Deciding that he's a danger to his business, he destroys his home and crushes him under the rubble. Without the strength to pull himself up out of it and an unlucky impalement through the chest, he dies under the rubble. Stark becomes aware of his death a few hours later. R4: Peter Parker is never born in this timeline. The concept of Spider-Man never exists.
output: Wouldn't R2 and R4 technically be the same thing considering Spider-man wouldn't be a concept till probably the time before Civil War?

output: The IRL Vatican? Hard to say; it's not exactly like they have a bunch of feats to point to one way or another here

SCPs that are usually murderous, like 173 and 096, are now fully interested in ensuring that all the old people in the home living out the last few decades in their lives do so in comfort. All their anomalous traits still apply, so for instance 173 still can't move when he's being observed. SCPs that are places, such as the infinite IKEA and endless staircase, are not eligible themselves but one of each type of anomalous entity is the little slenderman dudes from inside the IKEA for instance. Who does the best job of taking care of the elderly?
output: SCP-4999 When you are close to death and all by yourself, he shows up to comfort you during your final moments.

input: argumenta sobre: Would Batman be able to figure out Omni Man was evil if he took dark wings place in the Invincible universe? If Batman lived in the invincible world and had been a member of the guardians of the globe since Omni Man arrived on Earth, would he have figured out Omni man's plan before his ambush? Bonus round: would the fight have a different result with Batman taking dark wings place? Assuming standard gear
output: Comic spoilers: >!In the comics, when Nolan first arrives on Earth, he quickly ends up in a conversation with Cecil. Cecil, newly in charge of the GDA, is in a kind of desperate state for heroes. After the interview, his experts tell him Nolan lied about everything, but they don't know why. Cecil decides to ignore that since Nolan is acting a hero and he needs heroes.!< Given the above, there is no doubt Batman could figure out Omniman was lying, and if he knew that, he would assume the worst even if he didn't know. Could he do anything about it? Maybe. Maybe not. It depends a lot on what Batman has access to. He'd probably figure out >!Nolan's scifi books!< but whether he could use them, either by finding a way to travel the stars or duplicating them on Earth, is an open question. Edit: All of the Guardians and Omniman are a downgrade from the Justice League and Superman. Red Rush is slower than Flash, War Woman is way weaker than Wonder Woman, Omniman is weaker than Superman most incarnations, and Darkwing is not nearly as smart as Batman.

input: argumenta sobre: Could humans survive a cordinated ant uprising? As you might know, ants have either the same biomass as we have , or even higher than we do. This gives a question, could a organised ant uprising succeed, and what would be their best course of action? The rules are \- Humans are unaware of ant uprising, until it is undeniable few humans dying here and there is not enought, it needs to be entire villages being wiped of the map \- Worker ants have standard inteligence They can not build tools outside of those that they could resonably use, but due to trial and error they could for example figure out how to either chew cables or clog engines \- Logistics still apply for both ants and humans - Ants still have to eat, they can not just teleport across the continent - They could use either captured human food, small animals or even dead humans as sustenance, so it is not hopeless \- Each ant queen gains the ability to communicate with other ant queens, and they have inteligence of a person - This is the only 100% fantasy rule
output: Ants demolish most farming worldwide, cause mass starvation and wars. Humans survive in extremely cold climates free of ants however like Siberia, or Greenland.

input: argumenta sobre: Since this has become an MCU sub, Lets bring it back to basics. Which would win: A very large crab, or a very small elephant. For argument's sake both are bloodlusted. The Crab is about the same size as the elephant, but the elephant is smaller. Let's say Golden Retriever sized. &x200B; R1: Near a water source in the desert. R2: The Crab has a gun. The elephant has Mjolnir. R3: The Crab is actually Thanos as a crab. The elephant is actually Darkseid as an Elephant. Bonus: The crab has an army of regular sized crabs. The Elephant has an army of crab sized Elephants. Bonus 2: The crab is assisted by 5 elephant sized crabs. The elephant is now as large as a Walt Disney World's Cinderella's Castle.
output: I'll start this off with something... Off topic/Meta. I agree. This entire subreddit is just generic stuff like "John Wick is transported to 2012 in the MCU. Can he take over the whole planet?" So i'm gonna say, this is very refreshing. On to the non-meta stuff! R1: The density of the Elephant hasn't changed, and neither has the durability, but for the Crab... It would make sense for it's strength to increase in proportion to his size, and once a crab grabs you... It likely won't let go. See, as a former Crab nerd, i'd list off the different types of Crabs that have an edge in this situation, but, it doesn't matter. In my personal opinion, Crab wins, 6-7/10. R2: The Crab is just straight up powerless here, in any given situation. First off, i'll assume you mean the... aforementioned MCU version of Mjolnir. This version of Mjolnir is crazy powerful, and the Crab is finished in a few hits. Assuming the Crab doesn't hit the Elephant with the gun first, Crab looses. If we're talking COMIC Mjolnir, Crab's really screwed, possibly more than before. If you mean the Mjolnir of Norse legend, the Crab. Will not. Last. A second. This thing can level mountains in a single goddamn swing. Don't fuck with mythological Thor. Elephant wins 10/10, 10/10, and like, 100/10 on the last one. R3: Thanos, in the comics at least, isn't too terribly powerful compared to comic Darkseid. He has all kinds of stuff though. Super strength, INSANE LEVELS OF INTELLIGENCE, Telekinesis, but in the end, Darkseid is far superior to him. Even with "The Infinity Gauntlet" that everyone has lost their collective minds over, Darkseid Elephant wins 10/10, every time. Because Darkseid does not yet have a cinematic version, and MCU Thanos isn't as strong as comic Thanos, i figured i'd make things more fair by using comic Thanos. I'd do the bonuses but i have important 70's punk rock to attend to.

input: argumenta sobre: George Washington leading the modern US military vs. General Ulysses S. Grant leading the modern US military Alternate dimensions collide. There are two clone copies of the United States military in 2020. One is on the east coast and the other is on the west coast. The one in the west is led by Grant and the one in the east is led by Washington. Both magically have the supplies, logistics and resources of America in 2020 behind them. Both can parlay with foreign governments. One must wipe out each other. Who comes out on top? Grant or Washington?
output: Assuming each general is in complete control how how the war plays out and are bloodlusted, I give it to Grant. From my knowledge, Washington wasn't a particularly amazing general. Grant is a West Point graduate and is commonly known as a military genius, especially with logistics and troop movement. Also, Washington probably would have a much harder time trying to figure out how technology works compared to Grant who at least could understand the basis of modern technology.

input: argumenta sobre: Lex Luthor gets his deepest wish. He's teleported to the world of "The Boys". Can he take down "The Seven" and Homelander? Its Lex Luthor's wet dream. A world where "Superman" is an amoral prick and he's right, that's also a capitalist paradise for him. So Lex vs The Seven. Lex is sent in with no money and only his wits. He doesn't even have clothes. Can he: A Build up Lex Corp there? B Kill Homelander and mount his head on his wall C Set up his own Super Identity or Team in place of "The Seven". Can be him or not, his preference. D Get the loving adoration of the public.
output: Luthor is a supergenius. He'd be able to start his own company and build it up till he could just buy Vought himself. Also, Lex is used to much stronger foes, he'd definitely figure how to kill most of the seven seeing how most of them will die if shot in the head. Furthermore, homelander is not as strong as Superman, a nuke will kill him as well as uranium bullets. Worst case scenario Lex becomes president and nukes Homelander. Best case he makes some fancy bullets and hires an assassin. Since Superpowers are made in this universe Luthor would probably be able to reverse engineer it or create his own. He could definitely get the love of the public with good PR

input: argumenta sobre: Character Scramble Season 19: Final Destination Voting is live! Click HERE to vote for the winner of the season, who will be crowned on May 28th, 11:59PM PST. --- The Character Scramble is a long-running writing prompt tournament in which participants submit characters from fiction to a specified tier and guideline. After the submission period ends, the submitted characters are "scrambled" and randomly distributed to each writer, forming their team for the season. Writers will then be entered into a single-elimination bracket, where they write a story that features their team fighting against their opponent's team. Victors are decided based on reader votes; in other words, if you want people to vote for you, write some good content. The winner by votes of each match-up moves on to the next round. The pattern continues until only one participant remains: the new Character Scramble champion, who gets to choose the theme, tier, and rules of the next Scramble! The theme of Character Scramble 19 is Super Smash Bros. Round prompts will be based on the many Nintendo franchises represented in Smash, along with some of its third party offerings. --- Hub Post Rosters Join the email list! Join the Character Scramble Discord! --- AUDI FANAAAAAAAAAAM You're finally here. You stand on the precipice of the world you've sworn to save. You've made strong allies, faced powerful foes, braved vistas terrible and sublime. Indeed, you've done well to come this far. Victory, and the salvation of your world, is within reach. But just as you reach out to grasp your prize, it extends away from you. Hundreds of crystal steps sprawl into distant space, into a swirling nexus of worlds. One final sprint. THE GREAT MAZE Time is of the essence. The enemy team is making their final moves, and each of you have a lot of ground to cover. Make your way through the stages, overcome the challenges within, and emerge victorious. Be warned though, that not everyone can make it through. As you progress through the Great Maze, your characters will fall one by one, until the last one standing is crowned. There will be no stage select, no bans and counter picks. You will be making your way through all of these prompts. After all, the best sets always go to five. As you take your first steps into the maze, you're greeted by glaring sunlight. Rolling hills and checkerboard patterns sprawl into the distance as palm trees sprout from the verdant earth. You feel the pull of gravity as you approach a slope that leads intoâ€¦ is that a loop-de-loop? STAGE 1: GREEN HILL ZONE As you try to make sense of the twisting paths, however, the enemy team arrives. Suddenly, you feel time itself attack. What you're doing here isn't a normal fightâ€” it's a race. You're Too Slow! This match is a race to the end of the zone. The last ones past the goal post are the first ones eliminated. Green Hill's Looking a Lot More Like Sand Hill! Of course, Green Hill Zone is notoriously overplayed. If you wish to set the race on the deserts of Tatooine or through the mountains of Mordor, by all means. What matters is that you race to win. As you pass the goalpost, the checkerboards dissipate and the grass grows wild. Clouds hover just above, so close you could touch them, and the crests of great cliffs tower in the distance. STAGE 2: GAUR PLAIN The ground beneath you trembles. You look up and see a giant approaching you, ready to fight on behalf of the opposing team. But, big as that baddie is, you can't shake the feeling you might be fighting on something even biggerâ€¦ You Will Know Our Names: You've stumbled into an area that's way above your level. Not all of your teammates are making it out in one piece. The Bionis and Mechonis: It's giants all the way down. You're not only fighting against a titan, but you are fighting atop even bigger giants, locked in the aftermath of their battle. Describe this setting. For both of these, you can choose whatever giants best fit your setting. However, as it is the 10th anniversary, you are strongly encouraged to take a look at the titans of the pastâ€¦ After slaying the giant, blue skies and green grass give way to stormy clouds and barren wastes. You trudge through the night, until at long last, atop an imposing mountain, backlit by the full moon, you seeâ€¦. STAGE 3: DRACULA'S CASTLE An ancient evil, once thought to be vanquished, casts their gaze towards you. They seek revenge for their vanquishment, and are even willing to work with the enemy team to ensure they enact their tollâ€¦ A Terrible Night For a Curse: You will face off against an opponent from your past, someone you have faced in a previous round. They're stronger than ever, and they're not happyâ€¦ And they are committed to enacting their vengeance. Monster Mash: Though not strictly necessary, Dracula's Castle does often include a menagerie of spooky creatures waiting in the wings. Fill these out as little or as much as you please. But, because it's the finals of the tenth anniversary, take a look at some of the monsters of ages past for inspirationâ€¦ After defeating your enemy in their lair, you walk deeper and deeper into the castle. Plunging beneath the earth, you feel yourself leave this plane of existence. In the distance you see a light, a single roomâ€¦ and the sounds of mighty beasts. STAGE 4: LIVING ROOM The way forward is guarded not by any titans or lords of the undead this time. Instead, a panel of judges watches intently, waiting to be impressed. If you wanna get through, you're gonna need to be the best in show. And to do that, you'll have to adopt a cat or a dog to defeat your opponent's cat or dog in a contest! Here are the wonderful animals just waiting to be adopted! CATS | DOGS -----|-------- Xiaohei |Den Catra | Legosi Old Hob |Infinite Nepeta Leijon | Doggie Krueger Puss in Boots | Chewbacca What The Dog Doin? That's right, it's Nintendogs/Cats time. Your team must prepare one of these furry critters to fight against your opponent's furry critters in a dog/cat competition. Get Outta Here! Go On! As attached as you have become to you have certainly become to your furry friend, they cannot stay forever. Becauseâ€¦ After all the trials and tribulations, only one team member remains. Reality falls apart around them as they hurtle through space, witnessing the collapse of stars, the birth of cosmos. They have reachedâ€¦ FINAL DESTINATION It all comes down to this. One final battle. For the sake of the world. And more importantly. To become champion. No Items. Fox Only. Final Destination. By this point, each of your teams are down to their last member. Write a 1v1 to end the set and claim your crown. Whether your team selects a champion, or the rest have fallen, it comes down to this final match. Omega Form: You can tackle the previous stages in any orde you want. You can even merge them together if you want. But Final Destination is the Final Destination. No gimmicks here. Just a brawl till the very end. --- FINAL ROUND VS FIGHT
output: The following is a work in progress and is not yet finalized. Will edit the post later with the full story. Apologies for the delay! Health problems have made progress slow.

input: argumenta sobre: Ross Geller takes a character on the worst date imaginable. Which character, if any, agrees to a second date? Ross's terrible date will include the following: Ross will be wearing his leather pants from "The One With All the Resolutions" and his pink shirt from "The One With the Birth Mother." He also has his luminous white teeth from "The One With Ross's Teeth" and half-really heavy tan from "The One With Ross's Tan". Throughout the date, Ross extensively shares information including: his marriages to and divorces from Carol, Emily and Rachel, his children with Carol and Rachel, being Monica's first kiss, dating one of his own college students, and the events leading up to/during/after his breakup with Rachel putting much emphasis on the 'on a break' debate. He will also ask them whether they would rather drown or be burned alive, and accidentally call them 'Rachel' on various occasions. input: argumenta sobre: The Avengers MCU all mysteriously disappear before the first film and Fury has to scramble enough replacements to replace them can this back up team defeat Loki? While Nick Fury is creating the Avengers initiative all of his candidates vanish off the face of the earth and now he needs to find some replacements and fast! and let's say to make the prompt interesting Nick drops Captain Marvel's pager and broke it so she can't show up and solo the fight. Can this last second team still save New York and defeat Loki? If they do how does the team continue if it does at all? Ghost At this point she was still a secret agent for S.H.I.E.L.D. and is recruited in exchange for a cure for her condition War Machine Mark ll He's no Ironman but you find a better guy in a robot suit at short notice The Red Guardian Risking an international incident S.H.I.E.L.D. breaks Alexi out of prison with promises of diplomatic immunity and acceptance back at his motherland The Winter Soldier Since the end of the world is bad for business the shadier HYDRA-ier parts of S.H.I.E.L.D. pulls some strings to wake up an old soldier to fight again The Abomination Nick promised Blonsky some time off his sentence if he did some... community service A squadron of Hammer drones This is how you can tell Nick is really desperate
output: Okay this is going to get weird. I'mma break down the characters real quick, and then see how they deal with the final battle since Loki probably skips from Germany to New York with no Avengers to fight. Our New Dark Avengers: Ghost. Cool powers like Intangibility and Invisiblity along with enhanced Strength. Really good skill set and powers along with ablility to sneak into Stark Tower and shut down the Laser and maybe even fight Loki. A better Black Widow War Machine might be better than Iron Man in this scenario. Nothing Tony's suit can do that Rhodey's can't do just as well if not better since Tony's not just going to leave his buddy in the dust. Rhodey trades those cool red lasers for fire power. Just a note, at this point in the timeline Rhodey would be using an unrebranded Iron Patriot so that's what Imma be using so it's sleeker, not too bulky so it's speedy and has no issue with the icing problem. He might do everything Tony did but better. Red Guardian. Basically a shitty Steve Rogers. Good fighter and strong as fuck but he's got nowhere near the leadership skills or self sacraficing nature of Steve. He might actually hurt the team in one respect. Winder Soldier. Good at killing and not much else. Bucky isn't really Bucky right now and no one is going to recongize him past Red Guardian and Alexei is not fucking liking him if he finds out about what he did to Natasha one time or if they met in the old days. He and Alexei could blow the team up if they don't have their heads on straight whether Alexei uses the chaos to kill Buck or if Buck thinks Alexei might do that so he kills him to make the mission easier. Abomination is a better team mate but a worse combatant. Abomination seems to be okay with reforming as Shang Chi showed us and it's been 4 years since Harlem so he might be pretty chill. Overall the only defect with him seems to be that Hulk was super fucking eager to wreck shit during Avengers 1 which might hurt Bolonski's chances but he can and will be directed better so it's a coin toss. Hammer Drones are okay to be used. I honestly don't see a single one of them surviving. Justin Hammer didn't really even design them and his involvment might not be the best descision for anyone and Tony and Rhodey beat the shit out of them in scores. But let's talk about benefits, mostly that Justin if involved will follow all of Nick's shit to the letter. He is going to be super scared of Nick offering up only offering up a passive resistance. So now group dynamics: OG Avengers had a good dynamic after blowing up fast. Cap was unequivically the leader with a great tactical mind, Thor and Hulk were powerhouses capable of mass destruction, Iron Man was a great utility and gadget player with good moblity, Hawkeye was their eye in the sky and Black Widow was deadly as hell along with the most mission focused playing a instrumental role in ending the conflict. Now here's the group dynamics come in. They kinda worked well together. Clint and Natasha were already friends, Tony isn't so much of an ass that he couldn't work with anyone and is able to pull of being a snarky prick so it doesn't so much interupt team stuff along with already working with Widow and ending up with an okay relationship as time went on, Cap is Cap and did the right thing letting Hulk be Hulk who also saved Tony I think because Tony was nice to Bruce and wanted him and Hulk to become Professor Hulk. Thor was also super able to pal around with everyone. Now our Dark Avengers are uh not that. While the Avengers might be described as a ticking time bomb, this team might implode mid mission. I already mentioned Winter Soldier and Alexei's shit but let's break it down further. No one is friends with anyone on this team. We've got: Career military dude Rhodey who knows how shit supposed to work and defacto leader who is not going to get along with Justin Hammer at all or Red Guardian. Might get along well with Ghost and Abomination though. Rhodey though is a great leader but the challenge here might be too big. Will do his best and might pull it off. Justin Hammer is not the biggest detriment to the team suprisingly. He's not going to be liked and Rhodey and he might have tension, but Rhodey isn't going to blow the mission cause of him and Nick can easily keep him in check. Honestly Alexei might like the dude just to mess with him as "little buddy". Ghost is probably an okay team mate. She's not evil in anyway and just wants a cure which is going to drive her. She, Rhodey and Abomination might get along real well. Abomination is going to be okay with anyone on this team. He rehabed pretty well assuming he's been doing this before Wong and won't do anything to really upset team dynamics. Winter Soldier is not going to really do anyone wrong. He's there to kill and that's about it. He'll creep people out sure but he's not going to mess anything up. Alexei might blow this thing for the whole team. Dude will be absolutely convinced he should be the leader and might undermine Rhodey's chances of leading the team efficiently. He will absolutely not get on with Winter Soldier at all and might try to fight him there and then. Okay so fight: Rhodey is pulling triple duty here since with no Thor or Cap, he's taking on leadership duty, and trying to fight the most and biggest people since he's the big gun. Ghost and Winter Soldier are probably doing Black Widow and Hawkeye stuff but I think both of them realize pretty quick their talents are better served trying to close the portal rather than limit civilian casualties. Ghost might actually do the most civilian saving here since she's not a bad guy and will listen to Rhodey but Buck's b lining for Stark Tower. The Hammer Drones take over for Tony suprisingly well. They issue is that they have the same issues as the Chitari. They can't bank worth a damn and I don't think the expert piloting of Justin or even SHEILD agents could make up for it as opposed so as the fight goes on their effectiveness at keeping that perimeter is going to go down. Abomination does what the Hulk does and maybe saves a few civillians in there as well but he might not take out as many Leviathans or Chitari as Hulk. Alexei can maybe keep up with Cap but after giving the Cops their instructions might go after Loki too. So Loki first faces off against rather than Thor or Hulk, Winter Soldier and Alexei. And he does really well against them. Loki fought Thor in a losing effort twice and threw the fight against Cap in Avengers 1 so he's a stronger but weaker than Thor against 2 Cap ish level dudes. They don't pressure him enough to leave the Tower like in Avengers 1 but what they do do is buy enough time for Ghost to get there. Ghost finds Selvig and he tells her about the Staff. She tells Rhodey and everyone B-lines for Loki especially since at around this point, the Hammer Drones are probably all dead. Loki loses to everyone here and Ghost gets the staff. Coucil launches Nuke, Rhodey intercepts and launches it through the portal. Alexei and Winter Soldier take each other on. So yeah, they can win but only if a Loki doesn't kill Alexei or Buck bThey hold him off long enough for Ghost to get there. c Alexei and Buck don't kill each other. &x200B; Also Rhodey is going to have to put in a super human effort here to put all this together and their is going to be so much more civillian casuallties.

input: argumenta sobre: "Zombie" apocalypse but it's dogs and cats Instead of ppl turning into dumbass corpses, infected ppl turn into dogs and cats all different types, including animals like wolves and lions. The dogs and cats will not turn on each other like actual zombies. Dogs and cats will act like their animal self other than mindlessly pursuing humans. If a dog infects, victim turns into a canine and if a cat infects, they turn into a cat. Infection is via bite, scratch or excessive licking. Current dogs and cats will spread transmission and are now "zombies" but tbf, they won't spread transmission until 72 hours after initial attacks. Patients zero is a cute puppy in NYC in Central Park at peak times and another in Beijing as a stray cat during peak times. Ppl turn within 10 mins from bites or scratches, but excessive licking can take 24 hours provided the dog/cat saliva does enter the body and just stays on the skin. Does humanity survive? Bonus: humans that turn into cats and dogs still have their human brain/mindset. They can choose to side with humans by not "infecting" others. They can also now speak their native language. All current/wild dogs and cats will still be animals and try and turn humans. Edit: the cats and dogs are NOT zombies. They're normal cats and dogs. They act like their normal animal self. That's why licking is a way of transmission because a dog or cat can be affectionate that way
output: Cat's are min-maxed predators. They're literally the perfect animal to do this.

input: argumenta sobre: What characters could absolutely humiliate Hannibal Lectre using only their intellect? And how? I was rewatching Hannibal and at the beginning of season 3, he makes this snide little comment about how what he does isn't cannibalism because he and the rest of humanity are not equals. As in he's so much smarter and better than everyone that they are beneath him. So it got me curious. Who in fiction, without necessarily using superpowers, could run circles around Hannibal? At the end of season 2 they make this big deal about "if you think you're in control it's only because Hannibal wants you to think that" Well who could actually be in control but make Hannibal think that he was? Who could manipulate and plan in such a way that by the time Hannibal realizes the truth, he'd be forced to admit he was an idiot compared to them? The Sherlock types are great detectives but I don't see them as master manipulators or strategists. So who? And perhaps as importantly how? A few quick rules: no mind control or other such super powers. And no direct physical confrontation until Hannibal is already mentally beaten down and broken by whatever genius thing they did to dunk on him.
output: There are a few Batman villains that would be good at this. Namely: Hugo Strange. As a psychologist he wouldn't be phased by Hannibal's tactics of manipulation and as a super genius himself who likes to experiment on people I imagine that he would have a lot of fun in deconstructing Hannibal in Arkham. It might take a few years, but in the end Hugo would recreate Hannibal into something more to his liking. Probably something a lot worse. The Riddler. The Riddler is absurdly smart. Too smart even for his own good as he is very insecure about himself. The idea that Hannibal would consider himself more intelligent would probably drive Edward crazy and to prove himself superior, I imagine he would construct an insane death trap based on a logic puzzle so intricate that Hannibal couldn't possibly escape. The Joker. The Joker would prove he's more intelligent by breaking Hannibal's mind during regular therapy sessions. Hannibal would probably agree to therapy sessions with the Joker too because he'd be trying to do the same thing back. Unfortunately for Hannibal though, I can't see him ever besting the Joker in a battle of wills.

input: argumenta sobre: 1 German Maus Tank WWII super-heavy tank vs 100 Sherman tanks US WWII medium tank. The Maus has an elite German tank crew, tank aces. The Sherman's have average combat tested crews. They have been in combat several times before and are well trained, but not considered "elite". Terrain is flat and lightly wooded. Just the tanks are fighting, no other combat units or air support around. Both the maus and the Sherman's have a mix of AP shells and HE shells. Maus is loaded to the brim with extra shells. Maus could hold 68 shells for the main gun and 100 for the secondary 75mm gun, but I imagine it could hold more if the crews tried to stuff it. Who wins?
output: Sherman easily. 1. It's tracks aren't any stronger other tank, could be disabled by normal weapons. 2. It still only has one turret but two cannons, so it can only target one tank at a time. It would maybe knock out a few Sherman but then gets disabled by returning fire. Sherman would shoot the tracks to immobilize it first, then aim for turret ring to jam it. Sherman could hit it with concentrated white phosphate shell until Maus was either set on fire or crews all died from inhalation burns. Tank back then didn't have overpressure NBC system.

input: argumenta sobre: All zinc in the universe is transmuted to copper. Can humanity survive? A cosmic being transmutes all the zinc in the universe to copper. No new zinc can be produced by any means. Biological processes that require zinc are modified to no longer require it, but other than that, humanity must make do on its own. Can we survive? How much damage does this change do? R1. No warning. R2. Humanity gets a year of warning.
output: I think humanity would survive. For a start, there are small tribes living in the middle of nowhere without any metal. But, more generally, not that many critical things use zinc. Zinc is often used in corrosion protection. So even in round 1, humanity has some time before problems appear. Ships and bridges start rusting faster without their sacrificial zinc, but they don't rust overnight. Some electronics probably breaks. Especially with the old and less used zinc batteries. Brass becomes pure copper, and is somewhat weaker but doesn't break down instantly. White zinc oxide paint turns into black copper oxide. A few industrial processes probably explode. There will of course be a bit of panicking and supply chain disruption.

input: argumenta sobre: Who is the weakest character that could beat Rand al'Thor in a head-to-head fight? They start 100 feet apart from one another in a grassy valley. Rand is unaided at his peak channeling ability before fighting the Dark One. Mountain level feats, can level or delete cities. He is alert, no waiting for him to fall asleep to just stab him. Balefire works, and Rand won't refrain from using it. Ta'veren works insofar as someone would feel compelled to bend to Rand's will, but no plot armor. Bonus round: Epilogue Rand, but I'm not sure it's even possible to beat him then.
output: I'm not sure who it would be, but the categories of that person would have to be someone with psychic abilities, reality warper or speedster. I can't remember if he had a angreal or sa'angreal at the battle at Algarin's Manor. But he was weaving hundreds of weaves at once. Post veins of gold it is heavily implied that the Light itself is what merged his memories and kept his Madness from getting worse, so a psychic attack might or might not work. Balefire is lightspeed, but draining enough that he can't spam it. So a sufficiently fast character might be able to dodge it and get in close for a kill. Reality warper would have to be sufficiently strong enough to counteract his Ta'veren property. Ta'veren is plot armor though, just codified as an in universe property. Reality warps in his favor, but he doesn't directly control it. As for post Last Battle its hard to say. We see him use one ability on an extremely small scale with no explanation or how or why it works. He's definitely a reality warper at this point, but we have no idea on what scale. And ibdont think he would want to explore it much. He'll use it to make life easier, but I do not think he'll ever use it offensively. His character arc is done, he doesn't want to be anyone special ever again. He goes full circle to being a simple shepherd again.

input: argumenta sobre: Adult Aang masters every bending sub-skill blood bending, combustion bending, etc. and takes on the MCU. Can anyone stop him? In addition to his standard power set, he's capable of any specialized type of bending exhibited by any bender across ATLA or LOK. -He can bloodbend at any time of day like Amon -He can metal bend -He can lava bend -He can shoot explosions from his head like combustion man -He can generate lightning -He can heal if he has access to water -He can fly like Zaheer Can upgraded Aang go toe to toe with the MCU's heavy hitters? Round 1 - Aang will not kill and will only use blood bending as a last resort. Round 2 - Kyoshi takes Aang's place and gets all the same upgrades. She is in character aka bloodlusted.
output: Aang is cool and all but there is way too much here he doesn't have any defense against, especially not on the scale they can bring it: Nanotech Space ships shooting from orbit Modern/Scifi weapons in general Gamma radiation Reality warping/probability manipulation Telepathy Ring portals Soul jacking Mirror world and other magic bullshit Etc. Also there is no reason to believe most of his stuff would have any effect on characters like Hulk and Thor. Sure metal/blood/fire bending can hurt normal humans, but these guys shrug off tons of stuff that would kill or restrain normal humans. It would be like saying guns work on Hulk because they work on normal people. They don't though, that's kinda his thing.

input: argumenta sobre: All range weapons stop working, including guns, bombs, aircrafts, submarines, nukes... etc. Who would dominate the world now? No possibility of using any modern weapons, and no possibility to fix or manufacture them. Cars, ships and planes are possible to use for transport, but any intention of using them to kill someone would cause them to malfunction and stop working. It's a melee game, and the world is at an all out war. Who dominates who?
output: Dominating the world would become several orders of magnitude more difficult, and likely nobody would. In this scenario, defense just got much easier and offense much harder. You can still develop regional dominance if you can get places with melee weapons. Since the prompt eliminates aircraft and ships that are weapons, I'd assume it doesn't disallow transport air and ships. If it does the entire nature of the question changes and nations that depend heavily on importing food and fuel - China being the biggest example - are screwed. If the prompt doesn't allow you to transport infantry forces on unarmed ships, then my suggestions below are changed. While these circumstances tilt the field towards regional powers, few of the high population countries can exploit it. China is fairly hemmed I. By geography. If it decides to conquer it can get to some places, but its bigger rivals - Taiwan and Japan - just got stronger because now it lacks capacity to project power to them. It can put lots of soldiers on transport vessels, sure. That's vastly less effective than being able to fire missiles and weapons, but But those vessels are more vulnerable than ever. Defensive technology like mines that do not move on their own seem like they'd still work. And when they get to the beaches, defense infrastructure is even better. America likely is the biggest loser, though. America is the world's strongest military but it's actually mostly a naval power. That asset just vanished. It can no longer rain hell with a carrier group or interdict trade routes at will. America remains mostly impregnable due to geography, but its ability to protect power is gone. It would develop a lethal infantry force that can defeat anything generated in the western hemisphere. But it would face the same challenges China does in projecting that power. While those two superpowers are losing in this world, others gain. If you have access to resources over land, a good geography, a decent population and the ability to move against enemies overland, you'll gain. Russia has a decent population but is in the early stages of demographic collapse. It can defeat Ukraine in a melee war, but the cost will be higher than ever and cripple it long term. Its ambition may end right there. Poland, however is currently in a better spot than ever to defend itself and maybe even project a little power. It's relatively young. It has the problem of access, though: its geography is not that defensible. Turkey would be in a great spot. It has proven a warrior culture and has an enviable geography. It would rise in power in this world. France has something of a defensible position and a strong population. Germany, like Russia, lacks the people to be anything more than a regional power. If you're an island nation, you're vastly more defensible, but island nations have always relied on using naval power to get what they want. That's mostly gone. Japan, UK, Australia and even the United States are net losers to some degree. Sure nations like the Americans and Brits would absolutely develop crack Marine forces, which seem possible by the rules of the prompt, but that is so much harder and more expensive than pounding an enemy through the air. May not even be worth the costs. Geography matters more than it ever has. Anyone with overland access to its rivals is also accessible by its rivals. Israel would be in trouble but will adapt to highly refined defensive strategies and high quality infantry. Nobody on its borders is getting to it easily. By the rules of the prompt, explosives are still working, you just can't fling them through the air or otherwise project them. So nukes likely still function if you truck them somewhere and detonate them. Countries with those weapons would be able to nuke other countries but they can't fire them directly. They have to get them to their enemies. In all, everyone got more defensible, America is going to withdraw from the eastern hemisphere but increase its reliance on the western hemisphere. Europe sort of becomes old school Europe with many countries bordering on each other all of whom can attack each other. The Middle East probably has the most defensible geography. It will be able to expel any foreign force it wants to, but also cannot particularly expand. I know countries always were able to project power pre-industrial with largely infantry based melee forces. But these are vastly differing circumstances. Those forces did have ranged weapons. Those forces fought in times where explosive devices didn't exist. No mines. Castles took decades to build. We can build defenses much faster now with modern construction materials and equipment. Defense is vastly stronger and offensive capabilities hugely clipped. Overall this likely creates a more peaceful world because the cost of conquest is so high.

input: argumenta sobre: Who is the weakest Marvel Mutant that could attain the 1 Hero spot in MHA? MHA/616 Marvel's mutants run the gamut of powers, from being weaker than normal humans X-Ceptional to being strong enough to destroy the universe Franklin Richards Pretty wide scale for something caused by a single gene... but whatever. Where on the scale of Beak to Legion would a mutant have to be in order to attain the 1 Hero spot in MHA's Japan? For the sake of the prompt assume that the mutant in question will understand Japanese and understand how the world works. Mutations and quirks are functionally identical, so stuff like Eraserhead works on the mutant. The mutant wants to be the 1 Hero, even if the mutant would normally be completely uninterested in such things. Personality remains, so those without charisma would still have no charisma, but they'd be trying to be a hero.
output: It's always going to be Kitty Pryde. In every single prompt about the weakest marvel character that can do X. You even narrowed it down to mutants. Mirio was considered to be on fast track to becoming a future All Might, and Kitty's modern control over her power is several dozen times better than his. Unlike Mirio, kitty can stay phased 100% of the time while still seeing, hearing, and interacting with the world through selective unphasing. She can also phase other people and objects. Doing things like phasing a rock into someone and leaving it behind, or phasing a person into the floor and abandoning them there. She can reach into someone's head and snap her fingers, knocking them out even if they're hulk-durable, and has before. She has also manually performed brain surgery on the hulk with her bare hands. It's always Kitty Pryde. Always.

input: argumenta sobre: 40 forty year olds or 60 sixty year olds? - 10 ten-year-olds - 20 twenty-year-olds - 30 thirty-year-olds - 40 forty-year-olds - 50 fifty-year-olds - 60 sixty-year-olds - 70 seventy-year-olds - 80 eighty-year-olds - 90 ninety-year-olds - 100 hundred-year-olds You can hand pick your combatants so that they are elite trained or blood lusted or whatever.
output: 40 40 year olds easily. A world class fighter in peak shape at 40 isn't far off from a similar 20 year old fighter who's a few years from their prime. The numbers advantage would be insane. 20s wouldn't stand a chance since it's a straight up 2v1, and 30s would still be outnumbered. 50s don't outnumber 40s as much, and age really starts to catch up in your 50s as opposed to 40s.
