I know the current American election system might be a mess when there are over 40 candidates, so let's just assume the one who gets the most votes wins. All of them have all the info and knowledge they need about the modern world and politics. Both parties stay neutral, and every living politician or celebrity can support whoever they wanna support. All the living presidents Clinton, Bush Jr., Obama, Trump, and Biden won't participate. Edit: I forgot that Carter's also alive.
output: The people yearn for Teddy Roosevelt. George Washington probably wins on name recognition alone though.

input: argumenta sobre: Hand to hand combat - could anybody, present or past, beat a UFC Champion? I saw a Reddit post today asking if an ancient Spartan warrior could beat a modern-day UFC champion like Jon Jones and almost unanimously people said no. Got me thinking, is there anybody either currently or previously alive at any point inside or outside the MMA world that you believe could hold their own or beat a UFC champion with all the best modern training, nutrition etc in pure hand to hand combat? Here's the conditions: - Open arena the size of the Colosseum. - "Beat" I'm gonna say fight to the death or until the other person simply cannot fight any longer. No holds-barred, no DQ, no ref, nobody stepping in. - No weapons, no gloves, no other body protection. Just trunks and hand-to-hand combat, any type of striking, dirty tactics allowed as mentioned. - Would have to be in the same weight class or it just gets silly. - Can also include a general "best of" in your proposal for the other fighter. Example, Khabib vs "the best Roman gladiator from this time period" or "the best Templar knight from the crusades" just examples. - No mythical figures like Hercules etc. So there we go, the very best UFC fighters from the last 10 years, fully fit and ready to fight. Can anybody from any point in time beat them and if so, who?
output: same weight, no armor, no weapons? beating a modern UFC champion is a hard ask. The human body can only move efficiently in a few ways. There isn't some long forgotten secret that people in the past knew we don't know today. people get knocked out when hit, pass out when choked, and roll around in pain when limbs are broken. Fighting mechanics have always been the same. A jab and right hand is the most efficient way of throwing a punch from point A to point B. So no, based on boxing alone, there aren't any people that would punch better than modern-day boxers. Therefore, the same applies to mma. only exception would be a freak genetic knight heavyweight who would somehow overpower John Jones, but the chances are minimal.

output: Probably something that could fly. A Xenomorph born from a land dwelling animal would have limited mobility while a Xenomorph born from a bird or something would...well fly. A normal flying Xenomorph is already a hazard and a half But a flying Queen Xenomorph would not only be a flying fortress but would have the means to lay eggs almost everywhere

input: argumenta sobre: How long would Superman realistically last in our world. Superman in this case is from Kansas and grew up there. We won't consider about the possibility of the alien ship landing elsewhere cus if that happens, there won't be any superman. Superman is real and in our world now. His powers are also very real and so is everything related to him and krypton, including kryptonite. How would we realistically feel about Superman? What would happen to Superman if he first shows up as a hero? Would we cheer for him or try to kill him? Did one for Batman already. Now Superman. This is Superman from the comics btw. We are also going to explore what Superman would be doing in our world.
output: His secret identity won't hold up at all, between billions of people with social media, millions of cameras and multiple world governments all with a vested interest in figuring out who he is, the connection to Clark Kent will be figured out quite quickly. Once that connection is figured out, the US government will get involved, and it's hard to predict exactly how that will go down. Superman often breaks laws, but popular support might mean he's not ever charged or found guilty. Many people will think he's a god as mentioned elsewhere - and he essentially is. Many people will want to study him. Many people will make the argument that he has a moral onus to humanity to be studied and or provide unlimited power or any other myriad of arguments. Him saving people will almost certainly have constant side effects and backfires, it won't be all roses. People will understandably fear him, people will want to use him as a weapon. People will demand that he act as a weapon e.g. go solve the problem in the middle east, or with Russia, or whatever.

I would give it to Doc Ock though because his arms are better long-distance and he can probably overwhelm Grievous here.

input: argumenta sobre: The modern day USA is transported back in time. What is the latest year that they could appear in where it could still be possible for them to conquer the entire world alone? No fission/fusion bombs, anything else is fine. R1 They must be able to declare war on every country on the planet, and make them concede defeat. R2 They must be able to declare war on every country on the planet, and either install a puppet government or fully occupy every last one of them.
output: Uhhh today? If you remove nuclear weapons as a deterrent, what is stopping the US from subjugation the globe today? The US doesn't get involved in easily winnable conflicts because it doesn't want to risk nuclear war. North Korea, Pakistan, Russia, Iran; these nations exist as they do because the US views an escalation of conflict with them as a prelude to nuclear war. There is no guarantee that the US would win vs the world today. I'd say...it's a 7-3 in favor of the US Edit: So this is in response to everyone saying "the US couldn't even defeat poor farmer in -insert country here-". Yes, we did defeat them. The US failed in Vietnam because we lost the political war at home. The people didn't like the war. But the US was going to win that war if it kept going. We were slaughtering Vietnamese fighters left and right. Vietnam is still trying to recover from the 3,000,000 Vietnamese people who died in that war. While the US lost 58,000. And Afghanistan was an even bigger win for the US. We outright kicked rhe Taliban out of the country for over a decade. The Taliban spent 2010-2021 hiding in Pakistan and only briefly reentered on occasion before the US withdrawal.

input: argumenta sobre: John Wick vs. Jason Bourne vs. James Bond My boys with the J's are out and I'm curious who is the best. Each fight is a 1 v 1. Just want to know who would win the most. Round 1 - Hand to Hand Combat in your schools cafeteria Round 2 - Same as Round 1 but bloodlusted with a knife. Round 3 - Each is equipped with a pistol of their choosing. Takes place in a Walmart with opponents on opposite sides of the store. All bloodlusted. Bonus - Each is assigned to assassinate each other. Can they all complete their mission? This is happening at separate times as well So they aren't tracking each other at the same time.
output: If we are using Craig's Bond I think his ass would get handed to him by Bourne. First Bond in comparatively bad shape, Skyfall references how he failed his physical testing, but M passed him anyways. Second it is suggested in the fourth Bourne film the one with Jermey Reiner that Jason Bourne has been genetically/chemically enhanced in some way to grant him above average physicals and senses. So if it comes to hand to hand combat no matter how bloodlusted either of the two are I think it would fall in Bourne's favour. In pure hand to hand combat I think Wick loses to Bourne for the same reason that Bond does, Bourne is faster, stronger and by far the best at improvisation. While Wick might beat Bond I think for the two of them it could potentially go in the opposite direction I give it to Bourne. Wick's suit, well it grants him a considerable edge, by being bullet proof when it comes to the Gun Fight. Other than that I don't think his Gun-fu grants him such a massive edge, for we have seen Bourne fight against armed opponents in close contact and win. Well Bourne is most likely to retreat when the odds are not in his favour, that's also why he has survived the length of time he has being hunted by the CIA. I could honestly see Bourne going up against Wick discovering that Wick is a master at Gun-Fu and wearing a bulletproof suit, realizing that he is at a disadvantage, then after temporarily incapacitating Wick disappearing into a crowd and later hunting Wick from a safe distance, with a sniper rifle. As for Bond in this scenario goes down first, A lot of these comments are stating that MI6 / SIS would be able to instantly track down Bourne, I don't think that's the case at all. The CIA perhaps the largest and most well funded intelligence organization has spent over 10 years being throughly and completely embarrassed by by Bourne. He even at once point broke into the office of the senior agent not sure if it was a deputy director or not that was hunting him and called the said agent from said office after leading them on a massive wild goose chase. So no I don't think Bond as cool as he is could honestly hunt down Bourne. As as reserved as Craig's Bond is in comparison to the other bonds, he is still the tuxedo wearing, Aston Martin driving, Martini drinking high profile target, were as Bourne is able to far more able to disappear into a crowd, and hide in plain sight, a skill he demonstrates in every film. Wick as good as a he is at tracking criminals I don't think he holds a candle to the MI6 trained and backed Bond or the sheer and frankly superhuman skills of Bourne possesses when it comes to hunting and tracking people. Short answer I think Bourne wins this.

input: argumenta sobre: Which is the weakest sci-fi civilization that can defeat a Viltrumite Invincible invasion ? Round 1: ''Human'' sci-fi civilization Round 2: Aliens
output: Round 1: The Dune universe would give viltrumites a run for their money. Their shields make them completely invulnerable to Viltrumites, unless they make their fists travel slow enough to get through the shields. But realistically, Viltrumites fight so much faster than Dune humans that there's a good chance they'd never discover this. In terms of weaponry, I'm not sure how strong their lasers are, but they can trigger nuclear level explosions by shooting lasers at their force shields. Combine that with actual nukes, precognition and the weirding way, and I think they'd do surprisingly well. Round 2: Precursors from Halo destroy the Viltrumites, it's not even close. So do Forerunners. The Covenant though would probably struggle. But if they unleashed the Flood... it would be terrifying to see Flood-infected viltrumites.

input: argumenta sobre: All countries declare war on each other and start annexing each other, which counties cease to exist and which ones come out on top? Rules: First 6 months require no war crimes After a year and a half of fighting war crimes are allowed Three years in countries are allowed to bomb major population centers of enemy countries 10 years in nukes are allowed, but only one a month Countries won by controlling 75% of each country their trying to conquer, or until a country surrenders Countries are allowed to ally with other nations 4 years into the war Each country gets a month of prep time, but can't attack until the month ends
output: The United States has a massive lead the entire time. They're virtually uninvadable from the east or west, and their military is way stronger than Canada's or Mexicos. They quickly annex most of North and South America while China and Russia their only real competitors until nukes get unlocked eat each other. As war crimes and bombs get unlocked, they leverage their superior defense budget and the weakened state of their two main competitors and clean up.

input: argumenta sobre: Death Battle 189: Omni-Man VS Bardock Invincible VS Dragon Ball Z Battle Link >!It's time for the new season of Death Battle, this time fully independent! Been looking forward to this and from all the discussion in the previous thread, I was definitley going in with the impression that this would be a stomp in Bardock's favour.!< >!In terms of Analysis Omni-Man's was pretty much the same gist as his previous battle with Homelander but with some extra stats and calculations, no issues there and very well edited. And Bardock's seemed pretty in line with other Dragon Ball analysis. Was cool learning more about his story since I'm not very well versed in Dragon Ball, and I felt it definitley made him out to be more powerful than Omni-Man, especially when they started acknowledging non-canon feats.!< >!The fight itself was awesome. Sometimes the models looked a little odd but the action, the music, the voice acting and especially everything happening in front of that star at the end was awesome. Really happy they're still able to keep up these high quality animations.!< >!Aaaaand the result. Did not expect the Omni-Man win and I think that's gonna be pretty controversial, especially when a lot of the pros for OM seemed to be based off the super high stat calculations. output: Scaling for Nolan will definitely be the most controversial part of the episode. The Sun Disc is example of probably the most divisive type of scaling. Some folk love stuff like that, while others consider it a perfect example why many calculations are such bullshit and ignore author's intent to highball the characters.

input: argumenta sobre: A man who is only 25% as strong as the average man but knowledge of every fighting style Versus a man who is 4 times stronger than the average man but only knows how to fight from watching a single Rocky movie. output: Strong guy is, what, 16 times as strong as martial arts guy? You could make a case for martial arts guy being able to dodge most of what strong guy has to offer, but he's not going to be able to do any meaningful damage with 1/4 of a normal man's strength and sooner or later he's going to be OHKO'd. Strong guy wins 9/10 times because there might be some obscure thing with pressure points I'm not aware of that might give martial arts guy a chance.

input: argumenta sobre: Robert Downey Jr. as Tony Stark challenges Robert Downey Jr. as Sherlock Holmes to a game of chess Inspired by this scene in which Robert Downey Jr. as Sherlock Holmes plays chess with James Moriarty. R1: normal game with zero prep time R2: both given one week of prep time R3: Tony Stark challenges Sherlock Holmes to a fistfight after the match. He remains unarmored for the duration of the fight. Can Stark defeat him?
output: I think Holmes wins every round. He probably plays more chess in general, but he's also much more of a guy to think and plan ahead than Stark. Stark is brilliant and reactive and can think his way out of situations but in terms of knowing your enemy and entrapping them with a plan, I think Holmes is better. We've seen Holmes fight, I don't think Tony with no armor stands too much of a chance. He knows some moves but he doesn't have the same fighting instincts, plus most of his combat revolves around flying and repulsors and things, he's gonna be out of his element.

input: argumenta sobre: Tiger VS Human This post is mainly to settle an argument between me and a buddy. Some background information: My buddy is a power lifter, about 6'4, 225 pounds of pure muscle. Can deadlift about 605 pounds, squat about 500, and bench press about 365. He insists that in the scenario of a fully grown tiger charging after him, he could kill it. His technique is to put his arm up, let the tiger bite his forearm then gouge its eyes. He does admit that he would probably lose his arm, but in the end he would win. I insisted that the tiger would easily obliterate him in one swift move but he still strongly believes that he would come out victorious so it's time to settle the argument.
output: Your friend is severely underestimating the force of the Tiger charging him. Forget the teeth and claws - It'd be basically like being hit by a small car. Good luck stopping that by holding your arm out in front of you. input: argumenta sobre: The US military vs. a self-aware crab the size of Maine So for context: I had a dream that a crab-worshipping cult summoned a crab from beneath the arctic, and it took the entire whole of humanity to generate enough spiritual energy to defeat it. However, if this were to really happen and it was just the US military, could they stop Megalocrab? Rules: Both sides are bloodlusted. The crab begins its assault off the coast of New York City. Round 1: no nukes Round 2: nukes are allowed Round 3: MEGACRABAGGEDON!!! 50 crabs, each the sizes of one of the US states, begin their assault on the world. Could all the people in the world stop them?
output: Maine is 320 miles across. A crab is about 1/10 as tall as it is wide. The crab is 32 miles high. Its eyes sit comfortably in the mesosphere. The Mariana Trench is 7 miles deep. The crab barely gets its claws wet while crossing oceans. It can walk over Mt. Everest and not even notice. Even if the crab can only cover its body length once a minute, it is still moving at like 19,000 miles per hour. The air pressure alone wipes most of the East Coast. The world is fucked from this thing just existing. Good luck trying to hit it with any sort of munitions as hurricane force winds, tsunamis, earthquakes, and the actual crab cause chaos for hundreds of miles in every direction. Even if you cut everything in half and then cut the speed in half a couple more times, I don't think there's anything anyone can do. Just the mass of rotting meat wherever it dies would probably release enough gases to poison the air for hundreds of miles.

This is reflex, combat and movement speed btw Force of a great typhoon - The strongest typhoon was Haiyan so you can generate a localised storm around yourself covering an area of about 100m around you in all directions with winds of up to 195mph you can sustain this speed for a minute, slower speeds can be sustained for longer Strength of a raging fire - You're able to fire thermal blasts of at least 3,000 megawatts, but you can potentially go up to 13,500 megawatts if pushed Mysterious as the dark side of the moon - You emit a perception altering energy that affects anyone that is looking at you or able to hear you. Anyone looking at you will be unable to distinguish you clearly, only seeing a blurred, perpetually warping shadow that they cannot pinpoint the distance or position of accurately; anyone that can hear you, while they can hear what you say, cannot identify your voice or its point of origin as to them it appears to shift and alter continuously. Your identity can never be discovered unless you freely offer it. Now that you're a full fledged man, who's the strongest you can beat?
output: With enough time, I could probably solo Modern Earth, perhaps a few other low-power settings as well.

input: argumenta sobre: Kevin McCallister Home Alone is now a youngling in the Jedi temple during Revenge of the Sith. Can he beat Anakin? Kevin, protagonist of Home Alone, is now a Jedi Youngling with the appropriate level of training for his age. He is reasonably talented but not some sort of force genius. The moment all the adults in the temple are out of reach, Kevin intuits, via the Force, that Anakin has betrayed them and is coming to kill everyone. Can he set up traps capable of stopping the future Darth Vader? Kevin has been putting together partial, incomplete traps for the past year just for fun, without knowing what it is for and rapidly puts them all into effect when he realizes he needs to stop Anakin. Assume that Kevin is favored by many Jedi and extremely resourceful and was therefore able to obtain anything a Jedi could plausibly give him to use for his traps. Kevin himself cannot flee the temple. He must either kill Anakin or incapacitate him in some lasting fashion. If Anakin's precognitive abilities and danger sense make this a stomp, assume that all of Kevin's traps contain some sort of special material or cloaking field that prevents them from being predicted by the Force, or that Kevin has some sort of unique force ability that makes it impossible to predict traps he set up using the force. Anakin can use his speed or other abilities to try and escape them, but will receive no precognitive warnings about them whatsoever and is unable to search for them using the Force even once he knows they're there. In all rounds, there are no Jedi Masters or adults in the temple even after Anakin enters, of course. Anakin will not receive, and cannot draw on, any outside help whatsoever - he has his standard gear and nothing else.
output: Kevin got caught in the end didn't he?

If a character is absolutely no, then Naruto can pummel them as many times as needed for months on end to make the killer lose the will to continue. Round 1: Jason Voorhees. This is the character that brought me to this idea. Jason is a lot more tragic than other horror villains, and is seen sometimes showing, er, compassion? I don't know if that's the right word. He spares kids IIRC, people who look like his mum, and even let a boxer take his best shots at him. Round 2: Freddy Krueger. Now, this one is absolutely a hard no, but talk-no-jutsu is often used after Naruto beats the antagonist to a bloody pile, so could Naruto continue to beat on Freddy, torment him or bully him, to make Freddy chill out or lose his fear factor? For example, Freddy was weak after being forgotten as seen in Freddy v Jason. Round 3: Micheal Myers. Granted, I don't know much about this character, but he's popular so I factored him in. Round 4: Art the Clown. This one is an even harder no, but similar rules as with Freddy. Could Naruto defeat Art time after time for the clown to eventually say "fuck this" and give up?
output: The other commenters are right in that Naruto's talking skills only really work on people who are open to his arguments, but if you want a proper anti-feat to seal the deal, look at the recent issue of Naruto X TMNT. Naruto fails to talk down Shredder, and I feel like any conversation he'd have with a horror movie slasher would go similarly.

input: argumenta sobre: Smallest country that can remain completely self-sufficient for a year? What is the smallest country that's able to sustain the below conditions for a year? If that proves trivial, what is the biggest country that could successfully pull it off? Which country could survive the longest? Rules: "Smallest" is by population size. The country must be recognised by at least one other country Sentinel Islands do not count and must be either a sovereign country with an internationally recognised government or a dependency thereof with at least some self-governing capacity. Hong Kong counts in the latter category, Taiwan in the former. The country must be completely sealed off from the outside world for one year. No imports and no exports will cross its borders, and no travellers. It may communicate with other countries but no transfer of any goods or people. The country must start immediately and is given no opportunity to prepare or stockpile beforehand. The year begins at the best possible time in most cases just before harvest. The country may devote more resources, land, and labour to farming if necessary so the fact it currently doesn't grow all its own food is not necessarily a disqualifying factor or to other essential services, as it sees fit; it may also consume reserves of any resources it does have. The country may also modify its system of government, laws etc. to suit its needs. It may take any other steps to meet demand encouraging or enforcing energy conservation, victory gardens, etc.. Countries' self-sufficiency depends on at least the following: food, fuel, medicine, electronics, sources of income, and any other essential imports of any kind. Self-sufficiency means the country may not necessarily function normally, but must function stably. Excess mortality due to starvation etc. cf. North Korean in the 1990s must be negligible. Social unrest must be minimised, and if the government is overthrown the country loses. A country need not be strictly self-sufficient i.e. sustainable; so long as it can keep itself going for a year, it's fine if it consumes resources or technology faster than it can replace it.
output: So, fun history fact. The rationing done by the UK in World War 2 is well known, but less known is that the British government was fairly certain that they would be completely cut off from imports and wanted to see if they could sustain themselves entirely on their own domestic agriculture. They did several indepth studies by various research groups, and the consistent finding was they could easily sustain the country on a very sparse ration of meat, grains and fats, supported by a large supply of easily grown vegetables, particularly root vegetables, Potatoes, turnips, radishes, etc. These could be grown in massive amounts, enough to give a more then adaquate supply to every person in the UK, but it came with a few downsides. The amount of time needed to eat enough to get all the required calories doubled, as well as a 'remarkable' increase in flatulance and feces. Regardless, they proved repeatedly, in small scale testing, that you can sustain a large population on massive supplies of root vegetables, which are easily grown in such numbers. Things never got bad enough for them to put what they learned into practice, but it gave the UK confidence that it was basically impossible to 'starve them out' if it really came down to it. They could simply fall back on mass production of easily grown vegetables and that would be enough to keep everyone healthy and active.

input: argumenta sobre: Jaws 1975 vs. Orca 1977 > "The Great White Terror vs. The Vengeful Killer Whale â€” who rules the sea?" --- The Setup: Location: A wide-open stretch of cold Atlantic coastal waters, near a fishing village. No humans involved, just a straight-up animal brawl. Both are bloodlusted, in their prime, and aware of each other's presence. Bites through metal cages, barrels, and wooden docks. Survives multiple injuries and high-powered weapons until the finale. Shows intelligence in stalking and ambushing prey. Strengths: Massive bite force and powerful jaws. Apex predator instincts. Incredibly stealthy and fast underwater. Takes a lot of damage before going down. --- ðŸ‹ Orca â€“ Orca 1977 Stats: Species: Killer Whale Length: 35+ feet Weight: 6â€“8 tons Known Feats: Destroys ships and fuel lines. Hurls humans into the air. Bites off limbs and kills great white sharks. Demonstrates emotion, intelligence, and targeted revenge. Strengths: Larger, heavier, and more durable than a great white. Highly intelligent and strategic â€” learns from experience. Can leap, tail-slap, and knock enemies out of the water. Thick blubber and strong bones offer natural defense. --- ðŸ§  Fight Breakdown: This fight isn't just brute force â€” it's strategy vs. savagery. Jaws is faster in short bursts and more relentless, but Orca is smarter, stronger, and used to fighting large prey and threats. Orca can outmaneuver Jaws, strike from above or below, and use tail attacks and slams. Most real-world encounters show orcas dominate sharks, flipping them upside down or targeting their gills. Even if Jaws gets a bite in, Orca's bulk and intelligence will likely turn the tide. --- ðŸ† Verdict: > Orca wins 8/10 times With superior size, intelligence, and marine mammal strength, Orca would likely kill Jaws after a brutal battle â€” possibly using tactics like stunning blows, grappling, or drowning it via disorientation. Jaws puts up a bloody fight, but Orca swims away victorious.

input: argumenta sobre: Average man vs. Conor McGregor, but every 10 seconds time stops and Conor gets kicked in the nuts by a 12 year old. MMA rules, in an octagon. Average sized, reasonably athletic 12 year old boy wearing shoes. The kid take his time and get into the best position to deliver his kick. But if Conor freezes in a position where his nuts are totally inaccessible, the kid has to kick as close to the nuts as he can get. R1 - Conor is wearing a cup and knows that every 10 seconds he will feel the pain of a nut shot R2 - Conor is not wearing a cup and has no idea why he feels a shot of pain every 10 seconds EDIT: R3 - Since the consensus is McGregor wins easily, in round 3 he has no cup, no warning, his opponent is now a 6 foot 200 pound 25 year old former high school football player and mma fan who still works out regularly, and the fight starts with a nut shot. Can Conor still win?
output: It's a tie. Hear me out: Connor stomps his opponent in under 10 seconds, but is bothered for the rest of his life by inexplicable testicular trauma. Every 10 seconds, it feels like someone is kicking him in the nuts. He goes to the doctors, who are clueless about what could be happening. Eventually, he gives up, having been driven mad by the pain. He uses painkillers which get him addicted and kicked out of the UFC. He becomes homeless and destitute, racked by excruciating pain and unable to get a moment's rest. He is tired beyond belief, and wishes only for it to be over. input: argumenta sobre: Dante Devil May Cry vs. Doctor Doom 616 My son and I are playing Capcom v. Marvel as I type this and he asked which of these guys would win so I told him I'd ask you guys. input: argumenta sobre: Could Percy Jackson circa The Lightning Thief book win the Hunger Games? output: Riptide can't harm mortals, only monsters and gods, so that's basically useless. First book Percy is also at his weakest, and a few weeks of training at best. Let's also keep in mind the Gamemakers, who might not notice the waterbending Percy pulls off thanks to the Mist, but will absolutely screw him over to keep things interesting. He also probaby won't get sponsers for at least the first few days since he randomly replaces Katniss the day of the Games. Best case scenario- Percy manages to grab a sword and supplies from the Cornucopia, runs to the nearest body of water, camps there, and the Gamemakers ignore him forever, and he wins the Games. Worst and more likely scenario? Percy tries to get supplies and weapons but gets butchered by the Career Tributes. If he manages to escape, the Gamemakers notice when he stays away from all the fighting and camps near the lake, so they turn the water to poison or fire to keep things interesting.

input: argumenta sobre: What would happen if Gothem was a real city in the US? So to any comic book reader it is abundantly clear Gothem is a shit hole with few redeeming qualities. You have like four or five active serial killers running around one of which likes mass murder. The courts are corrupt AF and never put down the villains despite the fact so many of them would get executed in 2 seconds irl, ESPICALLY JOKER. And there is quite literally a place called "crime ally" where if you go there you will be mugged and shot. Why does anyone live here? I mean seriously is everyone ok with dying by some lunitic every few days? That aside, lets say Gothem, Batman the villains and everyone are all real. How would our government restore peace and civility and make Gothem a "nice" place to live. Is it even possible? Even places who suck balls to live in irl like Detroit do not have mass murderers running around everywhere. And genocide isn't carried out once every few days. Could anything be done about Gothems situation?
output: With all the metahumans, the first time Batman brings them in, the government would probably start experimenting on them in order to replicate their powers and make super soldiers. A spy with Clayface's powers would be the most useful espionage asset on the planet, with the ability to shape-shift into and imitate anyone. There is a lesser known Bayman villain naked Mr Bloom, who can give people superpowers, and has many himself. He can shoot fire, freeze objects, shape shift his fingers into blades that can puncture metal and kill humans. He can produce these seeds that if consumed, can give another person similar powers, and the more people ingest these seeds, the more powerful he gets. They would capture Mr. Bloom, Bane, Professor Pyg, Mad Hatter, and Mr Freeze, and get them to produce the labors of thier scientific exploits. The US would soon get access to things like super powered soldiers, freeze weaponry, and mind control devices. Professor Pyg is so skilled in surgery, he can graft a man's foot where his hand would be, and have the nerves still work and let him control it like normal. He has also given people minor super strength with his experiments. With Pyg's expertise, and Bane's knowledge on how to make venom, supersoldiers would pop up almost immediately. After they get Mr Bloom, they can use him to make even stronger superhumans with better powers. Croc wpuld probably be expiremented on for his strength, durability and healing factor. The US military would become exponentially more powerful, with venom enhanced soldiers, better weapons, mind control, new bioweapons with fear gas, and super-powered men and women that can shoot fire. A new world wide arms race would occur, with other countries trying to steal the research and specimens the US has to allow them to create super powers and all these new weapons. If they ever find out the secret to Poison Ivy's powers, they could create a surplus in food by creating larger, more efficient plants. They would probably take Joker to, for his immunity to toxins and laughing gas formula. Gotham would only be left with only organized and normal criminals, as all the ones with legitimate superpowers and the ones with advanced tech would be either kidnapped or assassinated by thr government.

input: argumenta sobre: Who would win: Kipchoge running a marathon, or 42 fresh Usain Bolts running 1 km each? Eliud Kipchoge runs a full marathon 42.195 km solo at his standard pace. Against him is a team of 42 Usain Bolts, each one running exactly one kilometer before being replaced by a fresh Bolt for the next. Every Bolt is in his prime and starts their leg fully rested. There are no delays between transitions. All participants run on a flat, paved course with standard road racing conditions. The competition is strictly about who finishes the full marathon distance first.
output: The bolts win pretty easily, I suspect. Kipchoge's record pace was 2:52 per kilometer. That equates to 2:17 per 800 meters. 2:17 for 800 meters is "mediocre to bad high school runner" times. If you believe Bolt, he says he ran 2:05 800s in training, which is not that hard to believe given that his 400 time is under 50. I don't see any chance that Bolt can't beat 2:17 once for 800 EASILY and stretching that another 200 meters for 1k would not add 38 seconds.

input: argumenta sobre: An average grandma, 80, with no gaming experience vs. Red Dead Redemption 2 in one month With guidance of a grandchild, could a regular ol' grandma of the age 80 with no gaming experience beat Red Dead Redemption in one month. We assume 8 hours of play per day with weekends optional depending on rest arthritis. Bonus round: Beat it to 100% Edit: I fucked up. What about a year??
output: My former boss was pushing 60 when I showed him a screenshot from modded Skyrim. He asked where the picture was from and I told him it was a game. The next day, he told me that he had bought Skyrim, and asked how you win. I told him that you can set your own conditions for victory and that the game was broad enough to allow him to decide when he was winning on his own. The next day, he asked how to get out of the tower, the one that you run into immediately after the dragon interrupts your execution, and I told him to jump out of the window. The next day, he told me that he had beaten Skyrim. Since I had told him he could set his own victory conditions, he had decided that getting into the keep and getting his hands loose was a victory for him and he went back to his reptile keeping as a hobby.

input: argumenta sobre: All of the Avengers are translated into their literal names. Who wins? Iron Man: A man made out of Iron. He is sentient and living, and his body won't kill him instantly or whatever. He's just a man made out of iron, though. Very heavy, very durable, very slow. Captain America: The captain and leader of America. Otherwise known as Donald Trump, currently. He has the access to the Secret Service won't have access to the entire army or nukes, to keep things balanced, and is trained in both basic hand to hand and small firearms usage. Thor isn't being included because the only definition for Thor is the Norse god of thunder, and that's too overpowered. Hulk: A massive, sentient ship. It is made of wood. Bulky, and slow, but incredibly large and somewhat durable. Hawkeye: A man with a single eye identical to a hawk's. No other difference from a normal person otherwise. Black Widow: A black widow. Doctor Strange: A regular man. He acts kind of weird and has a PhD in medicine. Black Panther: A black panther. What else? Ant-Man: A man who is similar to an ant. He has six legs, antennae, and can lift up to 10 times his weight. Captain Marvel: The leader of Marvel Comics - Stan Lee, naturally. Assume he's still alive. input: argumenta sobre: Smaug vs IRS Smaug, known for his giant hoard of accuired riches, never paid any taxes on it. The Taxman comes calling assume the enitrety of Middle Earth is legally under IRS Can Smaug successfully protect his gold WITHOUT using any violence, with his words and possibly knowledge of law alone? Round 1: Smaug is cornered at his nest by the tax collector, after he failed to answer multiple summons. No prep time, the IRS agent is tax-lusted Round 2: Smaug has 6 months of prep time, and is given the entirety of the tax code in a dragon readable book form, as well as the entirety of Tolkien's books and notes. EDIT: After all your excellent responses I thought about it some more and came with another problem: What EXACTLY Smaug took from the dwarves? - at least a trillion gold coins worth of hard currency - at least several billion gold coins worth of jewellery, gilded works of art and precious cultural artefacts - an entire city of real estate - several different operational mines - probably the greatest industrial forge in the Middle Earth - several hundred smithies, casting equipment, and related industrial machinery - the palace of the King of the Mountain and the Vault - which were government property so, it was kind of a hostile privatisation? Smaug had not paid tax on ANY of it. In how much trouble does that put him?
output: I doubt the IRS in middle earth have any means of proving which way he acquired the gold, or whether he got it before or after tax codes were implemented. He could simply state he's acquired it before tax codes were implemented and they'd have no way to prove otherwise. With the tax code assuming that doesn't work, he could just claim that the gold he has was inherited from friends/family dragons. In the US only 12% of states have an inheritance tax, I doubt middle earth would have implemented one. A third option Smaug could take would be declaring the halls of Eribor an independent state via a Declaration of Independence, meaning he doesn't have to pay taxes to the IRS of a foreign power. And thus wraps up the three easiest ways I see Smaug weaseling out of paying his taxes.

input: argumenta sobre: Will humanity survive if they were averaging 170 meters in size? no physical side-effects If humans were 100x bigger, like originally since 270,000+ years ago, will we even survive up to 2025? What would our lives and adaptations be like as absolute titans? There won't be any physical side-effects & difficulties like the obvious "gravity crushing weight", or "can't breathe", etc.. the humans and their remains simply scale by 100x and keep functioning on a relative level i.e. as if you're normal, this includes the height of fall damage being scaled by x100, dung size, red blood cells, movement speed, appetite, etc.. Just from a pure resource availability and compatibility perspective, how would or could humans survive on a tinier-looking Earth? Will we rely on literal wooden broccolis for food, will we overpopulate the Earth quicker, are we even able to make transistors in the first place, or will we die of hunger as soon as we get scaled up? \Note: To know what's that like for the American people out there: if we scale up the average person's height of 1.7 meters up to 170 meters x100 - that's like \1.83 Statues of Liberty tall, or about 50 average alligators, or almost 37 Toyota Corollas stacked on top of each other, or more accurately 895 bananas.\
output: So since square cube law doesn't count... I still don't think humanity would survive. Elephants would be relatively smaller than chipmunks. The tallest dinosaur ever would be 1/10th our height. A Blue Whale would be 1/5th. like the size of a small dog. Needless to say, meat is out of the question. even a few humans would eat every creature big enough to catch our notice into extinction. Plants aren't much better. Sure, there's more mass available, but the amount we'd have to eat every day, trying desperately to get enough calories out of... wood... which we are not built to digest, is staggering. Frankly, I'm not sure that even a lone human could possibly ingest enough calories in a day to not starve to death, much less have a breeding population manage to sustain itself.

input: argumenta sobre: To spite anyone who thinks 2020 can't get any worse, gravity is doubled starting tomorrow 9/1 for the last 4 months. Can humanity survive? This means that it's harder to stand, harder to walk, everything functionally weighs twice as much, etc. Not only that, the stress placed on vehicles and structures by gravity is twice as strong, with all the issues that entails. The infirm now need that much more help to get by, and assumedly many animals with non-fatal terminal velocities now suffer fall damage. Etc etc. How broad is the devastation resulting from this, how do people cope, and can humanity survive until 2021? Edit: To clarify since I'm seeing confusion, on January 1st, gravity returns to normal. It's essentially a 4 month endurance round. Bonus Round: The gravity increments by 1x every month until the end of December.
output: The moon, the tides, earth's orbit, buildings, cities, towns are in chaos. If the entire Universe's gravitational constant doubled, many neutron stars, some within our own constellation, would create a singularity 5.972 Ã— 10^24 kg/sq inch, subsequently resulting in massive bending in the space-time continuum. This would create black holes and supernovas, resulting in copious gamma ray bursts threatening our thermosphere and ionosphere. The event horizon for black holes would double, so they would be much more dangerous as well. The strength of the gravitational constant is what keeps the atmosphere and oxygen on Earth, preventing diffusion into the vacuum of space. Now the air would be significantly thicker at the surface of the planet. Thicker air results in larger insects, but they are the least of our worries. Our bodies and bicuspid valves are made for this gravity. We can last in less gravity with some acclimation, but not more, especially not double. We're fucked

input: argumenta sobre: Batman vs. Tony Stark in a prank war After a heated discussion in The Inventory over whose smarter, Tony drunk, of course decided that the best way to end the argument is to see whose the better prankster. Batman, exacerbated from the hours of awful arguments from Drunk Tony, gives up and just agrees to this. The winner is the person who had the most successful pranks within a year. They have access to any and all of their equipment. R1: Both parties can dedicate all of their time to creating and executing pranks, as well as disarming enemy pranks. R2: The Prank War is just another part of their usual routine. While Batman is out solving crimes, he also has to be on the lookout for Tony's pranks, and while Tony is doing Avengers stuff and creating his suits, he has to be on the lookout for Bats' pranks. A prank can include any practical joke, from re-programming the batcomputer to call Bruce funny names, to rigging up one of the Iron Man suits to force Tony to do the chicken dance.
output: I feel like Tony would win because he has the better sense of humor. Batman is more sardonic and subtle. He's more about reacting to other people's mistakes and stupidity. Tony will have a three story teddy bear delivered to the Batcave. In a Batsuit. Or will develop a nanotech hologram drone that will fly into the batcave looking like Batman's worst enemy and the slap a pie in his face. Batman won't find any of it funny and will consider it juvenile. But he doesn't really do "pranks." It's just not in his wheel house. Tony once turned a do good nerd scientist into a insane world dominating villain by pranking him to the roof. He stopped a conference with the entire media of America to eat a Whopper. He throws parties while wearing his suit and lets models try out the hand guns, does break dancing in his power suit, and has his goons break into some rando kids' garage and give him the equivalent of a Mad Scientist Makeover. These may not all be Pranks in the sense of "got you!" but they are Jackass and Pranked! style feats that show he's playful, fairly self destructive, and very childish.

input: argumenta sobre: The entire Yautja species Predator vs. The entire Klingon species Star Trek An all out war between the Klingons and the Yautja. The war is considered won once one species is either completely wiped out, enslaved/imprisoned, or has their population reduced to less than 10,000. Only Movies and T.V. Shows are considered canon for this battle this includes both AVP movies. No video games/books/comics. The Klingons will not have help from the Federation or any other Star Trek species, but both them and the Yautja can trade for weapons/supplies is they want. Battle takes place in the Star Trek universe with the events of the Predator movies considered canon. Who wins?
output: - There is not much information about how big the Yautja Civilization is, how many space ships they have and how destructive they are in space combat. The few information indicate a rather small society measured in the millions of low billions tops, with more passive starships. - Depending on the timeline in this case the Dominion war the Klingons have around 1500 warships, each of them capable of FTL and equipped with force shields, energy weapons and projectiles guided torpedoes capable of terrible destruction on a city / continental scale. They are very experienced in large scale ground & space combat and have in the Star Trek universe a reputation as highly competent and aggressive warriors. In addition to that the Klingons have access to transporter and replicator technology usable for defensive, offensive and utility use. Both species have access to cloaking devices on their ships. butthe Klingons have build up an entire space infrastructure shipyards, outposts, sensor stations, multiple planets, mining stations etc to support their war effort with logistics. - The Yautja can use a faster FTL not sure how the opening sequence of AvP2 can translate to into hard data, otherwise it would be millions of light years in a matter of hours, vastly faster than any warp drive together with advanced wide-ranging sensors capable of scanning interstellar distances. - In ground fighting Klingons are usually superior compared to humans, but would loose to the Yautja, both in pure physical performance and typical loadout camouflage, sensors, energy weapons vs disruptors and bachlets together with conventional armour ... then again: orbital bombardment and transporter teleportation ... That goes probably to the Klingons quite easily, assuming that the Yautja is a smaller species without entire space fleets of warships or vastly superior space ships compared to Klingons warships. SYL

The movies are with their respective real life actors - Satan's Alley: unironic drama about medieval homosexuals, starring RDJ and Tobey - Scorcher: average action movie starring Ben Stiller - Scorchers 2-6: average action movie sequels starring Ben Stiller - The Fatties: A "comedy" starring Jack Black and more Jack Blacks - Simple Jack: unironic drama about the life of an autistic boy starring Ben Stiller R1: Which makes the most and least money in the box office R2: Which gets the highest and lowest rating from critics R3: Can any of them win an oscar
output: Satan's Alley would be controversial and may get people to see it, it won't be a blockbuster but depending on word of mouth it will achieve success either in awards or renown. Scorcher and Scorcher 2-6 mirrors how a blockbuster 1st installment of the movie made so much money that more and more sequels were made. I feel Scorcher 1 was a blockbuster and made a lot of money, probably 2-3 as well, but 4-6 would just be the studio trying to cash in on the popularity of the franchise. The Fatties, if it was the 90s it could have worked, not so sure about now since comedies tend to include a lot of nuances now and simpler premises with gross-out factors don't exactly break the box-office anymore. Simple Jack, following how the in-world reception was about the movie was panned because of Tugg Speedman's performance and the premise. === R1: Which makes the most and least money in the box office Scorcher 1 makes the most money, maybe even Scorcher 2. I don't know if Scorcher 6 would have been affected by franchise fatigue, if so Scorcher 6 may have made the least money but I feel Simple Jack would have made the worst performance in the box office. R2: Which gets the highest and lowest rating from critics Satan's Alley highest. The Fatties and Simple Jack may have been panned. R3: Can any of them win an Oscar Academy Award Satan's Alley, hands down. Simple Jack won't because you don't go full r------. Scorcher probably on effects.

input: argumenta sobre: How much of a threat would a man with ^5raise to the power of five stats be in real world if he wants to go on a rampage and destroy military? This man had base physical stats but one day all of his base physical statsexcept for body size including reaction speed, movement speed, swimming speed, strength, durability etc. are raised to the power of 5. He discovered his superpowers and want to go rogue and cause chaos around the world and destroy Chinese, Russian and U.S military can he be stopped?
output: "Raising his power to the fifth" means next to nothing when it's not easily quantified. If it's increasing his max measurements punching force, running speed, etc then sure, he'd be powerful, but without that exact quantification, it'd be tough to say. As a quick attempt on my break, here's some numbers I threw together: Lifting Strength: 150 lbs -> 75Ã—10^9 or 76 Billion lbs Punching Force: 120 lbs -> 25Ã—10^9 or 25 Billion lbs Sprinting Speed: 15 mph -> 760,000 mph or Mach 990 Reaction Time: 0.25 s -> 0.001 or 1 ms Durability is the real issue here since it's hard to give it a metric, but I'll break it into Structural Strength bone-breaking pressure: 1500 psi -> 7.6Ã—10^15 psi or 7.6 Quadrillion psi Penetrative Pressure skin-breaking pressure: 100 psi -> 10Ã—10^9 psi or 10 Billion psi So, with those vague estimates, here are some things he could do: - Lift 2% of all cars on earth simultaneously - Run around the earth in 2 seconds - Survive a mountain being dropped on them - From what I can tell, very likely bulletproof Funnily enough, their skin is their weak link, since their punch would almost certainly annihilate a lot of their skin and flash, but their bones would be intact. But yeah, they likely couldn't be killed by anything short of an ambush with a nuclear bomb or sufficiently large conventional explosion, given that their reaction time and speed are likely their greatest assets

input: argumenta sobre: "Zombie" apocalypse but it's dogs and cats Instead of ppl turning into dumbass corpses, infected ppl turn into dogs and cats all different types, including animals like wolves and lions. The dogs and cats will not turn on each other like actual zombies. Dogs and cats will act like their animal self other than mindlessly pursuing humans. If a dog infects, victim turns into a canine and if a cat infects, they turn into a cat. Infection is via bite, scratch or excessive licking. Current dogs and cats will spread transmission and are now "zombies" but tbf, they won't spread transmission until 72 hours after initial attacks. Patients zero is a cute puppy in NYC in Central Park at peak times and another in Beijing as a stray cat during peak times. Ppl turn within 10 mins from bites or scratches, but excessive licking can take 24 hours provided the dog/cat saliva does enter the body and just stays on the skin. Does humanity survive? Bonus: humans that turn into cats and dogs still have their human brain/mindset. They can choose to side with humans by not "infecting" others. They can also now speak their native language. All current/wild dogs and cats will still be animals and try and turn humans. Edit: the cats and dogs are NOT zombies. They're normal cats and dogs. They act like their normal animal self. That's why licking is a way of transmission because a dog or cat can be affectionate that way
output: Normal cat bites are a major threat with modern healthcare. Rabid dogs kill thousands of people every year. Dogs are also just lethal to smaller humans. If they were all zombified that's the end of human civilization as we know it.

output: Shermans. This isn't even close. Assuming an array of Shermans you have enough firepower between the American 75mm M5's, the 76mm M1 and the British 17-Pounder to destroy the Maus. input: argumenta sobre: Could Naruto use talk-no-jutsu to talk down iconic horror villains? Some of these will most likely be a hard 'no', but I'm curious nonetheless. If a character is absolutely no, then Naruto can pummel them as many times as needed for months on end to make the killer lose the will to continue. Round 1: Jason Voorhees. This is the character that brought me to this idea. Jason is a lot more tragic than other horror villains, and is seen sometimes showing, er, compassion? I don't know if that's the right word. He spares kids IIRC, people who look like his mum, and even let a boxer take his best shots at him. Round 2: Freddy Krueger. Now, this one is absolutely a hard no, but talk-no-jutsu is often used after Naruto beats the antagonist to a bloody pile, so could Naruto continue to beat on Freddy, torment him or bully him, to make Freddy chill out or lose his fear factor? For example, Freddy was weak after being forgotten as seen in Freddy v Jason. Round 3: Micheal Myers. Granted, I don't know much about this character, but he's popular so I factored him in. Round 4: Art the Clown. This one is an even harder no, but similar rules as with Freddy. Could Naruto defeat Art time after time for the clown to eventually say "fuck this" and give up?
output: 1- No. Deep down, Jason is a momma's boy, and he wants to do right by her. Which involves killing lots of people. Naruto won't even be able to pummel him into giving up; if dying and becoming undead won't stop Jason, nothing will. 2- No. Freddy's powers are tied to those who both know and fear him. Freddy's more likely to decide to haunt a village far, far from Naruto than to stop doing his thing. 3- No. Here's what his childhood psychologist had to say about a young Michael Meyers. >I met him, 15 years ago. I was told there was nothing left. No reason, no conscience, no understanding; even the most rudimentary sense of life or death, good or evil, right or wrong. I met this 6-year-old child with this blank, pale, emotionless face, and the blackest eyes; the devil's eyes. I spent 8 years trying to reach him, and then another 7 trying to keep him locked up because I realized what was living behind that boy's eyes was purely and simplyâ€¦ evil. And Michael Meyers has done nothing but proving the psychiatrist right. He only stops because Naruto has laid such a smackdown on Michael Meyers that his bones are liquified. 4- No. I don't think it's clear that art was at any point human. There's nothing for Naruto to talk to, and the best he can do physchally is likely make Art decide to torment people far from Naruto.

input: argumenta sobre: A man wake up in a world where humans didn't exist, and has a mission to go to mars and return?how much time would he take to complete this challenge. Basically the man don't age, is immune to diseases and when he dies he just Respawn in the same spot he came from
output: Assuming the man is also immune from going insane from his isolation and immortality, his best bet would be to find an already intelligent animal such as a chimpanzee and selectively breed them over thousands/millions of years to create a race of sapient beings that are capable of forming a civilisation that can build the technology and infrastructure necessary for a return trip to mars. It's impossible to predict how long it would take the man to selectively breed an intelligent race; the last common ancestor between humans and chimps lived 6-8 million years ago though which could provide a very very rough estimate. However once the man has successfully bred a species that has intelligence comparable to humans, the heavy lifting is done. As long as the man ensures that his fledging civilisation worship him as a religious figure / deity, which shouldn't be hard given his immortality, then he just needs to hang around for a few thousand years until the civilisation develops the necessary technology and infrastructure to send him to mars and back.

input: argumenta sobre: Average US soldier during WW2 right before they entered basic training at 5'9 144lbs or the average US male today at 5'9 200lbs The average US soldier during WW2 before basic training was 5'9 and 144lbs. The average US male today is 5'9 but 200lbs. The average US male today is the same height as the average US WW2 soldier but almost 40% heavier before they started boot camp. Who wins?
output: Lot of people here forgetting the fact that most Americans are fat. 42% of Americans are obese, and 74% are overweight. The average, 50th-percentile American is heavily overweight, borderline obese. It's not 200lbs of muscle. The average, 50th-percentile American does not exercise essentially at all.

input: argumenta sobre: These killers are locked inside a building, who's the last one standing? A bunch of these characters randomly wake up in an empty office building let's say 15 stories tall and the only way to escape is to be the last one standing. Each killer wakes up on a different floor and have to find the others. Everyone has their standard gear Things like guns aren't allowed. Ghostface Scream, can be any Ghostface Edit: only from film canon Joe Goldberg You / Netflix Norman Bates Psycho films Hannibal Lecter Films Dexter Morgan Dexter Josef Creep franchise Patrick Bateman American Psycho Leatherface The Texas Chainsaw Massacre 1974 Max Cady Martin Scorsese's Cape Fear Who wins?
output: First off, Norman Bates and Leatherface would be largely passive unless engaged by the others. Bates has a weakness for women, who excepting some Ghostfaces would not be present. Bates would just sit in their chair and not even bother trying to escape. Lecter, Bateman, or Ghostface have the charisma to use Leatherface as an attack dog to go after the others. Josef is not used to dealing with other psychopaths so his main dynamic of seducing innocents into his schemes wouldn't be effective. Max Cady is driven primarily by misogyny and revenge. Women are notably absent, as are any he has a direct beef with. He is prone towards violence but without his standard target pool he has nowhere in particular to vent his wrath. Anti-Semite Patrick Bateman would immediately hate the Jew Joe Goldberg, but his victims lack Goldberg's luck in killing serial killers. Goldberg, when faced with a serial killer invariably wins through luck and skill. Dexter has a similar knack. Ghostface's movie advantage of anonymity would be negated by everyone being a serial killer. Ghostface's stealth, durability, and strength would remain formidable. Hannibal Lecter is brilliant, manipulative and a skilled combatant. These two are individually the most formidable adversaries in terms of feats coupled with manipulation. Dexter and Joe would make strong allies given their shared altruistic bent towards serial killing. If they worked together they could be a match for any of the other combatants with the possible exception of Lecter. I would say the most likely survivor would be Lecter. He is the arch-predator. After that the Dexte team with Dexter having the stronger survival directive probably killing Joe, but could go either way. The third most likely scenario is Ghostface. The others have minimal chances due to their lack of experience in dealing with other serial killers.

Edit: If 20 is a stomp, reduce the number of 5th graders to 10.
output: Does the empty music classroom have chairs? I feel like Ali's chances go up if they have chairs. He can pick them up and throw them at kids and/or use them for crowd control if they are to remain planted where they stay.

input: argumenta sobre: U.A High School My Hero Academia VS. Camp Half-Blood Percy Jackson Okay so before you guys start debating I just wanted to clarify a few things: 1. This battle is using the most current versions of U.A Manga and Camp Half-Blood Books. U.A is as it is during the school year and Camp Half-Blood is as it is during Summer. 2. All combatants are current. 3. Celestial bronze and other enchanted metals from the Riordan-verse will affect the students and faculty of U.A. However, weapons made from the enchanted metals will not turn the Heroes to dust upon injuring them, nor will they rip out their souls, or absorb their essence. They'll act just like regular super strong, razor sharp weaponry. 4. All manga feats are allowed for the students and Faculty. 5. Only named students and Faculty with specified quirks are allowed in this fight. This is to prevent debaters from theorising about what potential quirks the students in 1-C,1-D, 1-E, 1-F, 1-G, 1-H, 1-I, 1-J and 1-K may possess. 6. Since children of the Greek gods share similar abilities any feat-less, unnamed campers get the abilities of their siblings. 7. Since the exact number of campers at Camp Half-Blood during Summer When it has it's largest population is unknown I had to make some assumptions when calculating Camp Half-blood's population. In the The Trials of Apollo: The Hidden Oracle, Lester mentions that there are 20 beds in the Apollo cabin. Assuming each one belongs to a camper then there are 20 Demigod children of Apollo at camp. If we are assuming that each cabin has the same number of beds and that each belongs to a camper and factoring in the 20 cabins in camp Due to the addition of 8 minor god cabins at the end of The Last Olympian, then there are 400 campers at Camp Half-Blood during summer. Unfortunely the Zeus, Poseidon, Hades, Hera and Artemis cabins are all empty. This means that we have to subtract 100 campers from our total. Now we are left with 300 Campers at Camp Half-Blood in summer. This actually lines up pretty well with the Books. In The Blood of Olympus it mentions that there were around 100 demigods at camp during the Roman's attack, 'A hundred demigods fanned out around her \Clarisse\ \...\' Page 429. Since this took place in August it's a safe bet that there are \100 campers at camp during summer. I am aware that I didn't factor in the fact that many of the Minor gods cabins barley have 5 demigods inhabiting them or the fact that The Dionysus cabin is also practically empty or that it has basically been confirmed that there are 30 Ares campers. This confirmation comes from the The Last Olympian when the Ares campers join the Battle of Manhattan '\â€¦\ And a dozen war chariots charged into battle. \â€¦\ A total of thirty fresh warriors, \â€¦\.' Page 272... This is just an estimation so take it with a grain of salt If there is another example of the books mentioning how many campers there are, please let me know. 8. In rounds where both sides are allowed prep time they do not have access to the materials of the enemy's universe. 9. Basic knowledge means that they know what each enemy looks like and a general idea of what their powers are. 10. In battles where the Faculty are allowed, Percy gets the Curse of Achilles on top of his current stats. &x200B; Which side do you think will win in the following scenarios? Round 1: Students VS. Campers: Every named student Big three students included vs Every Demigod Camper Nico, Thalia, Frank and Hazel included Battle takes place in a Paintball field. Random encounter. Standard battle gear. Morals on. Round 2: Students VS. Campers again, I know. Battle takes place on a beach on Long Island, New York. 1 day prep time anything goes. Both sides get basic knowledge of the appearances, capabilities and abilities of their opposition. Morals off. Round 3: All of U.A Faculty included VS. All of Camp Half-Blood All allies allowed excluding Camp Jupiter, the Amazons, any non-Greek Mythology factions and, you know, the gods. Battle takes place in the U.S.J. 1 weeks prep. All gear and equipment allowed. Morals on. Bonus round: Which side can invade the others base of operations with the greatest efficiency? R1: It's a surprise attack! Takes place in the middle of the day. R2: The opposition knows that the enemy is coming. They get a months prep as well as basic knowledge on their enemies. Anything I missed? Any ideas on how to make each round more fair? Let me know in the comments and I'll add it in.
output: For morals off it is worth noting that unlike the demigods MHA has clear limits. Mirio fro example is explicitly said to be shoot out when he tries to re-materialise in matter. There is no reason that won't happen if the matter also has a soul. No such limit has been given to Percy. 90% of human body is water. Shinso may be able to mind control but Percy can just control his mouth not to open instead. And All Might may be able to clear the clouds but can Deku dissipitate a hurricane being actively maintained. Nico's skeletons can only be stopped by another child of Hades. Greek fire can't be put out. The Argus III can bombard from up high while Jason calls down lightning bolts. That's not even counting the Mist which any veteran camper knows how to use. Apart from AOE attacks all other would just miss, that's if they aren't confused into attacking each other. Todoroki's ice is no-sell due to Percy. Bakugou's is canonically seen to need multiple explosions to put down someone without durability enhancements. Compared to demigods who are regularly thrown into walls and fight giants without any ill effects, only his biggest attacks matter. Many of the faculties quirks can be easily denied. Eraserhead is good against criminals but against trained warriors whose powers can't be nullified, capture tape isn't going to do much. Jason or Percy can easily blow away the sleeping gas of Midnight. I really feel people are too biased in favour of BNHA. Also I would say prep time favors the campers. The Athena cabin is equivalent to multiple intelligence enhancing quirks. Nedzu could even the field but campers have multiple people so they can bounce off ideas and find flaws better. &x200B; Edit : Did not say this before but also their fighting styles. The demigods fight to kill and have killed gods, monsters and humans before. Their fighting style has been optimised over centuries. and they are taught by Chiron who has thousands of students worth of experience to guide them in the best possible way. In BNHA they specifically do their best not to kill and that translates into their skills. Plus each has a comparatively unrefined, unique style.
